description:
Every time I think I'm too old to be frequenting dive bars, I'm reminded of the fact that I still love them so much. As I've gotten older, my bar-going days/nights have dropped significantly. The times of going 2 - 3 nights a week have long passed. But every now and then, I remember how much I loved doing it.

I was getting my car serviced in the area and came through to the Lucky a little after 11:00 am. The joint was empty so we had it to ourselves. We had our first round in the courtyard but it was a windy day, so it was the only one. The next few rounds occurred inside. The courtyard is awesome on warm, sunny days or warm nights.  As the day wore on it began to fill up, but there were plenty of open seats. There are plenty of TVs that have the games on and you can keep up with local teams.

I only intended to have a couple, but when you're with good buddies and they're buying, it would be rude to decline.

Lucky 13, you are my Batcave and Xavier Mansion.
author: Rich H.

description:
Wow! I'm impressed with the urban and divey bar here!

Skeletal bones are very suitable for Halloween!

Pool table and pinball machines available here!  Sports tv as well.  Class jukebox makes this a place worth checking out and chill!  

Cool.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Lucky 13 is one of those places that reminds you of the "days of ol" or "good ol days" in San Francisco. When I first moved here over a decade ago you'd be able to find places like this all over the city but, times have changed. Fortunately for us, Lucky 13 is still around and thriving.

In a recent visit I was reminded how much I love a great dive bar. My go to order is usually a boilermaker (shot and beer), so I ordered a shot of fernet and a miller high life. Yep, classy. The bartender was quick and poured a heavy dose of herbal elixir...props to her. 

All in all, if you're looking to check off an awesome dive bar in SF this is a must stop.
author: Benjamin F.

description: What a great find on Market. We're taking public transit to the South Bay today and this was a pit stop after riding the L from Taraval. This place has an excellent beer selection and a patio too. Extra points for the photo booth and friendly service. Cash only.
author: Angela T.

description:
Last stop on an impromptu crawl before heading to dinner. This was across the street from where we were shopping, so we decided to check it out on Saturday, September 16th around 6:45pm. Our party of four easily found a table against the wall, opposite the bar.

I believe everyone got a beer here. I probably got a Stella Artois as that is one of my go to beers. (Unless they have Blue Moon.) Judging from the pic I took and what I ordered all day, I'm pretty sure I got a Stella. (Can you tell I don't really drink beer? Or I had a little more to drink than I should have?) I didn't pay, so not sure of the pricing. They have a huge beer menu here, so I'm sure you can find anything your heart desires. Or at least something similar. The mood here is like a bustling dive bar. The lighting, very dark. 

Nice place to throw back a beer or two. Had no idea they had a patio outside. May have to come back to check that out. I love outdoor seating on a nice day!

Note: Lucky 13 is cash only. I do believe they have an ATM inside, just in case.
author: Elena N.

description: This place is genuinely wholesome. The bartenders have always been welcoming when I order from them. On a recent visit I lost my wallet in the patio area. Bars don't usually answer phone calls, especially on Saturday's, but lucky 13 did. Thankfully with the help of Emily (I think this was her name) and Noah, my wallet was found and held for me until I could pick it up the next day. They also offer free popcorn and sell tall cans of pbr. There's also a good community of regulars here. Lucky 13 has an excellent homey feel, and is definitely a staple SF neighborhood bar.
author: Corey L.

description:
Lucky 13 is a dive bar with a solid reputation among locals. It is very casual inside, complete with arcades, pin ball machines, and one pool table.

The great part of it is the cheap booze during happy hour that lasts until 8pm on a Friday and the outdoor seating.   The outside seating is dog-friendly and smoker friendly. If you have problems with either, it's better to stay inside.

I had a good time here with a group of seven people. There was a wide selection of beers. The beers that I tried were the death & taxes, fieldwork IPA, and something else similar to a Belgian that I can't remember the name of. Fieldwork is one of my favorites and it's great to support the local breweries. Happy hour was well worth it since I don't think I spent over 20$. The bartenders knew their beers and provided excellent service. 

Cash only as usual!
author: Jaime F.

description: Best punk rock dive bar west of Brooklyn. Hands down best jukebox & most of the bartenders are cool.
author: Scott F.

description: Great beer-and-a-shot type bar with the most amazing jukebox on the planet. Lots of punk, blues, glam rock, Rob Zombie, etc. The regulars and staff are very friendly and down to earth, the place looks as if a brawl is going to start but don't be fooled, as long as you have a friendly and down to earth attitude yourself you will be made to feel very welcome. Well-behaved doggos and free popcorn.
author: Nina L.

description:
Lucky 13 is a SF institution - go now before it is torn down. It's a dark, loud bar with a great rock jukebox.  There is a pool table, a photo booth, and some pinball.  Drinks are strong & cheap, and they have an impressive selection of beer on tap. Free popcorn, or order a pint of goldfish crackers for a $1.

Cash only, but there's an ATM in the back. There is also a side patio open during the day for smoking, chilling in the sun, and the occasional BBQ.
author: Rachel R.

description:
REVIEWER #647

YUP! I'M A FAN!!

Thank goodness to my colleague who introduced me to this dive bar! SF is like a maze...tons of hidden gems but you wouldn't know about them unless you spent your time walking around and exploring the area!

I came here for my first time on a Friday night and fell in love. It's a chill local bar but it's the people and the presence that make it a solid 4 stars! Yup it's dark once you walk in but it definitely helps set up a vibe of a nice drink and some relaxation! Listen up drinkers while I tell you the top reasons why I will be coming back to this bar:

* Calling all dog lovers!! This place is truly dog friendly! They even have an icon dog that sits by the door and patiently waits for your arrival. Don't forget to say hello upon walking in!

* I am like 60% sure that this bar is family owned but if it's definitely a good partnership. It's a lovely lady and nice gentleman that work the bar area. They are totally friendly and I had no problem receiving services from them although I was a newcomer. 

* Great outside patio area! Yes, the bar is dark at times but you don't to stay in that inside. They have a great outside patio where you can hang out, enjoy the nice breeze and meet new people! Check it out when you go!

* OKAY...This is the kicker....they have POPCORN!!! Yes, a popcorn maker in the dive bar, this blew my mind when I saw this! So I can have a lovely drink with some popcorn?! OmG! I was sold when I had seen this! 

* They have all the alcohol options you can imagine! Pick a drink and I promise they can make it!

Okay, so there you have it! Those are the reasons why you should come here. If you don't, that's fine as well because that means more popcorn for me! HAHA!

Have your next drink at the Lucky 13!

REVIEW 88/196
author: Porsche C.

description:
Stopped in here today with a friend for a mid-afternoon thirst-quenching. Friendly bartenders pointed out beer list above, bottles and on tap. Cash only. ATM in back. Bathroom up front (which I hear is an adventure). 

Bartender was nice enough to give me a complimentary refill on a pint of Lambic Cassis (black currant) to show me how my first, blended at his insistence with a lighter beer to balance out the sweetness, compared. He was right, the second, straight-up Lambic was uber-sweet, though tasty in small amounts. I was amused at his first blending offer because, channeling my dad, he said "Oh no, that is WAY too sweet. If you drink a whole pint, that'll ruin your dinner."

Walls covered in very cool, trippy posters. I laughed at the handwritten "NO GOOGLE GLASSES" sign above the bar. Dog also spotted on bar next to owner's beer. Dogs also wandered in who've seen it all and didn't really care if you petted them but half-heartedly sniffed your offered hand. 

Only caution I'd add is if you are sensitive to mold, stay the heck away from this place. The smell will hit you in the nose right when you walk in, and then settle in the back of your throat like a wet trout and then only slooooowly become less obvious the longer you stay and more alcohol you drink. Maybe they need a few dehumidifiers? 

Other than that, cheers to the quintessential dive bar!
author: Sarah J.

description: Absolutely love this dog friendly place! the bartender was really fast and efficient!! People are really kind here and it was extremely busy for a Thursday evening around 6pm.. nonetheless this would definitely be my go to bar if I'm out here again! p.s they don't sell food but your able yo bring in some of your own snacks! I would suggest nuts or maybe pretzels!!
author: Tawny V.

description:
Lucky 13 is a perfect dive bar.  I found this from yelp recommendations and am so glad I decided to check it out.  
Located right off the F-Market line, Lucky 13 is super easy to get to.  Walking in, the place is pretty dark but grab a beer (cash only) and head outside to the awesome patio.  The service I have had here has always been super friendly and unpretentious.  Outside there is plenty of seating, umbrellas if you want some shade, friendly patrons, and dog friendly! Lucky 13 has an amazing beer selection that is super affordable.  Also, full bar for any non-beer drinkers in your group.  Back by the pool table there is free popcorn and cheddar goldfish behind the bar to snack on.  If you want a little something more, you can bring in your own food (wholefoods/safeway is close by) and enjoy yourself all afternoon.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
This is a dark, cheap dive bar with good drinks and good music.  I got nostalgic listening to 80's hits (I'm giving away my age here), but I actually enjoy rock music from every decade.  What really was special about Lucky 13 was the POPCORN MACHINE. I don't even love popcorn that much, but after being out on the town for a while, I can't describe how good hot, fresh, buttery popcorn tastes.  

I see a bunch of reviews about bad service, but I have no complaints on that count and would encourage anyone avoiding the place for that reason to give it another chance.  It sounds like maybe one bartender left a bad impression.
author: Sheri W.

description:
We were early for a rez down the street Aatxe so my husband unit dragged me here to have a drink. True grit and totally entertaining. Plus I had the fear factor like something really bad could happen any minute. Walls and decorations are worth a drink all by themselves. Bartender (super nice macho type) out of a good indy movie--you can't make this stuff up.
I was able to smoke tobacco and dope at the same time by inhaling the fumes from the "backyard" that drifted through the bar. No charge! Don't miss it.
author: Chris V.

description: One of the last old school bars in San Francisco. Been coming here since the 90s. They have a good vibe, great draft selections, and no nonsense cocktails. It's cash only so not a lot of techies here trying to pay with ApplePay or with CC so that's a bonus for me and my friends. Pool table, pinball and some video game machines here along with the vibe makes this place a must stop for dive bar lovers. If you need a mixologist to spank mint or add coconut bitters to your cocktail, don't go here. They're not mixologist but bartenders. And, that's a good thing.
author: L D.

description: Always a good time at Lucky 13. Great atmosphere, fun people, yummy drinks. I always have a good time here.
author: Cherry W.

description: Longest bar in the city, still lucky to get a stool at the bar! Nice little patio that allows smoking. Voted best jukebox in the city!
author: Douglas A.

description:
Every time I'm in SF I have to come here. I've been coming here since my early 20s n every time I visit friends in SF we already know where we are going to...

Pool tables, smoking patio, photo booth, good beer, popcorn... A SF gem. Cheers to this place. A bunch of good memories had here and I can't wait to be back in November!
author: Tracey L.

description: Please. Best bar in the city. Pliney, pinball, patio, perfection. Do not pass go; do not collect $200. Great people behind and in front of the bar. Hope it stays around for as long as possible.
author: Matt J.

description:
From the reviews I read from this bar, I was very excited to try it. Upon arriving after hitting Brewcade, we were cold and wanting to be indoors. 

We passed by this bar and were intrigued by the atmosphere.. good drinks, great crowd... but the bouncer was incredibly rude to us. Saturday night 8:55 pm, we were greeted by a bouncer who asked for our IDs. We were gently pushed outside by the bouncer who asked us to be outside while he looked at our IDs. 

After getting my ID back, I walked in and was immediately yelled at for my lack of respect for him and this bar. "If you're rude to me, you'll be rude to the bartender," he yells amidst the crowd we were surrounded by. 

I'm taken back by the way he's yelling at me; I'm embarrassed by the volume of which he proceeded to increase with each minute I'm here. 

I was simply taking my ID back (because I'm shivering from the weather) and attempting to grab a few drinks. He insisted I was disrespectful by the way I retrieved by ID. I did not intend to be rude. I was eager to be indoors. I am just incredibly taken back by the way he handled the situation and question how he handles most customers. 

I ask the owners of this bar to be more aware of their workers and their behavior towards their paying customers. 

We walked a few doors down to Blackbird and was welcomed by the workers. Cheers to them. 

All I can say is that I'm very embarrassed by the way he acted and will be contacting management.
author: K L.

description:
Great beer selection at reasonable prices. The bartenders are cool and the atmosphere is chill. It's also dog friendly and I love that my house mate can bring his dog with us out for beers. Pinball tables and a pool table are available as are a couple of TVs for watching whatever sports might be live. Did I mention they have a killer jukebox? 
:)
author: Vic V.

description: What a great casual spot. Drinks are awesome. Staff is friendly. Lighting and decor is cool. You can actually have a conversation in that bar. Love the popcorn and tabasco and the pin ball machines! One of our favorite spot in the city.
author: Ian C.

description:
It's dark, they have erotic photo hunt, and serve Pliny The Younger. 

What's not to love?

I came to meet a group of friends and ended up spending 80% of my time there playing photo hunt with my girl and sipping Pliny in between pictures while ignoring the rest of the group. 

On a Saturday night it was easy to grab a seat around 8pm and you never had to wait more than 2 seconds for the bartender. 

A win in my book.
author: Candice G.

description: This used to be my favorite bar!!! I'm so sad I had the following bad experience ....Bartender currently working with long grey hair was extremely rude.  Was upset I ordered a margarita and began to pant and throw a tantrum.  The next person behind me saw my margarita and wanted one as well so she ordered one.  He then threw a fit and yelled "anybody else in line want a margarita? I'm not making these one at a time". I then confronted him and merely said, the bar was empty and if he didn't like doing he job he should quit and not take it out on the customers.  The two other people behind me chose to not order and leave the bar.  This was a very bad experience and will not come back here!
author: Miguel A.

description: This bar is a fucking gem! Awesome bartenders who play good music, amazing patio, killer jukebox, great drinks and no bullshit. It's a refreshing change from all the bourgeoise bullshit one has to deal with when getting a drink in SF these days.
author: S8adow M.

description: Service sucks. And the whole atmosphere here is very dark sided. It's kinda scary.
author: Olinsser F.

description: Impossible to get served. Even when quiet. Dead on a Saturday night and I sat at bar for 15 minutes looking for service while 2 bartenders ignored us all. Doorman was very amiable. A silver lining. Bartenders sucked ass.
author: ODHRAN M.

description:
I usually love this bar for the vibe but last night turned so bad I had to leave. So my friends and I were hanging out by the pool table where these girls were playing pool next to us. There was a big ol' pool of water or beer next to the table and one of the girls slipped and ate shit pretty hard. 

One of my guy friends works as a bar back at another bar and out of instinct went up and informed the tall blond bartender with pigtails that there was a big spill and someone fell and she replied "what do you want me to do? Clean it up?" And proceeded to be very rude to him and went over to the girls and began to harass them. 

She proceeded to tease her and bring out a nasty mop instead of dry towels to clean up the spill and said "This is only going to make it worse." And started saying that she's fallen in the bar all the time and never complained. Hun, it's your job and you should probably get some non slip shoes and learn how to clean up a spill. 

So the girl was in the corner facing the wall trying to hold back tears and this bartender kept coming back up to her and harassing her even though she never complained about the spill, it was my guy friend that was just trying to be nice. 

So we decided to leave and on the way out my girlfriend wanted to let her know it was really disrespectful and was given a lot of sass by the bartender and the short one with black short hair. 

I completely understand that as a dive bartender you have to be tough, but not tough enough that you make some girl cry for falling in public. At that point you're just being a bully. And in the words of Taylor Swift, "Why you gotta be so mean?"
author: Kristin W.

description:
if you'd like to experience San Francisco as it was when it was still cool, you will definitely not be disappointed here!  

Laura and Tobias are my favourites!

Pool table, pinball, popcorn, cash only, patio (depending on time of night), and sweet bikes in front.
author: Jane D.

description: What used to be one of my favorite dive bars about 4-5 years ago has really fallen to new lows. Knowing that they'll be shutting down soon means the service doesn't even try anymore. Even when it's not busy it's impossible to get a drink since the staff is too busy staring at their phones. It's a damn shame! I've been so heartbroken seeing dive bars disappear in the past (the most heartbreaking one that comes to mind is Attic Club) but this is one place that I'm glad is going to disappear.
author: Henry T.

description:
Came in with a group while empty and you'd think they'd appreciate the money coming in but NOPE. Bartender with the long grey hair was a complete dick to us. You having a bad day, not our fault. Paying customers, appreciate the customer dude. We got money to spend, we can spend it elsewhere. 
If I could I'd rate no stars.
author: Samantha P.

description:
Pinball pinball! 

Dive bar with awesome atmosphere and outdoor space. It's cash only- which blows but hey they have. An amazing beer list with an ATM next to the popcorn. 

Outdoor space was really nice and you can smoke there. I enjoyed all the games around the bar... Made highest score on attack on Mars pinball. BOOOM!
author: Amanda M.

description:
My girlfriend had booked a cheapo room online at "Twin Peaks Hotel" on what was described as upper Market. Upon getting there, we discovered we were staying at the corner of Castro & Market - an entirely different demographic than we were expecting!

After some good laughs, we checked in for our overnight stay (an experience to be covered in another Yelp review, hahaha). After attending a friend's birthday party near Buena Vista park (incidentally, very walkable from this location for active folks) we just weren't ready to call it a night, so we started Yelping.

Under "dive bars," the Lucky 13 showed up less than a block from us -- score!!

We weren't sure what to expect when we walked inside - Would the music stop as we entered; thick-necked, tattooed bikers glaring menacingly - nope, as it turns out, Lucky 13 is no Chalmun's Cantina. On on the other hand, ya won't need a intergalactic spaceship to get here, and you're not likely to get dissected by a light saber, either. 

Looking around, there was the requisite long bar, lusty barmaid, band stage, popcorn machine and dusty memorabilia everywhere. and (of course?!) a boob book (if you don't know what this is, neither did I pre-visit). Eclectic crowd was having a lively, loud time. We quickly "bellied up" and got our drink orders in. 

Startled to find Pliny the Elder pints on tap for $5, I grinned at my "Lucky 13" good fortune, and went to the nearest table to ask someone to take our picture.  Turning around, I watched with amusement as an inebriate slurred pick-up lines at my sweetie.

Havent tried the bar food here, but we had a great time, met some nice people and were totally amused by the drunk "regular".
author: John H.

description:
I love this bar. I'd say this place is one of the best beer bars in San Francisco. 

-great beer selection at good prices
-free popcorn in the back
-nice outdoor patio
author: Robert F.

description: Any place that Mark C. says is good, is good in my book too.
author: Emma H.

description: This place is a little rough around the edges, but I'm fine with it. The beer selection is incredible. They have a couple pinball machines, located in the back on a cool elevated loft area, though when we last attempted to play one of the machines was severely in need of maintenance. The popcorn machine is a nice touch! My only small complaint is that the crowd as well as the bar in general can be a bit grungy at times.
author: Alex E.

description:
We were walking by post-brunch and decided to duck in for a quick beer.  

I ordered a Lambic (raspberry) and my friend ordered a Pliny. D'oh! I jumped the gun--I did not realize they had Pliny on tap, or else that would have been the clear choice. No matter, I drank half of my friend's, obviously. 

We got into a bit of a tiff as to whether this bar is a punk bar or a metal bar. I argued the position that it's a punk bar, as it's decorated with Misfits posters and old tattoo art. At the end of the day, who really cares? Not me. 

You know why I don't care? Because both of those beers together cost ONLY TEN DOLLARS. What?! When was the last time you got two quality beers like that in San Francisco for ONLY TEN DOLLARS? I'm going to guess probably never. I usually pay $6-10 for shite beers. I was so excited, I nearly did a cartwheel. I also spilled half of my beer--but at that price, I could afford to! 

The patio is pretty bitchin. On a nice day in the city, it's a hells yes. 

The service is quick and dirty, just the way you know you like it. 

The crowd is eclectic, but refreshingly so. 

This is a cash only production friends, so be prepared. 

You know what it is.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Good people, good bartenders, good music, good beers.

No exposed concrete, Edison bulbs, or reclaimed wood though, so you'll have to hunt for basic bitches elsewhere.
author: Kevin O.

description: This is the first place I go when I get to San Francisco. I love it!
author: Chris S.

description:
I met my husband here. We made out while drinking Pabst Blue Ribbon. 7 years later, 3 years of marrige, 2 dogs, one kid and 6 moves later we are still lovin' strong. 
So, if you're looking for the one, here is where I found mine. 
Happy Anniversary!
author: Autumn R.

description:
Cash only.  Bathroom is in the front of the bar, not the back or upstairs.

Total dive bar which means super cheap drinks.  Gin/tonic and titos/ tonic = $11

Can't complain.
author: Angelica C.

description:
Had a great time here! Every bay area beer nerd who isn't that uptight needs to roll down here. Great selection of beers at reasonable prices. Had a Dogfish head 90 and....well a few others that I can't remember. 

Basically if you took Zeitgeist, put it in a better neighborhood, took the asshole bartenders outside and executed them - and then replaced them with friendly, helpful bartenders - you'd have Lucky 13!
author: Kevin D.

description: Cheap dive bar which is sorely needed in this crazy expensive city!  Prices are affordable, microbrewery beer for $4, yes please. Bathroom was cleaner than most. I like it and if you don't, keep driving !
author: Aag R.

description: Went here on Sunday afternoon. Its definitely a dive bar. Sticky snd smells slightly of vomit, BUT this is a dog friendly bar. Once I got over the stick and the smell, I realized the people were great, the bar tender was friendly and all the dogs were so cute sitting on little bar stools. It definitely grew on me after a little bit and I had a great time.
author: Midori H.

description:
Free popcorn and cheddar gold fish? Yes, please.
Comfortable CASH ONLY dive bar with a choice beer selection.
Punk, metal, sometimes ska tunes.
Plus they've got a pool table, pinball, a photo booth AND an outdoor patio?

There is one female bartender whose service sucks.
Other than that, Lucky 13 hits the nail on the head.
author: True S.

description: Your normal hole in the wall bar with pinball of course. The games were on the second level, however, they are $1.00 per game. I figured out why no one was playing. The beer (draft) did not taste the greatest. I ordered it because most people were drinking draft and I thought it would be fine. We stayed for one and left. Well I left half of my beer behind too...... Maybe another time and probably bottles only. The bathroom, holy crap! DON'T bother! They were disgusting, stunk terribly and I think I might have caught something while in there. HA HA! I literally held my breath while in there. Do yourself a favor, do not visit the bathroom. I would expect this inside experience though from a place like that. I would probably visit again though, hahaha! Dive bars are great sometimes!
author: Big D.

description:
LUcky 13 deserves all the stars it can get. 
Everyone I know loves this place. 
This is a great meeting place. 
This place has a way to be the symbolic of drink an be merry .
Great happy hour spot, great cheap drinks an very stiff
author: Luke S.

description:
GREAT bar all the homies meet up it's very nice - HOWEVER, tonight we went in (80 yr old capital A hole door guy took muhfuckin' FOREVER to let us in) got beers had two sips went outside to say what's up to some friends - on the way in had some shit about our ID's tried to explain we had beers waiting - talked HELLA shit to bae and so I stood there listening to the whole thing and snatched my ID back from the capital A - chased us in the bar and we got kicked out because of that. 

PAID FOR EFFING BEERS - took 2 sips and now we cannot finish - bad look on the bar get rid of his old incompetent ass.
author: Hana G.

description: Great dive bar. Extensive draft selection with lots of variety and reasonable prices. Especially liked the back patio area on a sunny day.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Just five years ago my time spent in a photobooth would have been debaucherous, scandalous, and the picture would have never been able to see the light of day (okay, I lie - apparently just being drunk and licking your friend's face isn't considered really scandalous, plus the picture is up on facebook). 

But now I'm a responsible(ish) "adult," and so when Keane and I headed into the photobooth we asked each other how to pose. "How about a serious one, then a funny one, then a serious one, then a funny one." Maybe too many flavor blasted goldfish and PBR tall boys made us sleepy and content. I may as well move to Florida now and wait to die, is this what adulthood is like?!

Anyway, the pictures are adorable, very awkward looking (well, just me. Keane is the Barney Stinson of SF), and a nice reminder of my ability to grow up and not invade everyone's personal space.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Great choice of beer at cheap price. This include belgian beer like "mort subite aux framboise" on draft! Pretty incredible to find that here in my book.

This is a favorite hangout of my SF friends and a visit here made me understand why!
author: Stéphanie S.

description:
This is the epitome of a great alternative / punk / dive bar. 

1) CD Jukebox that is expertly curated ( Think, Punk / Johnny Cash /) 
2) Free Popcorn
3) Plenty of Seating with a romantic balcony above the bar.
author: Colleen T.

description:
Fa Fa finally I've found a bar in SF that feels like a gritty punk bar of the LES. 

This place is rad. 

Huge bar, with a great patio, blaring music, pool table in the back, popcorn machine, and really good fucking beer.

The beers on draft are on par with a microbrewery but dis ain't chyo hipster bar. So handle bar mustache bros please keep on walking.
author: Ryley P.

description: This place is awesome. Yes there is a distinct smell when you walk in. But within a matter of minutes the smell dissipates...You no longer smell the smell...the smell smells you. Cheers!
author: J C.

description:
Love Lucky 13. Personally have never had any bad experiences here.
You can toke it up out on the patio. They're dog friendly.
They have a varied beer selection. Enjoy Pliney, La Fin, Duvel, etc.

And free popcorn and/or goldfish? Come on! :)
author: Lauren L.

description: My favorite bar in SF. Killer jukebox, cheap drinks. Bartender was a total sweet heart with a great attitude. Really enjoyed my night. Bought a shirt and threw it on the next day. If you love rockabilly, punk and car culture, this place is a must.
author: Bobby H.

description: Love this place! Great vibe, good beer, friendly staff, good music, affordable. Also dog friendly which is always a plus!
author: Sara S.

description: Great dive bar with the sweet dirty vibe I love.  Cheap drinks and cool bartenders I love this bar
author: Americo P.

description:
Cash Only Dive Bar located just before the Castro District in SF. 

Old Rock n Roll feel with that Local Vibe everyone seems to be looking for but not will to put themselves out there. 

Love this spot. 

I think Hipsters finally found a place where they feel uncomfortable...
author: Matthew M.

description: This place is divetastic! My favorite SF dive bar. Great beer selection, passable bourbon selection (if the owner(s), is reading this get in the Elijah Craig or Eagle Rare bourbons please. Take out the Basil Hayden if you need space that brand is all marketing). Nice patio area, pool table, jukebox. And not so loud that you can't have a conversation. Cash only which is fine by me - I bank with Sterling next door - so ATMs very available. I'll be back...
author: Michael L.

description:
Definitely my favorite punk rock dive bar in the city --  though don't let that description sway you, all types of people frequent this spot. Bartenders are super chill and serve drinks quickly, everything is reasonably priced, and they always have my favorite IPA, Racer 5, on draft.

Other things I love about Lucky 13, in no particular order:
- Outdoor deck area is great on sunny afternoons
- Free popcorn
- Lots of bar games: football, pool, pacman, pinball, nudie photo hunt
- Great jukebox selection
- Photobooth

This place will always have a soft spot in my heart because it's the first bar I visited when I moved to San Francisco eight years ago. The bartender let us buy a couple of unopened PBRs, which my buddy and I drank while walking towards the Seward Street Slides. Thanks for the great night Lucky 13!
author: Madhu P.

description:
An amazing biker dive bar that has no business whatsoever being a block up from the Castro.  It's consistently full of weirdos - be prepared to accept an invitation to an R&B concert in some guy's basement, then feel vaguely threatened by the guy outside with the crazy eyes smoking three cigarettes at once.  The bartenders here have heavy hands, and they pour drinks that are impossible to sip without wincing.  Your eyes will water, you will look like a bitch, and you will only pay $5 for the privilege.  

Like all dive bars, it's loud, dark, and the floor is sticky.  The music is aggressive, the decorations are tacky, and the popcorn is stale.  It's a dive bar made by real men for real men.  Finally, it's dog friendly, which automatically makes it my favorite bar in the entire world
author: Kevin C.

description: Thought this would be a good dive to check out for some cheap drinks and low key atmosphere.  Walked in to find a dark black and red bar with Misfits posters on the walls.  Prices were good and the beer selection was impressive.  Although it wasn't an issue for me, the "cash only" situation is pretty annoying these days.  Finding the Men's bathroom proved to be difficult as well.  Even with the giant "Mens" written down the wall, trust me, it's not where you would expect it to be.  We sat and watched others walk to the back and look all around hoping that one of them would be more intelligent than we were and we could piggy back on their success.  No such luck, eventually the bartender walked by and we asked.  He pointed out our stupidity which turned out to be the writing on the wall.
author: Scotty C.

description:
I dig it.  Not every bar is going to coddle you and hold your hair back while you barf.  Lucky 13 certainly won't.   Here are some guidelines to help you decide whether this is your kind of place.

You probably won't like Lucky 13:

If you shop at Banana Republic and/or it's ilk
If you love bright airy spaces 
If you have to have everything spotless
You have never had any adversity/tragedy in your entire life
You play tennis or squash
You expect there to be a sommelier behind the bar
You know what a sommelier is
You don't know who Lemmy is

This is just a short list, but it should help some people make the right decision.
author: Daniel W.

description: Went for Pliny the younger, it was insane with everyone else there for the same thing. The keg was tapped at 5 and was probably out by 5:20, glasses were running out and people were practically asking to drink out the palm of there hands just to get a taste.
author: Sugi s.

description:
Friendships - like plants - need to be tended and cultivated. It's too easy in our fast paced world to lose touch with people and get swept up in work and our own lives.

Lucky 13 magically seems to be that place that my friends have decided is "the meet-up spot"  - when we want to re-water our friendships. When friends are back in town visiting from grad school or such - Lucky 13 is the spot that we come to kick back and learn what each other has been up to as of late. With its vast - narrow stretching back section, upper level, free popcorn, friendly bar staff, and San Francisco edge  - Lucky 13 has a distinct charm.

The lighting is sometimes a little too dim for me on a nice San Francisco day, and I don't always dig the music on the juke-box, but I always have a good time here.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Good beer, good music, outdoor patio and 2 cool balconies. Pool, foozball, pinball and popcorn. Great dive bar. Solid bartenders and very nice. A place to frequent.
author: Zara S.

description: One of my favorite haunts in SF. Nice staff and a classic dive bar! Cool decor as well.
author: Sirdrewbrew ..

description: Cheap drinks but kinda stinks. Be prepared to hold ur noes. Only except cash. 4 beers under 20.
author: Trinidad E.

description:
This place is really cool. Everyone that goes here is real chill and know SF like any native would. Came here for the World Series games and the place did not get packed to the point that people are shoulder to shoulder. The place is huge with a patio outside with benches. This place is super divey and is kind of dark but that's no nevermind to me.
       There's a pool table and popcorn machine and is shared with the patrons. The people there are a little older but there are also people that are younger no doubt. This place has a good comfortable-giving vibe. No doubt I'll keep coming here. Can't forget to mention their beer selection is vast and you can't go wrong with any of them. Especially in my case, they have all of my favorite IPAs to keep me there all night!
author: Maria B.

description: i was visiting the city for new years eve & got recommended this bar by a friend who used to live here. me and my guy friend showed up about 20 minutes before midnight. we took a few shots at the bar and then took beers up stairs for the countdown. this place was perfect, i loved the decor & music, the crowd seemed all around really chill & the bar tenders were very cool. best of all this place & that night will always have a special place in my heart because at midnight my new year kiss turned into finally making things official with my dude  :) my boyfriend & i will definitely return to this bar any time we are back in SF! 5 stars hands down.
author: Kelci L.

description:
Never settle for charming, pretty, fussy business class warrior style .

  Instead go for that cheap spectacle bar which makes all who enter a virtual equal...

Cheers
author: Margaret M.

description:
The Lucky 13 is hands down one of the best bars in San Francisco. This is the place to get a cheap strong drink. Happy hour is from 5-8 and is $1 off all draft beers and 50 cents off well drinks. Most beers are usually $4-5 but they have pbr for $2 and a few more expensive micro brews also. Pool is free on sunday nights and they also have a PB&J (pabst and a jameson/jager) for only $6!! 
Also on the 1st sunday of every month they have bike night, and an awesome Dj named motorcycle molly and on the 2nd and 4th sundays they have the vinyl hayride which is outlaw country music night (also really fun).
Overall this is a great bar with friendly staff and cheap drinks, Worth checking out.
author: Noah T.

description:
If I could give this place less than one star, I would.  It was one of the first places that I visited after moving to SF, two years ago. I always had a decent time, and rep'd it to my friends and strangers visiting the city.

Tonight, I took my girlfriend and my new roommate for the first time, and it was awful. At 1:30 (just after we'd ordered our first beer) they told us that everyone needed to "[expletive delted] leave, now!" There were no fights or other altercations. It was simply weird, and rude. They came to our table, and started cussing at us, with no negative responses form us. Mind you -- we had only ONE drink before arriving at this bar, and were very sober. 

As we left, I asked if I could finish my beer, and use the restroom. I was told this was okay, but that I still needed to "get the [expletive deleted] out, with everyone else!" This was fine, for the most part; aside from the super rude service... and we tipped pretty well.

As I approached the restroom, a man intercepted me and tried to grab the beer in my hand. I asked him if everything was okay, and he told me to, "get the [expletive deleted] out." I told him I was just trying to use the restroom, and it was 1:30; everything was alright. He then grabbed the beer can (still half full) and crush it in my hands. I told him this was battery (having nearly three years of legal education). He told me, "NO, it's not; get the [expletive deleted] out our bar!" Again, I asked him what was wrong, and why we couldn't just handle this like adults. Nobody, let alone myself was causing harm.

Ultimately, they even followed us outside and cursed and basically talked s-it. 

I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone else. I'm a combat veteran, and third year law student... even with that and being SUPER nice, I've never been treated with such disrespect in my life. That's saying a lot. 

These people do not deserve ANYONE's business. I don't care what their excuses are, there is NO reason to treat any patron this way.  

This place really does deserve to be shut down.
author: Erik C.

description:
Great bar with a solid beer selection and close proximity to transit. Pretty divey, but if that's your style you'll dig the dark red walls, great music, and decor. 

They have free popcorn and a pint glass of goldfish crackers for $1. Sometimes you need a little snack to keep down all that Franziskaner and whiskey. 

Bottom line: I'll likely be back for the solid drinks, tunes, and snacks.  Definitely a dive done right.
author: Kellie T.

description:
Don't advertise a free bbq when your grill doesn't work...epic disappointment

Weather was great and crowd was cool.  Good prices and cider beer on Draft was nice.

I might come back if they fix the grill...The outdoor patio was nice.
author: Wesley W.

description: This bar is alright. It's pretty inexpensive. I got a midori sour for maybe about 5 dollars or 6? Shots were decently priced here. About 5 dollars each? I'll always have good memories of this place. Plus they have a photobooth! Which is all graffiti-ed up, but it really adds character to the photo. However, there can be some shady people there. Like I remember this older gentleman took my friends' hands and mine and kept inviting us to his soul food bingo. A bit strange. He was totally a solicitor, but in the moment I thought it was funny. I'd totally come back here. It's quite affordable and drinks are simple and good.
author: Julie L.

description:
Dive BAR?  Try DOG Bar bring your pup!  well behaved hopefully... or banished to the outdoor patio you are... hehehe
Umm more beer than budwieser.
author: Adam O.

description:
Former staff were complete SCUM OF THE EARTH.

A patron was verbally degraded by their bartender because he wasn't "dressed to depress" and then physically assaulted by the same bartender after he took offense to being insulted by this low-life jerk. Wish I could name that clown.

I couldn't believe my eyes. Horrible display of humanity.

Hard to get past that, I hope they've cleaned up.

Doubt I will ever go back.
author: Daniel Aka Translation X.

description:
Maybe it's cause I'm not a local...

My girls and I came for happyhour because I wanted to by my friend her first birthday drink! I'm a beer kinda girl so I enjoyed the wide selection of beer while I ordered the girl a simple Framboise. 

Nobody told me that this dive-bar smelled kinda like pee and was unmistakeably musty. We stepped outside to drink but behold, the tables were sticky and smokers were out too. We then proceeded to the 2nd story loft to overlook the bar which was a little better. 

The bartender was super friendly though :) Maybe we just got bad luck and came at the wrong time...
author: Mary C.

description:
Dive for me dive for you.

Quality: PBR's can't be measured, but the Bloody's can. They were good.
Value: depends on your taste, something for everyone.
Location: For the locals
Atmosphere: Punk rock, dark, roomy.
Service: Fast and fair
Outside smoke and drink: Yes
Extras: Popcorn

My experience: Fun gathering with friends here. In a city like this, this place is necessary.
author: Steve L.

description:
The depressing decor is full of cheap and tacky decorations. The restrooms were unkept and soiled with urine, a cockroach was scurrying along the dampened napkins outside of the photo booth. 
This place is a dump, a breeding nest for bacteria, rodents, and a spot where people with beer goggles find desperate one night stands. I had to abstain from using the pool table because of the rat feces I saw stuck on the carpet. If you don't have any standards for aesthetics, manners, ambience,  come to Lucky 13, a place where you can treat your body like a dumpster and die of an early death. If you think your standards are high, come here and satirically surround yourself with crass people until you frequent this establishment so often you eventually forget why or how you got here in the first place.
author: Antona B.

description: Sadly there's fewer sweet bars like this which serve strong beers at fine prices with enough room to sit. Anyways, compared to the bars in the area (between the Mission and Lower Haight) Lucky 13 is probably my favorite.
author: Misha T.

description:
I was here twice last month while on holidays and like it. 
The good points include: 
-Really nice looking spacious pub
-Well laid out. THe different mezzanine floors help to make this a different kind of pub each time you go
- Some very good mixes on the juke box. 
-A plethora of beers/ales etc to choose from, & all of them reasonably priced. Local & international. 
- a really long bar
-Friendly staff
-Clean bathroom
-Free popcorn
-Pool Table etc.

The con:
- The nights we went were both really really quiet so i couldn't get a feel for the vibe (& i suspect we were not the only tourists in there). I saw no metallers or punks at all (much less bikers). We were there on a Thursday & a Tuesday. Now i don't expect any bar to be full on Tuesday. In my experience it is the dullest day in any pub in any land, so i will excuse that.


I must say though that this hardly the pubs fault . I will have to come back another time & visit on a Friday or Saturday to see it in full glory because i have no doubt that this pub could be good with a crowd
author: Aileen M.

description:
This place is big for a San Francisco bar. Not only is there ample seating actually AT the bar. there are plenty of side tables,  a little split level with more seating, and a patio area for the smokers (you know you guys KILL to be able to smoke and drink at the same time) with picnic tables and side bench seating. There are SO many options.  

Prices are great.  A Belvee and tonic, along with a dirty martini = $14.  Yeah, baby.  And the waitress was so cute with her red pigtails.  My second drink was a strong Cosmo and, in a move I've never seen before, she missed the pour between the cocktail shaker and the glass!  Which resulted in a comp'd drink (for which I tipped her heavy) and actually a better Cosmo because she had to compensate for what she estimated was spilled.

Yum.

You want liquor?  This is the place to come to.  Quick and dirty.  No fancy bar tricks, "Mixologists" or attitude like you're unworthy to be asking for alcohol and wasting the bartender's time with your yuppiness.  Know what you want and order it - they have other shit to do.

Between the drinks, the seating, and pigtails, what could have been an average Wednesday night turned into a fantastically drunk time out with a good friend.

FYI: Dogs allowed!
author: Tamar D.

description:
Cool bar, nice layout, good selection of beers. 

The bartenders were all very cool, and they have a nice selection of drinks including some very good beer imports. A pool table, a juke box, and plenty of seating.. the place is a fun little spot. About $7 for a bottled import and around $4 for domestic, it's what you expect to pay for good libations. 

They also serve root beer on tap, which is one of my favorite things to mix with a shot of Jagermeister.. a "Jageroo" my friends call it.. the bartender says it was a new one for her.. but its a standard favorite of mine when root beer on draft is around. Stop in for a drink!
author: Ric H.

description:
This is my first review and lucky 13 is one of my favorite bars but some asshole they employed there instructed me to post a review:
This bar is cool but they hire some strange hairy little fellows that kick you out 5 minutes after selling you a drink.     Not recommended after 1am.
author: Stephen R.

description:
Oh Lucky 13, you are such a solid dive. Conveniently located on Market and Church, it's an easy spot to meet up with friends before a show at Café DeNord or before dinner, so many good restaurants in this area. 

I've been here several times, I usually order the same thing, my  Absolute Vodka & Rockstar. However they have great beers on tap. Several I've never heard of, but eager to try. Lucky has never steered me wrong, therefore I need to add this to my favorite dives in San Francisco.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Probably  the last real bar in the Upper Market area - divey, crusty, and punk rock. Killer selection of micro and macro brews.

Bring cash because they don't take credit cardS
author: Bumble B.

description: Great drinks awesome selection. The bartenders are really cool. One of the best jukeboxes I've ever seen. The patrons can be assholes tho. Most of them are quiet and keep to themselves. Some feel like they own the place tell ppl what to do. Not cute.
author: nancy w.

description:
Dark, grungy atmosphere with a bit of rock 'n roll.

The vibe is very relaxed overall, especially for Castro, but it's hard for me to feel passionate about Lucky 13. Drinks are strong and cheap, but not especially well-made. The space is huge, but was only about half full the Saturday night I was here. Meh.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Love this place - king of the dives along Market Street, amongst many fufu bars and restaurants. Mind you 'fufu' is not a word I use lightly -because i like that stuff ....sometimes. but that is NOT Lucky 13.

It's like a deep dark cavern when you walk in - graffitti everywhere, huge bar w/ a VAST list of beers on tap and in the bottle. Lot's of seats at the bar, a cute dog at the front of the bar - at least one. And there are high tables with bar stools seperate, a small upstairs, a pool table and a small smokin patio. 

This place ROCKS. I would even call it a rock and roll bar - always good rock on the jukebox playing. 

Cheap drinks, Drink Specials - a lot of fun colorful people. If you like the dive - this place is for you. Oh yeah, delicious Iced Teas too.
author: Rew C.

description:
The bartender was ignoring me for ten minutes while girl after girl walked up after me and ordered drinks.  When he finally decided to take my order, with an eyeroll, he took his sweet time getting the drinks.  I paid, and didn't tip.

He yelled "HEY, where you come from?"  I told him "New York".  He said "In New York, do they believe in TIPPING??"  I said "Yes, when they don't give you attitude and ignore you...A tip IS earned, you know."

He jumped over the bar and swiped the drinks out of my hand like an expert, and put them behind the bar, giving me my money back.

Then he told me "Fuck off Faggot".

This was several years ago...and I addressed this with the manager.  But why the hell should this happen in the CASTRO of all places?  Not sure if this douchebag still works there, but he can go sit on a rusty dildo if he's reading this.

Won't ever go back, and I dis-recommend it to anyone who suggests it.
author: Scott L.

description: Been coming here weekly for 5+ years for the awesome bottled beer selection and great jukebox. The new bald bartender ignores people that aren't his buddies, lets the bar sit in complete silence until you put money into the jukebox and then turns it off, and pours weak drinks (except for himself and buddies - then it's long pours of Jameson on the house). The bar now closes at 1:25am according to him. But it really closes at 1:10am when he turns off the jukebox *again* and plays crap country music while he staggers out to smoke. I love this place but that douchebag is ruining the vibe.
author: T T.

description: Met up with a handful of old school yelpers here for drinks during a lazy Sunday. Kind of divey, kind of not. Looks dive but the clientele span regulars to dressed ups looking for a quick drink. Dig the Misfits posters and music they sport. Lots of good beers on tap and even a root beer. Outside patio area for the good days. Certainly a bar for almost anyone as the people watching is fascinating and they rep all ages, sizes, ethnicity, and drinking styles.
author: Kim N.

description: I don't know! I'd like this bar more if I was less sober.  Pool tables bumps this place to a 3'ish starfish...
author: Michael D.

description:
Looks can be deceiving - and perhaps that's what kept me out of here for so long - or not.

But I'm glad Blackbird was recently packed on a weeknight, so I could wander over.

Drinks that don't require (nor accept) credit cards, an enclosed patio, pool table, ATM, upstairs seating for stealing away into a dark corner, ample selection of brews on tap, two cocktails for the price of one elsewhere, a classic Ms. PacMan table.

The essentials.

I'll be back. And I'm bringing friends.
author: Alissa A.

description: I was intimidated just walking into this place from the outside.  It looks like entering a small warehouse and I expected to be glared at and cursed out by regulars.  Good thing these expectations didn't hold up.  Certainly a dive, no question about it.  But clean enough, and quiet enough, and friendly.  The one bar tender working the very large room, covered in tats and holding down the motorcycle bar vibe couldn't have been nicer.  And couldn't have been quicker.  The beer list...mmmmm... what a beer list.  A ton of local crafts on tap.  20+ drafts in total.  $4 Pliny the Elder's during happy hour.  Really great prices.  Cash only.
author: Dan C.

description: It's a cool rock n roll bar.  The energy is good and the company I am with is usually good.  Bartenders are friendly and well cool.  I like it here.
author: Liz D.

description:
This is probably the best dive in The City. 

All the stupid marina chicks and dudes who come here looking for a dive, will give it 1 star. You know why?  BECAUSE THIS IS A TRUE DIVE BAR!!!  BRING CASH! DON'T ASK FOR DRINK SUGGESTIONS. THE BARTENDERS ARE SURLY!! 

This isn't some place to go for novelty. It's a dive bar that's run like a dive bar. Not a ride at Disneyland you self-possessed morons. If a bartender asks for an ID, GIVE IT TO HIM. Don't give him attitude. As people have found out, that get you absolutely nowhere.

All that said... if you want to go to an awesome dive, then go to Luckys. I've been going there for 7 years and never once had a bad experience. If you're looking for a dive bar to see what it's like "on the other side of the tracks" then fucking stay in the Marina. Luckys doesn't want you there anyway and sure as hell doesn't need your business.
author: Scott L.

description: Dark, dank, books, booze, lots of different areas to mingle, decent prices. No complaints here!
author: Cecilia A.

description:
I had never seen so many dogs in a bar. Went on a Sunday night and it was perfect because the place wasn't too crowded and I could really soak in the atmosphere, which is dive-y, complete with permanently sticky floors. 

But it has free popcorn so I'll definitely be back.
author: Emily D.

description: Jukebox is tight.  I once heard a Youth of Today song emanating from it.  Tried to locate the song for future reference but no dice.  Probably due to all the Pliny's I ingested.
author: Floyd B.

description:
Lucky 13 is one of the best bars in SF. They are cash only. The have the best jukebox! The bartenders know their shit and don't want their time wasted. Which is exactly how it should be.

As a customer I don't want my time wasted waiting for the dip-shit transplant trying to figure out what beer or skinny bitch cocktail they want. Don't come to Lucky 13 in your Princess pants thinking your shit don't stink. Be ready to order and go sit down. 

Yes, they will card you, and yes you better have your IDs ready along with all your friends. It's a bar. SF does pop in checks and yes no bar wants to get fined because your dumbass doesn't have an ID. Get over it! Are you new to the bar scene???  

Don't think you're special, you're just another face in the crowd. They are working their asses off, and don't have time to hold your hand. If you've ever bartended before you know it's not an easy job. You have to deal with multiple personalities and attitudes. When that special douchbag, and princess-party-pants comes in and cannot figure out what the hell to get it's annoying for ALL PARTIES! Step back read the drink menu then order your drink.

Fucking think. You're not the only person in the bar.
author: Stacey D.

description:
I was very excited to drink at this bar. I'd passed it a few times but was never able to venture in, til a Sat night. It was decorated awesomely and had a great feel to it. I was very happy with everything until I ordered my drink.

I don't go out drinking in extreme, so I usually ask the bartender what drinks they recommend. I like trying new stuff. So I asked the bartender what she'd recommend, and I was immediately met with resistance and one hell of an attitude. She threw out some drink names that didn't even remotely sound like I'd been looking for (I'd had those drinks before). Her attitude and rudeness was appalling, and, I suppose to get back at me for being indecisive and taking up her precious schmoozing time, she made my drink very weak.

I was hoping to stay there the rest of the night and invest money in the business and really make this bar my go-to bar that I rant and rave about, but this experience has really turned me away from it. I'll never go back to that bar, and I would never recommend it as a place to go.
author: Autumn D.

description:
A solid, and solidly large dive bar in the Castro. 

I prevailed upon my barkeep for beery recommendations for an out of town friend. The selection was wide, and the barkeep quite knowledgeable. She had a lot of recommendations, all of which were spot-on. This was a boon to the evening, and a great detriment to the following morning. 

My tall, single companion was immediately beset up on by suitors the instant my back was turned. This normal for a dive, but slightly less expected in the Castro.
author: Rob R.

description:
Ok I am a fan of dive bars, so my review maybe skewed, but I love this bar. Cheap good craft beer, stiff drinks, great juke box, and as dive-y as they get. A combination of beer, sweat and debauchery. the kind of place for me! Whenever I am in town, I make sure I go here. It is a little piece of dive bar heaven. 
be advised...the service staff is amazing at their job, but on the surly side, which again adds to the general vibe of the place. Some people can't really handle it I suppose.
author: Justin P.

description:
After leaving the Blackbird bar, I popped in here last night.  Suddenly, the prices here seemed like a bargain!  The Lucky 13 bar is not for everyone...it is dark, dingy, and a little edgy, yet so imminently satisfying as a dive.  The bar is really long and I always enjoy looking at the old rock posters on the wall which I think fit the place well.  All kinds of crazy things behind the bar on the shelves and hanging on the wall.  The pool table is pretty decent too although one of the bumpers is really dead.  Still very playable and the cues aren't too bad.

There is a serve-yourself popcorn maker there at the far end of the bar near the pool table.  Holy movie butter, Batman!  The popcorn was the super unhealthy, mega movie butter version.  I know movie butter versions, but this one was crazy, impregnated with butter (dry, not drizzled).  It went with the drinks so well and was so bad that it was good...so truly good!  It really fit the theme of the place too.  

Took another look at the mermaid paint in the bathroom stall.  It's actually more of a stencil than a line drawing like I originally mentioned.  Not only that, but it looks like someone has been painting and defacing it so it's not that special anymore.  Tried to take a picture, but my phone doesn't have a flash so it was way too dark.  

Not too many places like this in San Francisco...I could totally picture Jim Morrison or maybe the characters from the film Fear & Loathing in Las Vegas drinking in here.  Yeah, they should film an SF version...Fear & Loathing in San Francisco!  This place would definitely be a must.

Years ago, I used to be known for my fun "around the world in one night dates", barhopping around (via taxi) from the most upscale of places down to the craziest of dives.  So many bars, so many different worlds to see and enjoy together in just one night.  If I were to do that today, this would definitely be one of the memorable stops along the way.

Like other Yelpers have said...dive rock bar!
author: Roy N.

description:
Lucky 13. Is fun place, but bartenders are deplorable. 
Especially the manager Martin. ...

All bartenders are preferential who they serve. 

My being Latino I get less better service than my white friends. So in order to to get drink fast; I have my white pal get it.

One star...
author: Mike L.

description:
Hadn't stopped in Lucky 13 in many years.  We were tooling around the city and saw they had a free bbq on Saturday.  Sweet!

We walked in a saw a grill loaded with brats and other sausages, burgers, and dogs.  I'm a big brat-lover but was disappointed the grill guy said those were "private" and that it was just the dogs and (cheap patties) burgers that were available.

Kind of a bummer, but oh well!  I grabbed a dog and we had a few rounds of draft while watching the game.  Great beer selection and plenty of seating.

And of course, they are still rocking the punk/rock-a-billy music.  Decent place to stop in ever 10 years or so.
author: Jeff M.

description: Great service :), Went in there just to have a simple beer and the bar keep is nice, good taste in music, love the art inside the joint , can't wait to go again :)
author: Natalie M.

description:
The rogue hetero island in the gay sea of the Castro. I love this place precisely because it is what so many of the other bars in this area are not: relaxed! You will not find house music or plunging v-necks here. 

Just solid, laid-back dive bar vibes, cheap drinks, and free popcorn. There is also pinball, pac-man, and a Photo Booth for your entertainment. A great place to kick off a night in the Castro. There's also a smoking patio out back (open till 10) if that's your thing.
author: David P.

description:
Quick service, good selection of drinks and just the right amount of diveyness (if thats even a word)
Even when its busy it's not like you have to wait long to get a drink and there always seems to be space to you and your friends somewhere in there.
The doorguy was a little annoying by asking my friends a bunch of questions like "can you put your finger to your nose and spin one time?" she did thinking that he was testing her drunkness even though we hadn't started drinking yet and then went on to talk about if she was left handed she turn one way and if she was right handed she'd turn another way. The whole time this is happening the line is just getting bigger and bigger while everyone in line including myself is just trying to cut out the bad jokes this doorguy had and get in already.
I understand you get bored sitting at the door all night but could you chitchat when there isn't a long line at the door please?
author: Cescilia A.

description:
5-star beer selection - great Belgians and ales, with tons of micro and craft-brew selections. 

4-star space - dive bar meets rock posters meets filthy bathrooms.

5-star bartender - he knows how to pour a beer, for sure.

1-star cash-only situation - seriously. Just charge me $2 or $3 per transaction and let me use my card. This is the most expensive city in America outside of NYC. 

Overall, I enjoyed the style of the place enough, but the majority of the 4 solid stars on this review come from the amazing beer selection (Plint the Elder? Oh yes). I'd hesitate to return due to the cash-only situation though.
author: Don B.

description:
Here it goes. 

This is a dive bar with beer cheap enough for the homeless. I'm not breaking the bank getting a double stacked PBR ($3.50). Usually I'm in on a Tuesday or Wednesday night. Sometimes there are a few good looking girls but it's hard to tell with the cheap beer and the dark lighting. But the good part is that people leave you alone in this joint, that is if you want to be left alone. If you don't then you can mingle with the other down and outs and halfway attractive individuals. 

I love this place because an asshole like me can visit and not feel the need to pretty up. Or if I do doll myself up I can at least not feel like an out of place asshole either. 

I will say the service is good, I get my beers at the bar and when I'm ready for more I don't have to stand around looking like an asshole standing around waiting for a beer. 

Another thought, there's a damn fine Juke box with old school Punk and some rebel rock playing. It's only a buck for 3 songs and if you hear a little Social D playing then you know I'm there. 


Stay cheap.
author: lester h.

description:
13 is my special number.  My name has exactly 13 letters in it.  I was borne on a 13.  So come Thursday last, I definitely got lucky at this bar.

Chaos ensued.  You see, sometimes I believe that I'm ta'veren at parties.  Things just happen around me, with me usually in the center of said trouble.  Then I sit back and watch the chaos enfold around me.  It's not a talent; I wouldn't really boast about it.  It just happens.  Tried and true over the years since college.

The bar is quaint.  I love that they have so many different types of old school geek games for you to indulge your senses (and coins), while also sporting a nice pool table in the back.  There's something for everyone here.

Granted, if I ever return, the stars will not align so perfectly as it did last week.  But I'll be wishing on a star for you to meet me there.  Then the magick will begin all over again.
author: Lorrayne L.

description:
A perfect example of what a dive bar should be, except their beer selection is far superior to most of the dives I've been to.

The place is really big, with plenty of room outside and inside to gather with a large party.  They have some pinball machines upstairs, a pool table downstairs and decent music playing.

Their beer selection was awesome with something for everyone.  They even had Russian River's Pliney on draught - yum!
author: Jaci H.

description:
The Lucky 13 was added to my list as Dive Bar to check out during our trip to SF..after partaking in our strip club tour we came to the Lucky 13 for a drank or two..Score one for them having ice cold PBR, short and tall cans, backed with one hell of a Patron shot..the bartender was helpful in pointing out places nearby to get some grub as we were starving.. 

I was surprised at the size of the place, the length of the bar, etc..we visited during the mid afternoon hours and are looking forward to returning during the evening.. 

Will definitely remain on our list of places to hang at and drop a dime in the near future..
author: David S. Y.

description:
Brought my friend who flew in from Chicago here. We were warmly accepted here despite not being leather-bound and pierced like we assumed the crowd would be. We ended up calling our bar-hopping night on account of awesome and ended up staying until close. If you ever need a reprieve from the typical Casto scene, ie. a breath of heterosexual air, this is close by and welcoming. I'll be back for sure.

The old-as-dirt guy who's a regular there is a riot. He looks like Ted Nugent's Grandpa. Can't miss him.
author: Pete F.

description:
This place kind of felt like Alex's bar in Long Beach to me because it was all red and dark and divey. But, they had really odd creepy photos on the wall so the similarities were only a little superficial. It's a cash only spot with a house dog and expensive photobooth which really made me sad. There's nothing like getting pumped up about getting in a booth to take some photos only to realize there's no way you're spending that much on instant gratification.

If I were in the area I may go back or I may not. Oh all right, the drinks are poured strong enough that I probably would go back. But, I'd still be begrudging about the photobooth.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Great divey-type bar on Market with a small patio with plenty of seating and suitable for smoking.  Staff was friendly enough and they have a decent selection of beers (from Pabst Blue Ribbon to Dog Fish Head) and a full bar.
Close to just about everything in the area, its a great place to grab a drink before a show at the Swedish-American Music Hall.
author: Tracee E.

description: Good selection of beer. There is a popcorn machine! And and pool table, fairly standard dive bar. i like the fact that it was moderately busy midday on a weekday, made for a nice atmosphere.
author: Manuel A.

description:
Totally my kind of bar. Seriously if you need someone to go have a beer with and you want to go here call me up and I'll be there. 

Huge space, plenty of seating, awesome jukebox, games to play, fab decor, GREAT beer selection, and free popcorn. Totally chill atmosphere with people that were being themselves - no fake ass "look at me, look at me" annoying people, a huge + in my book.

While I was relaxing with my pint of Pliny the Elder (yay) one guy came up to play patty-cake with me and two others bought me a beer because my foot is in a cast and they felt bad for me - hell yes! I love random nice bar patrons.

The bartenders were also nice, prompt, and very attentive plus I got a great pic with Arthur who exclaimed he was a dirty pervert before he laid a big ole kiss on me - it made my night.

Lucky 13 fulfilled my need for peace, love, and good booze for sure ~ chase
author: Chase S.

description:
Great bar with a good beer selection. A great outdoor seating area, and two really cool balcony's for people watching. No dive would be complete without a pool table. This bar has a great basement vibe.

The bartenders are wonderfully viking-ish, and usually very friendly. I always am greeted with a smile.

Enjoy.
author: John C.

description: What's not to like, it's Divey with good music and a nice patio to hang out on.  Every time I come here I feel like I meet random people and can just hang out and join in on drunken conversation.  They also have lots games and decent pool table.  The best is good cheap drinks and bartenders who are pretty chill (usually way too many douche bar tenders at most Dives)
author: Nirea S.

description: I genuinely upset about this bar. Once I entered, I was under the impression that it was a chill atmosphere. They gave out free popcorn, there was a foosball table, and pool. It was fun! Drinks were fairly cheap compared to other bars in the city. However, when it was about 1:30 the people there rudely told us to, and I quote "Hurry up and get out!" I was appalled by this. I have never experienced such rude service. Also when my friend and I were buying drinks a really rude bar tender decided to take my twenty and use it to pay for both of our drinks, when we were paying separately. When I confronted her about it she rudely told me "You never told me you wanted to pay separately! Just have her pay you back" It was not that big of a deal, but she had the worst attitude about the situation. Overall I was disappointed and I don't think I will be going there again.
author: Ashley V.

description:
We found this bar on Yelp mobile app while walking back up Market St. to our friends' place just above the Castro. What sold me on this as a good place to take a break was the fact that this bar (like several other businesses in the area) is dog friendly. Seeing as how we'd left our dog at home this trip, we wanted to see some puppies, and we were not disappointed!

It is a dive, but in the middle of the afternoon on a weekday, it's pretty chill and approachable. Nice bartender, Belgians and locals on tap, and popcorn, if you want it. The decor is pretty dark and a little heavy metal/goth, and the music was a bit loud, but not metal (pretty good eclectic mix, actually), and the house dog was entertaining as he chased his ball around. We also met several local dogs, including some regulars who know just where to go to be served treats at the bar. Sometimes local dives make outsiders feel unwelcome. We never experienced that in this one.
author: Gina E.

description:
Love, love love this place. Dive bar with a great patio (about 4 picnic tables' worth). I've been on weeknights and it's fun, if a little busy, and the bartenders are great. On Saturday afternoons during the summer, they grill dogs and burgers and give them out for free. Drinks are reasonably priced and it's a really great low-key spot for groups, so long as you don't want anything too fancy.

Pro tip: bathroom is up front near the door, not in the back (I walked allllll the way back there just to walk alllll the way back while the regulars - and their dogs - chuckled at me.)
author: Rachael K.

description:
I came here on a Thursday, 11am with some friends, not expecting much but the Bartender was SO incredibly friendly, nice, and seemed pretty knowledgeable about all the beers that they had available.  He gave us a taste of the raspberry beer from Germany(???), and some other unique beers.  

Basically this rating is for the bar tender! PROPS!
author: Liz W.

description: I'm going to give a really good description of this bartender because I want the owner to know exactly who I'm talking about. The bartender, who was approximately early 50's, long gray hair, and skinny, was completely rude and had a horrible attitude. It's been years since I walked into The Lucky 13, and it used to be  great, but this particular bartender ruined the experience for me and my friend to the point that we walked out. I had asked for a sample of the Steigle, and the bartender said no, that he had been there since 9am and he was behind in his work and didn't have time. Okay, it was 6:30pm and there were about 12 people in the bar, it was pretty dead. While my Freind and I stood there in amazement of this guys complaining about his job, we decided that any establishment that has someone do more complaining then show good customer service doesn't deserve our money. Doesn't he know bartenders survive on tips? This piece of work obviously needs to find work elsewhere and stop scaring away the customers. I really hope the owner reconsiders their employees.
author: Kris B.

description: Huge dive bar with room to breathe (even if it's stinky sometimes).
author: Sonya Z.

description: Cheap drinks. Fun atmosphere. Even popcorn, if you so choose to dabble. There is not a single type of person you COULDN'T meet there.
author: Rachel O.

description:
So last night a few friends and I went to have a few drinks at this place, here is my review...

The night started pretty well, we had a few chimay's and triple karmelite. We had a few beers and grabbed some food from next door which was delivered to us in the bar. After a few drinks my friend was not feeling well and he was escorted out by one of the "security" goons. When outside, the goon came out and tried to pull my friends back in to the place, we took our friend and kept walking. At that point the security guard got aggressive and with out notice or cause what so ever he shoved one of us to the ground, he did this twice. To my knowledge, a licensed security guard can not put a hand on you if there is no reason to do so. The cops were of no help at all either. This place o be honest is ok, but they need to think twice about who they hire for security.
author: Francisco V.

description: love this place come with friends as a designated driver i don't dtrink love the goth,punk,altertive cleintell plus they serve food sometimes im a fan
author: Leigh G.

description: This is the best bar within a 2 mile radius of itself. Laura is the sweetest, coolest bartender on earth. And they have beers and an awesome juke box. Nuff said.
author: Mitch G.

description:
One of the best known dive bars in San Francisco with an impressive beer selection, both on draft and in bottles. I don't expect to be drinking Russian River beers at a dive.

Its big, loud, with an array of different people and dogs, they are very dog friendly. Also conveniently located on market and church. 

Beware it gets crowded.
author: Erin S.

description:
This place is awesome,

Considering the high amount of bicycle riders in San Francisco, this place has very few. I base any SF review on simple math.

The Less cyclists.
The More stars.

Plain and simple.

No Coors original, but the bar tender was actually cool about talking to me about why he don't stock it. Oppose to doing the usual San Trancisco deal and throwing down the "Eww who drinks that?" line.
author: Sam W.

description:
I really dig this place. It is in the Castro, but hosts a very mixed crowd. There is an outdoor smoking patio, an upstairs with foosball, pool table, several beers on tap-but let's face it, FREE popcorn is the shizit! 

I like it here.
author: Kat M.

description: Cheap beer with good selection. Red walls, Red lighting, Red devil decorations. Cool loft areas inside, nice patio outside. Music is too loud to chat. I found the lighting and music annoying.
author: Brian L.

description:
I arrived at 8 p.m. on a  Friday.  It was so packed, I had a tough time making my way over to "the gang".  I was literally tippy-toe side-stepping.  I took a deep breath and talked myself out of having a claustrophobia attack.  

I found a small spot on one of the tables to un-load my baked goods and made my way to the bar.  I asked for a "Crucifix" and got a really weird look from the bartender.  I instructed:  Raspberry iambic with Guinness. I technically had no idea but someone had told me that's what it was.  He nodded and brought me back a delicious pint of raspberry accented stout.

I grabbed a buddy and on our hunt for the naked lady photo hunt game, we somehow ended up - upstairs.  There's a really cool little area up there that had much more breathing room and pin-ball machines.  I saw the machine I suspected of having the nudey picture game, it was obstructed by what seemed to be a regular.  I asked him, "Does this have other games on it?"  He smiled and replied, "There are tons of games on here" and began to pull up a menu.  I deviously peeped out, "Naked lady games?"  He grinned again and immediately pulled it up for us.  There were already credits in the machine.  We played a few rounds (so fun) and made sure to pay it forward with the credits.

A tamale lady rolled through and another buddy and I formed our own game - "community tamale".  It started with a couple of chuckles of how many people were eating out of one particular tamale on the table.  The final tally came about 2 hours later when one last person dug in.  I saw it, yelled over to my buddy across the table, pointed at culprit #8 and smiled.

I never tried the popcorn due to a rumored fable involving already chewed gum.  It was enough to give me the gag-reflex upon any thought of diving into a bowl.  

The busy nature of this place was a bit much for me.  However, they can't help it if they are popular - right?  Due to the full capacity, a beer was knocked off of a table. The staff came out and cleaned it up right away.
