I know for sure that I want to come back on a Wednesday because I hear that is when the stripper pole On the Bar is utilized.
author: Jenn N.

description:
I like this place a lot.  It has a great selection of beer on tap, and as far as I know, you can get cocktails and whatever too.  Also, the jukebox is terrific, there's a lot of space inside, there's free popcorn, and there's a little patio out back.

Its not all that convenient to me most of the time though, so I don't stop by here very often.  

Some might refer to this type of bar as a dive, but I don't see it that way.  It is located right in the middle of one of the most crowded nightlife districts in the Bay Area.  It's usually pretty crowded, and always is on weekend evenings.  It has energy and vitality between those red, candle-lit walls.

Still, it has a certain grimy ambiance to it that generally gets watered down to "dive bar" by certain people who don't really appreciate the difference between a place like Lucky 13, which thrives on craft beer and younger, music-oriented patrons, and a sparsely attended place that serves $2 beers out of plastic cups to a mostly older clientele - a true dive bar.  

The decor is punk rock themed, and the bathrooms are characteristically messy.  

At one point in time, this would have been my go-to destination for weekend drinks with friends, but these days I have quite a few friends that probably wouldn't really fit in here or appreciate the peculiar charms of a place like this.  

That being said, I would bring people here if I thought they had a leather jacket in their wardrobe or a Ramones album in their music collection.   

If they had a Gun Club album, I would probably even buy the first round....
author: Gopal R.

description:
Undisputed best bar in neighborhood and certainly top 10 in city.  Was able to stop by on a Friday afternoon and drink Pliny for $4 a pint.  Repeat: $4 a pint!!!!  Me and three friends killed the keg 3 hours later.  
They even allow you to smoke outside with the other eccentric clientele.  
Good music, good beer selection, free popcorn, no nonsense bar, and never a dull moment there.
author: Siu C.

description: Free BBQ on Saturdays! Both hamburgers and hot dogs. Delicious when it's matched with a good ol chimay or boddingtons. Awesome selection of beer for around $4-7 a pint. Great deal and great atmosphere. A little scary walking in the door but the beer and BBQ are worth it.
author: Sarah S.

description:
My go-to place in this neighborhood

- Very wide selection of beers.  If I show up already drunk, I stand, stunned, in front of the enormous beer lists, unable to make a decision.  (The bartenders don't love this).
- Sufficiently grimy / punky / dive-y to keep away girls who think designer purses and stiletto sandals are appropriate bar attire.  They peek in, and do an about-face.
- Good jukebox!  
- Free popcorn!
- Tiny but wonderful little patio in the back, open when the weather is nice.
author: Heidi M.

description:
It's been 2 years since i've been here (*tear*), but wanted to review them anyway because they're just awesome!

I am completely, utterly, without a doubt in LOVE with this place! 

My 3 friends and I walked in and felt a little out of place, just because it was about 3 in the afternoon (hey! Happy hour starts at 4, mmk!) and it was all regulars there. However, that quickly changed. $9 for a super cold Heinekin and the most delicious Bloody mary EVER, in life. Seriously, you gotta try one. The green beans are to die for and I even ate all 3 big fat olives. 

K - so after we all got a beer (HUGE selection btw), we headed out to the patio where there was a super friendly cook flippin' cheeseburgers and hot dogs. It felt like we walked into a friends backyard bbq. It was so awesome! We got our burgers w/ all the fixings + potatoe salad + chocolate chip cookies and devoured it all! There's several picnic tables out there - dont be afraid to make friends. People welcomed us easily.

Happy Hour 4pm-8pm. $3 for Heinekin and Newcastles (and all other tap beers). The FREE bbq is delicious, there's free help-yourself popcorn, and everyone is pretty friendly. Oh and for sure hit up the photo booth on your way out.

Dont forget to bring a sharpie so you can autograph the bathroom walls. 

Bottom line - dont let the darkness and locals scare you off. This bar KICKS ASS and has quickly become one of my favorites.
author: Jessica B.

description: Great place to hang out with friends! Def going back! My friends had a great time. Drinks were good, clean environment and most definitely friendly staff bartender!
author: Mary S.

description:
Walking in off of Market Street, Lucky 13 is a world of its own.

A dive bar with a red glow, long bar and some high chairs & tables, upstairs balcony with more seating, back patio, free salty-buttered popcorn, a good selection of beer and hard liquor, and games - pool, foosball, and two pinball machines.

Canine-friendly.
author: Cathy K.

description: This is the chillest bar I've been to yet in SF, and the first place I've actually considered coming to regularly. Goldfish! Popcorn! Outdoor seating! What more could you want?
author: Eliza D.

description: What can I say I love my dive bars but this one in particular exceeds basically any one out there! Laura is my favorite San Francisco bartender. She's friendly, fun, and can kick a guys rump out if need be. Oh, and if you're nice you get free goldfish. If you visit San Francisco, I highly recommend visiting Lucky 13 and giving Laura some company!
author: Amber D.

description: love this place! friendly bartenders, great beer and great prices. when can i go back???
author: Tera K.

description: I love me a good dive bar and this place more than delivers. You know you're at a good dive bar when that funky odor immediately hits you upon entering the establishment. Anyways, this bar totally reminds me of Cinebar in San Jose. I love the whole red and black color theme going on and the epic decorations. Strong cheap drinks and an interesting crowd. Bonus for the popcorn machine with the free popcorn!
author: Cristal C.

description:
Never had a bad time here.  It's a little too small for a fri- sat night.  So, I liked to come here on occasion on off nights.  

Pretty good atmosphere, music, and drinks at normal prices.
author: Brad K.

description:
I had every intention of going home early on Friday night.  For reals- it's on the talk threads.  But then I started watching the Red Sox (it took awhile, but they put it on for me), drinking "Root Beer Floats" and then it went downhill.  

Well not really, I managed to mostly behave myself.  You gotta admit, I am NOT boring.  

When we were here for the model crawl, I didn't really get a chance to scope this place out.  Coming here sober and sitting by myself while I waited for everyone else to get their lazy asses there gave me a chance to look around.  Granted, I STILL don't remember much, but I like it.  I like how there's an upstairs.  I like how there is a photobooth, even though I didn't try it.  I like how I managed to go potty in both the boys' and girls' bathrooms.  I like the back patio.  I like...Lucky 13.  

Did I feel lucky, punk?  Sure.
author: Pam S.

description:
Can't go wrong with PB&J special.
Lots of room.  Very LONG bar, nice and high, good if you like to stand up at the bar (as I do.)
Multi level seating areas give it a funky allure.
Pool table in back, some sort of video poker machine, but alas, no darts.
Bartenders and patrons all quite friendly.  Came on that recommendation, and found it to be true.
author: Ken B.

description:
Mick F. set up a little welcome to town soiree for me, the coolest thing I could have asked for in San Francisco short of all this fresh air and great food, making for healthier lungs and instant weight loss without feeling hungry.

And yet, amidst all this beauty and fancyfuck bars, there was Lucky 13.  The other half of "everything I ever wanted" - stale, dark, awesomely loud music and cheap drinks.  And a photobooth.  Mick was skeptical, but I enjoy some divey bars.  Had a great time in the balcony with several old and new friends.

I think I proved I belonged there when a woman I hadn't seen for many years, who grew up near my childhood home in Lincoln Park walked in (roommate to Suzanne B., who I met for the first time that night!).  What are the chances?  Great times...thanks again, sir.
author: Ellen M.

description: Great rock n' roll / dive bar. Free popcorn. The elusive, and delicious, Pliny the Elder on tap. A few tvs that usually have some sports on. This is the land of my people.
author: Nick D.

description:
$2 PBR's......AND all the yummy goldfish you can eat?...psshhhh....no brainer!

I like the decor, I like the barstaff (blonde, pigtails, pours a goodie).
It also has a little spot outback if you wanna grab a bit of smokey fresh air.

Good crowd, no drama, good jukebox, EXCELLENT selection of brews....I like it, I like it alot
author: Michael E.

description:
Overall, a good place to hang out with friends before 9pm. After 9, the place gets too packed. 

Pros: 
* Cheap beer
* Free popcorn
* Lots of seating
* Relaxed vibe

Caveat:
* Waiters can be slow at service and sometimes unfriendly (been there 5 times and its been mixed experiences)
* For a relaxed environment, the music's can be too loud at night to have a conversation.
* Menu can be difficult to read
author: Aakash D.

description:
This probably is my favorite bar in SF and, growing up here, believe me, I've been to them ALL, starting at age 15. Oh, skip that last part. 

The bartenders here are totally cool and rockingly talented and they really do have an awesome beer & cider selection. When we go out, I'm usually the "designated driver" and Lucky 13 makes a WAY TASTY Virgin Mary that is tangy, spicy, and refreshing!  

The crowd here is  casual, mixed, and, thankfully, people pretty much stick to themselves and leave you alone. Add to that, any bar that is dog friendly in the Bay Area is a definite winner in my book!
author: Richard T.

description:
Fantastically tasty Bloody Mary. Didn't see a pre-made bloody mary mix around. With the two pints that I had... I think I eclipsed my vegetable intake for a week. Nice kick with the horseradish... tasty olives, and quite possibly the best tasting pickled green beans I've ever had in a bar. Period.

Bottomless self-service popcorn... again, added to my excess vegetable intake for the week. Tasty.
author: Victor C.

description:
A great bar for those who love beer and don't want a fancy drink. An incredible selection of beer on tap and more in bottles--all at pretty cheap prices. And for those of you, like me, who know nothing about beer, the bartender is very friendly and will help you out. He recommended me a Frambois mixed with Blue Moon--you get the Blue Moon flavor with a hint of raspberry, but not as sweet or strong as the Frambois alone (9.5%). 

The decor is a little intimidating at first glance--think dark, permanently Halloween themed, makes me feel like I need a tattoo to fit in, but it's a great place. I asked the bartender about the collection of black cats everywhere and he told me you used to get a free drink for bringing one in. 

They are also dog-friendly and will allow you to bring outside food. With that, the jukebox, photobooth, free goldfish to tide us over until our Ike's sandwiches were ready, great service, and all those beers, I'd frequent this place a lot if I lived in the city.
author: Yang Q.

description:
Awesome bar.  Amazing beer selection for beer lovers (best in the Castro perhaps).  Tons of quality double and single malt scotches to choose from.   Cool staff, nice dark and creepy Halloween style decor.  Lots of black cat things.  If you wear a lot of black you will feel very comfortable here.

It's not a bar that is all fancy and polished with top notch bathrooms.  It's just an awesome place on the edge of the Castro for straight folks to get drunk and laugh with friends.    It is certainly gay friendly, but this is more of a straight folks hangout.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Lucky 13 is my kind of place!

My hometown is sorely missing a bar like this!

Things I dug:

- Friendly bartender
- Misfits/High on Fire/Other kick ass bands' memorabilia plastered on the wall
- Cheap drinks
- Good music
- Lit by candles
- Overall vibe of 'badassery'

Things I didn't dig:
*shrugs*
author: Estevan D.

description:
I dragged my drunk friend Tom to the 13 to sober up.

Why Nick would you bring a drunk to a bar to sober up? Well Lucky 13 is a little different. You can go in and chill out a bit because it's dank and dark. Tom was also getting a bit whiny in the cab and he is easier to listen to when I have a beer.

So this is a dive bar. It's a good dive that is comfy and cheap. I like a nice beer and quiet along with people not bothering you. When I want those things Lucky 13 is a place to go. 

Solid vibe, kinda clean, usually has people in it, and good prices on beers. I like Tom complain a bit while I knocked back a few. After a while I was drunker, he was more sober, and we were a bit more evenly matched. Tally-ho! Into the night we go to cause a ruckus!
author: Nick B.

description: Not sure how I always find myself here but the free popcorn definitely helps, the bathroom smell that welcomes me does not. My new favorite drink is the "roho" (rojo?) which is Hoegaarden and Lindemans Framboise Lambic. The beer cuts the sweetness of the lambic. Pliny the Elder on tap and happy hour until 8.
author: Mimi L.

description:
In a city populated by bars (and dive bars most of all) this one retains a four-star sense of originality and personality. 

It's dark, it's loud, tons of beer to choose from though, pool table, photo booth (where you get two strips of your shots for $5), red and black interior, free popcorn, couple of balconies, and an outdoor patio. 

Overall it's pretty cool, on my B-list of places to hit on a week/end night meetup with friends. In one of my fav parts of town (Upper Market), near some good sushi joints, a Squat and Gobble, the Mint Karaoke, and more sushi, on the edge of Eureka area, pizza, and more.
author: Kelly S.

description: I love dive bars. No frills fun. Pool table where I always win (100%, 1 out of 1). It's a place to be chill or messy. No one cares, the lights are dark anyways.
author: Jason S.

description:
A great divey bar on market street, lucky 13 will be home to your giant group of friends by providing large spaces to sit and be loud at together. And also a great spot to come to alone and people watch an interesting crowd.

Nothing pretentious or stuck up about this place, lucky 13 gets down to business right away. Big long bar right next to the entrance, seating right next to the door, upstairs and in the back. And there's a pool table thrown in there as well. Yes, dive bars can be pretentious and somehow have people who have an air about being there. See, some people at the "biker bar", zeitgeist (also a great place.. but you do get the occasional douche that's way too cool because he's there with his ironic mustache and neon shades).

Lucky 13 is a great place to grab a drink with a buddy, come with a group of friends, or even, bring a date... if you want to gage the tolerance of here dive bar-ness (this place actually is not very grimy of "divey"). It is nocturnal, friendly (in its own way) and loud. It is dog friendly, so bring muffles with you.
author: Anish B.

description:
Ahhhh dive bars... gotta love 'em. This particular one got me seeing red... literally. It's a pretty big space with a pool table in the back and more seating in the balcony area upstairs. It certainly has character and looks to be a popular spot and all things loveable of a dive bar: loud music, beer and graffiti here and there. It's still a dive bar though, but one with pretty decent selection of beer and music. It's also a great spot to grab some drinks before hitting up for some live music at the Cafe Du Nord.
I have a feeling I'll be back here...
author: Dee D.

description:
Unclear why it's taken me so long to write a review. This place is bomb. An awesome array (especially of IPAs) and often at $3 a pint. Daaang, it really is as good as it gets.

Happy hour until 8pm? Check.
Awesome beer selection? Check.
Super cheap prices? Check.
Friendly bartenders and patrons? Check.
Toronado without the attitude? Check.

If you want fancy pants cocktails and smarmy crowds, don't come here. Ditto if you're on the search for the cleanest bathrooms in SF. But if you want to kick it with some good company over cheap, but delicious beers (aka Dogfishead 90 minute, Pliny the Elder, Chimay), then get your ass over here asap.
author: Monica C.

description:
One punk rock dive bar to rule them all; Lucky 13.

What can I say? Been going there since I was legal and I still love it. The posters, the artwork, the knicknacks, the foosball, the pinball, the popcorn, the dogs, the patio, the photobooth and some pretty stiff-ass drinks come together for one damn fine drinking experience.

And I haven't even mentioned the jukebox. 

Hell yeah. 

In the age of touchscreen download whatever crap you like multi-media machines, Lucky's jukebox is still rocks carefully, hand-selected punk, metal, country and hip-hop that goes down smooth like a PBR tall-boy (which they serve). It's always rotating playlist is peppered with a few discs that never leave, namely Misfits and the Cramps, which, I don't know about you, never get old when you're drinking.

Yes, it gets hot. Yes, the bathrooms are stinky. But, that's what you get with a little authenticity. You want neat and tidy, go to the Marina. I'm staying at Lucky's. 

Another High Life and Jamie, please.
author: Jesse H.

description:
I got really drunk here the other night.

(Note to self: don't order doubles anymore)

To me, this place was like a bigger, louder, more crowded Molotov's. Same drink prices, about the same crowd, just as divey, and pretty similar music. If I'm in the neighborhood again I'd drop in, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.
author: Vanessa R.

description: Always super crowded, but...that's because it's a good spot. They have tall can PBRs and Lambic. Yes.
author: M K.

description:
This bar is ok. 

The atmostphere is a little boring. 

The crowd is definatley not the trendy kind more of the old and dirty kind.

The beer selection is not the greatest but not the worst.

The service was forgetable.

Overall this bar is ok but definatley not what I was looking for.
author: Carina P.

description:
Teenage me--the one who loves Rob Zombie, wears leather pants, hangs out with bands after concerts, and plays the "I was a fan of this band before you were out of diapers" game--would have loved Lucky 13.  So does of-age me, although I've undergone some sartorial and educational changes, and I no longer need to let you know that my musical taste is better than yours.  

Definitely one of my favorite bars to hang out with friends, any night of the week.

Lucky 13 has that rockabilly/punk vibe, but in a laid back, "we're okay if you're coming straight from your job with The Man" way.  From Naked Lady Photo Hunt to $3.50 Fat Tire pints to free popcorn, pool tables, a photobooth, red lighting, and grungy bathrooms, this bar is a living memorial to the countless hours I've spent road-tripping to concerts.  I always walk away having had a good time, even if I'm old now and think maybe, just maybe, the music could be turned down a tad.  

Also, it's close to the N-Judah line.  Bonus!
author: Jennie K.

description:
A good ol' punk haven is hard to find nowadays - especially one that serves good stiff ones. My new guy and I came here with a group of his friends all in various stages of the punk rocker musicality (22-early 50s) and not one of us was dissatisfied. While I'm not classfied as punk rock, I sure as hell have always loved listening to it! The music was the perfect blend of the classic punk songs with some good rock mixed in. Misfits a must here and they even managed to bring back one of my highschool favorites from Operation Ivy. Boozing and singing combined is common here, but it's surprisingly not THAT loud inside. And the bartenders don't stiff you on the drinks. 

Only thing is that I wish the bathroom doors in the girls room would lock. Unless you're into that butt shot short of thing.
author: Alita M.

description: As per a friend's recommendation, finally came around to checking this place out.  Lots of space, lots of beer to choose from, and dang.. it was cheap.  A Blue Moon on happy hour was just round $3.  Conveniently right off the J as well.  Good stop!
author: Mel G.

description: Lucky 13 is such a great bar.  Free goldfish!!  (the crackers, not the animal)  and great drink prices.  the people there are pretty cool, except for whomever stole my camera on my birthday....but other than that sad experience, everything else about the bar is great.  they welcome everyone, from people dressed casually to costumes to fancy attire.  whatever you want!  it's a dive, but a slightly nicer dive.  two thumbs up from me
author: Allison R.

description:
One of my favorite neighborhood dives. It's got a great beer selection at friendly prices too. Cash only.

On a good night, the pool table will be open and free fresh popcorn will be waiting for you. 

The regulars bring their pooches, the tamale lady carts her cooler around, and if it gets crowded just walk upstairs and challenge someone to a game of pinball.
author: Patty L.

description:
If it looks like a dive bar, quacks like a dive bar and walks like a dive bar - then it is probably a dive bar.

With $3 - $4 pints of Pliny the Elder and Dogfish Head on tap, you can never go wrong.  Grab some popcorn and mind the lounging dogs and stale beer-soaked floor.
author: Eric C.

description: One of my favorite bars in the Bay Area, have been going there since the early 90's and it's the same now as it was 20 yrs ago, which is nice.  Basically a dark yet inviting "Halloween bar" with great beer, salty popcorn, a metal/punk jukebox, and a prime people-watching balcony.  Love the L13...the bathroom could use an upgrade though!
author: Koll E.

description:
I love lucky 13! 

the place is actually a lot bigger than it looks from the outside. The bar has a really cool vibe to it and has plenty of things to offer besides it's strong drinks. They have a big selection of beers but CASH ONLY!
There is a pool table, popcorn machine, and, my favorites, a photo booth and jukebox!!!it has ample of seating options too and they play awesome music! The crowd there is really chill and adds to the atmosphere. The kinda place you go in for a drink and come out 5 hours later.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Lucky 13 is one of my favorite dive bars to go to and has just about everything I ask for in a dive bar.  

They have a great beer selection, with your regular run of the mill beers to delicious craft beers.  They have a pool table, a photo booth, an outdoor patio, and a juke box. Lucky 13 is also dog friendly, so bring your furry friend in!

The music is loud, the beer is good,they have a photo booth - what more can I ask for?  Oh some cheesy gold fish snackies?  Yeah, they have that, too.  I loves me some Lucky 13.
author: Jess G.

description: This is a dive bar. It seems like an excellent venue to see a band in, but when we were there, it was nearly empty. Lots of friends just hanging out and drinking.
author: Jonathan K.

description: Do you like white trash, poser hipsters, who actually control when you get a drink?  Then this is your spot, homey. The way they don't see you, or bring you drinks, makes you know you've found a home for your beard.
author: Caviar M.

description:
Just so you know, they don't have trivia anymore. But, they still have delicious popcorn. And the ladies' room toilet seat continues to get ripped off with regularity, which speaks to the reliability of this place. 

My one gripe is that the bouncer lady accused us of trying to sneak in without being carded, when that was not true, being well over 21 and all. We didn't notice her because she was hunched over with her back turned to the door. She also accused us of being sarcastic and then taunted us with insults as we made our way in. That kind of sucked.
author: Kim S.

description:
Jukebox is excellent (Misfits, Motorhead, Supersuckers, Stooges & the like)
Service is pleasant & efficient
Happy Hour is long & cheap
Free Popcorn
Foozball upstairs
Pool table down
Back patio w/free bbq on weekends...weather permitting
Dogs in attendance
Relaxing spot for pre Cafe Du Nord drinks

BONUS:  One time a bartender let us use the industrial citrus slicer on a pink stress ball...nuthin better then cheap beers & senseless creative destruction (little greasy pink plastic beads all over the freaking place)

NOTE OF INTEREST:  usually 10-15minute lag time between Johnny Cash tunes popping up in jukebox rotation...take that for good, take that for bad
author: Anne Marie M.

description:
Purposely divey, with a punk-rock vibe, and a bit of a throwback to a time when this particular stretch of Market was much more low-rent than it is now (remember when the wonderful Home was a Boston Market?!)

Massive beer selection, reasonable prices, awesome jukebox, good bartender, a honest-to-god photo booth and a relaxed  atmosphere; they'll let you bring in food, and dogs. 

The crowd seems to be pretty varied, which I enjoy and that means you might have a fun conversation with a barfly or be beside a table full of loud hipsters. But generally speaking no scenesters or club kids, just grown-ass people who want a drink.

Recently I've been going on Geek trivia night once a month and twice the Tamale Lady has shown up around eleven, which is pretty much the definition of the perfect evening :)
author: Espana S.

description: ARE YOU KIDDING ME?  $3 draft Dogfish Head and Pliny!!  Shit oh dear!!  Momma, divert all my mail here!!
author: Vincent N.

description:
Not a great dive bar.  Music wasn't even very good (is that Nickelback?)

Dunno about these famed great prices either.  I paid $13 for two pours.  WTH?

Good place to see people do coke in the restroom, or wrestle with uncomfortable furniture that might actually beat you.

Still, worth a second chance.
author: Dmytro A.

description:
Beer lovers: there is no reason to go to Toronado or Monk's Kettle when you're in The City! Check it: Lucky 13 has a secretly awesome beer selection, it's inexpensive, and their taps are clean. It's a dog-friendly bar (watch your feet when you're walking in), they have possibly the best rock-punk-psychobilly-dark-country jukebox in the Bay Area, and the decor matches. Don't walk in expecting the bartender to make you a Cosmo; this is an "Order The Simplest Drink You Can Think Of, Or Just A Beer" kind of place. Hands down my favorite bar on Market Street. Do yourself a favor: go in, order a Russian River Pliny the Elder or Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA and enjoy yourself.

Oh, and I'm not entirely sure as to why this is listed as a "dive" bar; I would consider the Bar On Church a dive bar much faster than Lucky 13,  i.e: a bar I would only go to as an absolute last resort. Lucky 13 is always worth going to.

Oh, and the popcorn! If you've got the munchies, they have popcorn as well.
author: Chris H.

description: A total jewel in the crown of SF bars.  The service is what I'd expect : attentive when it's mellow but there can be a wait when it's packed.  The beer selection and prices are great and the upstairs seating is really fun.  Popcorn, sometimes dogs walking around, pool balls clacking make  for a great time at the pub right?  And being on the city's main artery doesn't hurt either.  My only truly dissapointing thing is that the back area is always closed because of noise complaints or some garbage. It is the SICKEST area ever with trees growing up throught the benches, a killer cat mural and plus you could smoke.  I won't hold it against the bar that it isn't open but I'm always hoping.
author: Sin F.

description:
Lots of dogs roaming around, good (cheap) beer, pretty fun crowd.  I wouldn't really call this a dive bar -- more of an angry bicyclist's bar.  (reminded me of Zeitgeist, really)

This was my first stop in SF after I arrived from NY, and I was blown away by beer prices.  Maybe this is normal, but a good beer from Oregon for 3 bucks is just mind-blowing.
author: DH H.

description: Was meeting someone here for drinks and don't ask how I missed their sign. Eventually found it and waited outside since I can't drink for crap and amazingly the Dec. weather wasn't too bad (pretty good for a Socalian) .  Their crowd was nice (or maybe he was trying to hit on me, in a nice not creepy way). Sadly a place like this is wasted on this "I turn not red but purple when I drink" gal. But if you can drink, this might be the place for you.
author: Jen K.

description:
*shock*
*disbelief*

.....

I have no idea how I've gone almost 3 years on Yelp and never written a review for Lucky 13!!

One of my all time favorite bars in SF.  This place has a full bar as well as one of the best selections of beer on tap!  Highlights are the photo booth and the free popcorn.  Also a great back garden area to hang out on a (rare) hot day in SF or if you're a smoker (boo), you can smoke freely without worrying about dirtying the lungs of your fellow patrons (because I know most smokers are concerned about that).  

This place has a very chill, relaxed vibe.  It's a bit punk rocker-ish but you'll find a variety of folks who visit this place.  Best nights are non-weekend nights as it can get quite crowded but great on a Sunday evening or Monday or Tuesday.  Pretty sure this place is cash only but maybe someone will correct me.  

I haven't been in a while...must visit soon!
author: Melanie N.

description: If one could get over the overwhelming stench of yak urine and old men's slippers, I suppose the drinks are strong. The bartender is clearly unwell in the head, evidenced by her pigtails (not recommended on ladies over 6, let alone 60 years old). She was extremely argumentative and unpleasant. There were maybe 8 people in the bar when I was there, at around 9 on a Wednesday, and yet the music was at the volume to drown out a screaming crowd of maybe 100.
author: Umilia M.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to grab a beer in SF.

They have a number of great beers on tap and the prices are not to be beat. On a nice day, head out to the patio and they may have the grill out serving up burgers. 

There are plenty of places to sit and a pool table in the back. This is a very comfortable and nice place to have a drink with friends.
author: Eric G.

description:
Stopped in last night for a post-dinner libation on a Monday night, and was offered the "special" when I tried to order a Maker's Mark: $6 for a PBR and "almost anything" that starts with a "J" (translation: no Johnnie Walker). So I got Jager to help settle the stomach, and it was quite generous. 

My biggest takeaway was the fact that I came in a suit (not knowing it was a total dive bar) and I was treated right. It sucks walking into a dive bar and getting judged cause you're not wearing the part, and the bartenders here did a great job of making me feel fit, despite the circumstance. 

If you're looking for a good-atmosphered dive bar come here, as it fits my definition of a dive bar: a place where anyone can come and drink as much as they want, so long as they have a good time, and no judgments. But it might not be a "true" dive bar if you require the definition to include indoor smoking, patrons to only drink the crappiest alcohol on earth, and for patrons to take pride in drinking at a crap establishment. 

Apparently there's also a back patio here where the green smokers can hang out.
author: Clifford K.

description:
Went from 8-9pm on a Tuesday.

Very mellow, classy bartenders, decent microbrew options (e.g. 90 minute).

I'd give 5 stars if they'd burn the TV.
author: dark l.

description: I have to give props to dog friendly spots, especially those with stiff drinks. There must have been at least 6 different dogs in the bar... Which is awesome because I am a dog person. Next time my girls are coming with me!
author: Brianna S.

description:
We tried to go to Cafe Du Nord but they were having a Bingo night and were closing soon so we happened upon this bar, which was recommended by the bouncer at Cafe Du Nord.

The first impression I had unfortunately was "wow this place kinda smells like pee" and sure enough, the smell wasn't just coming from the bathrooms that were near the front door but actually permeated the entire place. It might have been stale or spilled beer or something but it was strong and somewhat distracting the whole time.

The service was a bit gruff and not super attentive but they did give us advice on where to get some late night food nearby.

The beers were good and they had a HUGE variety of stuff there, both on tap and in bottles. 

They also have pac man and pool and an upper balcony for overflow. 

Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area looking for some late night drinks.
author: Kathleen G.

description:
Lucky 13 reminds me of my youth! Bartenders with attitude, juke box with great punk selections, decent beers on tap, old punk concert posters behind the bar. Sure there were some poseurs hanging out, but stay out of my way and all is cool.

I love the german umleitung (detour) sign at the entrance.
author: Jim K.

description:
So, the last time I was in here, I was dressed like a power ranger on a Saturday night. The conversation went as follows:

Me: Red Ranger needs 4 PBRs
Bartender: $6 please...
Me: ..........POWER UP...(+pose like a ninja).

Yep...apparently just like popeye on spinach, this power ranger gets his power from PBRs (at least that night...or the parts of it I remember).

This is a great place for getting down and sloppy with a crowd. Its sizeable on the inside with plenty of pic-a-nic tables with drunk pets painted on the walls. Beyond PBR, there are several other impressive (and much better) beer selections, but that night was just not that kind of night...and I know you know what I'm sayin.

PHOTOBOOTH! That prints doubles!! So no more debating over who gets to keep that strip of pics of you and your friends when you should have never been taking pictures of you and your friends. When we were there, we also picked up some pics from random people that left theirs behind. 2 dudes - they looked like cool people. We were trying to use the photobooth pics as mugshots and match them up to faces in the bar, but no dice. Must have been the $1.50 PBRs.
author: Sean C.

description: I went here for a birthday party and it was a great bar for groups.  We ended up getting the whole back area with the Foosball tables to ourselves (about 20 of us) for the first half of the night and later moved downstairs to play pool.  Drinks were reasonably priced and the bar wasn't too crowded.  The photo booth was an added bonus - someone left $10 in the machine, so my friends and I ended up with 2 free strips.  I would definitely come back.
author: Sarah K.

description: This place is trying way too hard to be a dive bar, to actually BE a dive bar. Good mix of the studded jacket set and men in business attire (wtf?!). They had some kinda nasty smelling food going on, too, so the whole place stank of cheese. I love me a good dive bar but this place was just way too trendy, and the Misfits paraphernalia everywhere was just a little much.
author: Nina M.

description: Nice beer selection at fair prices.  I like the real long bar.  A good spot when you're in the mood for a rough crowd but not too rough.
author: Marc S.

description: Lives up to the "dive bar" label. Dark, kind of smelly, semi-sketchy people and cheap beer. But hey it works for a low-key Friday night when you just want to catch up with friends, eat free popcorn, and sit outside. Beer selection is great! Plus we were able to order pizza and have it delivered so we could enjoy it on the outdoor patio. If I were in the neighborhood I'd pop back in again.
author: Amy N.

description: Triple Vodoo brewing took over some taps and my fave was the White IPA, well done and my fave so far for new reales for SF Beer Week.
author: Chris D.

description:
What's better than free overly-salted popcorn and a Stella glass full of Gold Fish??? Oh, that's right- $3 beers during Happy Hour!! 

The back patio may be no Zeitgeist patio, but the tight space forces you to get communal with the punk patrons who make this place cool. And the bartenders, also unlike Zeitgeist, are unpretentious and genuine in their friendliness. 

I'm headed back once my ulcer heals!
author: Raquel C.

description:
Beer me please!

Lucky 13 used to be one of my favorite bars I'd go to as a step up alternative from the drinking training wheels of 11th Street corridor madness but that was years ago. Now I consider my experiences there hit or miss or a meeting spot before hitting up other bars in the area.

I will say the mainstays are the music (I find myself singing at times), beer selection, outdoor patio (although closed the last couple times I've been there), photobooth, and stiff drinks when you want the hard stuff!
author: Rachel C.

description: Cesspool of filth, bad attitude and shitty bartenders. Fuck you. I went in for a drink after playing a gig at DuNord and was verbally assaulted for absolutely no good reason by your bartender, barback, and door person. I understand what closing time is...the clocks are set 15 minutes early to get people moving. I had ordered a drink and 2-3 minutes into it, when I merely uttered, "it's only 1:44" (with absolute zero attitude - I was sober). A "hey, we're closing, finish your drink" would have done...instead what followed resembled 3 drill sergeants screaming "Get the fuck out motherfucker, that's the worst thing you can say to a bartender, we're gonna pick you up and throw your ass out bitch!!!". My girlfriend, pal, and I left peacefully, vowing never to return...and asking our very VERY large group of  friends - local musicians, artists, bartenders, bar owners, and locals to give you and your shitty attitude the finger by not patronizing the Lucky 13. You fucked with some wrong people.
author: Ranch S.

description: Sure, the beer selection is good and is reasonably priced, but the bartenders are overwhelmingly rude. Especially the red-headed female bartender. Felt so uncomfortable and angry we left ASAP.
author: Nike L.

description:
After a late breakfast at Harvey's i was in need of some libations. so i headed over to Lucky 13.  

Boy either they take the punk rock cred thing too far or they are in need of a plumber extraordinaire! the first thing you notice as you walk through the door is the overpowering smell of sewage, YEAH! just what i wanted, maybe its kept that way to deter undesirables or hipsters, but c'mon its pretty bad.

So since it was early in the day there was the tender and two patrons, i ordered up a Sailor Jerry and Coke while my drinking companion ordered up a Currant and Strongbow, which i sampled and was quite tasty.  As everyone seems to rave about the beer selection was great, but i dont really drink beer. So i'll leave that to the fans of wheat pop.  They were playing a great selection on the jukebox, mostly rockabilly stuff.  interestingly i overheard a conversation regarding the Misfits and how the people discussing them felt that they were the Led Zeppelin of the punk bar scene, LOL, awesome. Yes you can't go to a punk bar and not find Misfits in the juke. 

We drank most of the day away, and since it wasnt packed it was great, we had a great time people watching that is until the hipsters showed up. I mean seriously, how many different ways are there to wear skinny jeans, shave your sideburns, beard, funky mustache into that just "defines" your personality? I particularly enjoyed the plethora of fedora hats with multiple feathers. And yes everyone of them ordered up PBR. Classic

So if your in the area, or are wanting to listen to some great tunes, head on by Lucky 13.
author: Cooper M.

description:
Been here a couple of times with a group of friends. Love the dark red/black bars in the city. 

My name is tagged on the bathroom wall. Hello.
author: Courtney S.

description:
Love this bar!  This is always my go to bar when I'm feeling the urge to get out.  They have tons of beer on tap and bottled  (including my favorites, Chimay and Pliny the Elder).  Good music, good prices, dog friendly, free popcorn, and a pints of goldfish crackers for a buck!

The first time I ever stepped foot in this bar there were two dancers on the stripper pole on the counter!  That was the first and only time that I've seen anyone dancing on the counter, but who cares?  Still think it's cool just to have it - kinda adds to that dirty dive bar feel.

One thing I really enjoyed about this bar was the back patio.  You could smoke, drink and be merry with friends in their nice partially covered patio.  They have since got new neighbors that bitched and complained about the noise and so they've unfortunately had to close the patio until further notice (you're moving next to a bar!  Get over it!).   They also used to have free BBQ's on Saturdays (not sure if that's still in effect).

So, to sum it all up - GO TO THIS BAR if you like punk music, a dirty dive feel, free popcorn, dogs, and an excellent beer selection - you'll enjoy it.  Also, right next to Church station, so get drunk and ride MUNI home.
author: Alex K.

description:
Of all the dive bars I have run into in San Francisco, this has to be my favorite. Such a great selection of music on the juke box. They even have TOM WAITS. Totally my type of music and scene. There is tons and tons of seating, so even when it's crowded I am never just stuck sitting in a corner. The crowd is really good that comes in as well. 
Their prices are pretty good too. It's nice to buy a drink in San Francisco that doesn't make me cringe when they tell me the total. 

Not just one of my favorite dives in SF, but one of my favorites I've been to.
author: Heather Elizabeth S.

description:
I've been wanting to check this bar out so when me and a couple other friends decided to ditch the Haight and head out to a place more suitable for us, i was glad we ended up at Lucky 13.   

Very cool spot.  It wasnt overly crowded and the crowd that was here was pretty cool and friendly.  I felt totally comfortable as soon as i walked in.  The look of the place inside caught my attention - i like the off-the-wall interior.  Nothing fancy or hipster to it, just a good ol' dive bar to enjoy your drinks in.  

Had a couple rounds, got a couple plays out of the jukebox, seen the photobooth that i didn't get a picture in (dammit!), and then decided that after my sixth pint, i should probably slow my roll and head home.  Waking up for work did not seem appealing.  Luckily, i got up no problem this morning.....minus the fact im incredibly sleepy right now.

I'll definitely come back here again.  Some chick told me i looked so cute with my chucks & tattoos that she wanted to stick me in her pocket and take me home.  Ummm....thanks?   I really like the vibe here.
author: Juv C.

description:
I got lucky at Lucky 13! 

This is NOT a dive bar, despite the Yelp classification. It has a photo booth. It has pool tables. It has an upstairs area. It has well-stocked soap and towels in the men's room (at least at 3:30 pm on a Saturday). It has a huge golden-eyed boxer that makes sure the men treat the ladies with respect. It has an infinite supply of free buttered popcorn. It has conservative management that will not let you take any clothes off, even just your jeans, to weigh in for a contest (this is the Castro?). It has a very large selection of beer. A pint of Anchor Steam and a glass of cabernet costs $7 + tip. You see, this is so not a dive bar. 

At 3:30 pm I won the "Yelp's Biggest Loser" contest here, having lost more weight than the other male contestants. Thank you, Luis M for organizing this event! This is big money! I immediately celebrated by leaving with a Hot Russian Girl and taking her out to dinner. 

--------------- 
OK, I confess. She was the same Hot Russian Girl I had arrived with. But still, I think you will agree. I am lucky.
author: David D.

description: Damn I miss this place!! Wish there was a Lucky 13 in all my hometowns, will visit soon : )
author: Amanda L.

description: I understand why this is labeled as a dive bar (punk music! dirty! cheap drinks! dark lighting! graffiti!) But do not let the dive bar label fool you - this place has a solid beer selection.  One of the better beer selections in town.  I have always had a great time in this bar, and often met new people here.  It is worth checking out, for sure.
author: Tia B.

description: A dive bar with all of the amenities - cheap drinks, pool table, free popcorn and pinball machines. The people are cool here. Centrally located in The City between the Mission and Sunset.
author: Michael C.

description:
When is the new patio going to open?

Lucky 13 is a great bar, probably the best in town when the patio is open. Since it's been closed (August  '10?) I drop it down to 4 stars.

Easily a five-star bar with the patio. Good beer selection, good people, good service, good jukebox, good location ... a long-time favorite.

QUESTION (April 8, 2011): Is the new patio open yet?
author: Peter B.

description:
Oh, hi. As if you didn't know by now, I love dark bars with red walls. And Lucky 13 is just such a bar. Admittedly I've only been here on weekdays, but seating is plentiful and bartenders are friendliful. If you're from SoCal and love yourself some Alex's, head directly to Luckly 13 as soon as you get off that JetBlue flight on your next trip to SF.

Leffe! On tap! Yes. On tap! Say whaaaaa? Plus all sorts of other craziness on tap, but Leffe? Holy shit. This place is the tits! I love it. And the tagging on the bathroom wall will keep you occupied whilst trying to sober up. By the way, hit up the ATM on the way here - it's cashola only. But well worth that $2 ATM surcharge.
author: Hazel Q.

description:
I have been meaning to write a review about this place for quite awhile.
As I am writing this I am sure that the hangover I have today is not at all what I was thinking about last night when I was ordering that whiskey at 1;30 why?
This has nothing to do with lucky 13.
I like this place but only when it is not too busy, It can be a bit overcrowded with "I'm in a band" peope.
 I like it empty, I like the jukebox , I like the free popcorn and the cheap drinks.
So whenever I have some time to kill this is a perfect place for me.
Drink up fast.
author: cecilia k.

description:
Dear God, 

I just wanted to say "thank you" for paying attention to my drinking habits. I know it's not like you placed Lucky 13 on the map by divine intervention or anything, but something put the idea in somebody's head to have a rockabilly-themed dive bar, complete with crusty local owners (and I mean that in the best way), rockin' tunes, framed concert posters from before I could even go to concerts, and quite possibly the best best BEST beer list ever. Leffe ON TAP! On T.A.P. In a Leffe signature glass. Screw wine, someone should turn water into beer - this beer. And then they should let me bathe in it. 

It almost makes me tear up to know that I won't be able to stumble into Lucky 13's depths after this week. So perhaps my next request is that you create a teleporter so that all of my bad days, happy hours, birthday parties, and general (sinless) debauchery can take place here. There's no problem a little beer and music can't wash away, right? I promise - If you just fulfill that one little wish, I'll never ever bug you again. 

Okay maybe that, and the ability to eat fried cheese balls  for the rest of my life without having a heart attack (*note: this does not pertain to any food options Lucky 13 might potentially provide. I just like cheese). I get this might be a little far fetched, God, but after a visit to this bar, I'm feelin' lucky...
author: Veronica R.

description:
After one incredible show at Cafe Du Nord I slipped the very cute drummer my number. I wandered into the nearest bar with my friend which happened to be Lucky 13 for a drink. We're a bit preppier than the normal crowd there, but after a few funny looks we made ourselves at home, grabbing some of the free popcorn. Halfway through my first $2 PBR my phone rings! The band came and met us there for a ridiculously 
fun night. I've been back a few times since, and Lucky 13 never lets us down!
author: Kelly C.

description:
Don't be off put by the smell of sour beer as you enter this stellar dive bar. The super friendly staff, cheap beer, and rockin' tuneage will more then make up for it. 

Not to mention super dog friendly! My pittie would party into the wee hours if I let her, munchin' on popcorn and using her good looks to weasel treats out of the bartenders.
author: Elle B.

description:
If you were, say, attending a transit-oriented pub crawl, this would be the perfect first stop. Pub crawl or not, any Muni vehicle (and there are several that go by here) will take its sweet time to get you there. So you'll probably need at least one drink after the ride.

*New stuff*
Brand-spanking new photo booth (!!) by the door, and it's the same as the brand-spanking new one at 500 Club. Same $5, two strips, four frames deal. Some salesman is peddling his wares pretty well around here.

*Not new, still relevant*
L13 is still my go-to for reasonably priced beer, spirits and the like. Come with a group or sit on a stool by yourself; no one cares. It feels like a live music venue, without the live music. Everything is red, black, stickered and tagged, and I love it.

$2.50 a pint at happy hour is unbeatable. The people here (employees and patrons) give the place much of its character. It's hard to talk without yelling, but it's still a good time.

Come for the beer, the liquor, the jukebox, and the crowd, then jump in the photo booth to document your good time (not that way, pervert).
author: Tara R.

description:
Since this is actually a neighborhood bar and more of a "regular's" establishment, once again my review might seem biased but I'd like to keep it that way. I've seen too many bars become infiltrated by "Marina people" like every other bar in the mission. Sometimes you can hear a fresh faced Banana Republic outfitted gentleman say, "Hey! Let's go slumming in the Mission!" and the response from their doe eyed Bebe counterpart is, "That sound's great but let's stop at The Blue Light first!"

Lucky 13 has none of this crap. I love it when a Marina type person comes in and claims, "I've been coming to this bar for 15 years!" 
Well Mr. Coolest Guy in the Room. 15 years ago it was a gay bar sooooo....

Lucky 13 has no pretentious bullshit. The drinks are cheap, the staff is great, the pool table is always fun and the BBQ on Saturday's is free. What else do you want? A female pro-wrestler to punch you in the chest and knock you into a bunch of chairs and then pick you up and buy you a Pabst? Oh was that only me? Get your own fun story.
author: Jason C.

description: Fun vibe, great drinks, but more importantly, popcorn machine. Hellz yeah!! That's pretty much all it took to earn my sincere admiration.
author: Loli L.

description:
I love this place. It always plays the music that I like and it has nice beers on tap (and I don't usually like beers a lot). 
It's a great place to hang with friends and chat.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
Pros:  Nice, attentive bartenders.  Good prices on a wide range of beers.  Tables for small to medium sized groups usually available.  Bloody Marys are good but they don't make them in the evenings/when its crowded.

Cons:  Bathrooms near the front can make it smelly when you walk in.  Patio area closed down months ago.  Music sometimes not the best.
author: E. R.

description:
After I finally got to where I needed to go, I ended up in a group with people who've known me less than a year and someone I've known since I was 18.  After Nihon, we went to Lucky 13 which is someplace my friend and I used to go to when we were 22.  

Not much has changed.  It's not any cleaner or less smelly.  They still don't take cards and pours are super stiff, almost too much so.   The new-ish friends were grilling the old one for juicy stories from our youngster days but since he was usually more out of it than I was, I was safe.  Nice try, gangsta.

I was very dumb and mixed my booze that night.  Because the drinks seemed to get progressively stronger throughout the night, it resulted in me running to the photobooth before we left.  I was sitting there, minding my own business, doing my usual faces when "shot #3" flashed on the screen and then suddenly there were boobs all up in my face.  

Hello, Ms. Butterfly.
author: Seong P.

description:
Lucky 13, we had some good times together. Despite your ridiculous punk rock posteuring, I gave you a chance. Maybe I thought that if we became friends I could convince you to improve your taste in music. Like, you know, maybe you could replace the Misfits albums in your jukebox with some Pere Ubu and The Wire. I saw progress: remember that one night you played Bauhaus, and I just happened to be wearing my Bauhaus reunion tour t-shirt? That was so romantic of you.

You could also be really generous, and I like totally loved that about you. $3.50 for most of the beer in your really-good (except for the surprising lack of stouts and porters) selection. Just a dollar more for a goblet of Delirium! And for your thirteenth birthday, you hired a (really bad) stripper and gave everybody free BBQ. That was like, OMG, so sweet of you!

Plus, everybody's a sucker for a photo booth. Maybe that's why, long ago, I forgave you for your ridiculously slow service. And for the bartender who obviously aspires to be Mike Ness who forgot to bring me my $16.50 change after pouring me a beer. 

But this weekend, I think I finally saw you for who you really are. My hot date and I, after a couple of beers, finally scored two seats at the bar. We were giddy happy. But you had to go and ruin our good mood.

A guy beside us signaled to the bartender -- the fat one who looks like Fred Durst -- and said, "What's a good local beer? I'm from Austin, so I don't really know."

Fat Fred Durst recommended Brown Shugga, a fine choice: a unique, rich sweet beer that is a whopping 9 percent booze. I had just had one a few minutes ago, and it was a bargain at $3.50 a pint.

"Here you go," Fat Fred Durst said to the Austinite, "That will be five bucks."

The nice Austinite tipped Fatty two dollars, totally unaware that he had been ripped off just because he wasn't from around here.

A few minutes later, as F.F. Durst was mixing some drinks for another customer, a guy asked him, "Can I get two ciders when you get a chance?" 

The bartender shot back, "Can I get a HOT MEAL AT A FAIR PRICE WHEN YOU GET A CHANCE?!" and walked off, leaving the guy to order from another bartender. 

Fat Fred Durst was obviously having a bad night. All three bartenders were ignoring pretty much everyone that night (after waiting for over 5 minutes, my hot date and I had to enlist a tall, loud, and very friendly stranger to order our second round for us), but Fatty was on a roll. He did actually manage to take the order of a cute-ish girl next to us who batted her eyelashes at him and ordered three tequila shots. But when she asked for a glass of water, he snapped at her, "There's a water machine at the other end of the bar by the popcorn!" 

Yeah, no shit, and there's also a great liquor store around the corner, fucktard. If she wanted to serve herself, she'd probably go there.

Fattttttt Fred Durst continued to charge random-ass prices (five bucks, $4.50, $4.00) for beers that are supposed to be $3.50. And once, amazingly, he charged someone $16.00 for three identical drinks. Do the math: that's, uh, $5.33 each. 

As we were waiting for one of the three bartenders who were hovering around right in front of us to actually LOOK UP and MAKE EYE CONTACT so we could order, my hot date overheard Fatty Fred Durst and Wanna-be Mike Ness (who, from the looks of things, spends the majority of his time thinking about his own penis. Like this, "Dude. I totally look like Mike Ness. And I also really love my penis. It is fucking awesome!") making fun of somebody by saying, "Yeah, that dude totally drives a Prius -- hahaha!" Yeah dude, polluting and giving extra money to huge gas companies to fill up your monster truck is totally punk rock.

The final straw came when a dapper old gay next to us got royally ignored for ten minutes, even after trying to speak to Fatty Fred a few times and holding up a twenty. The third bartender took the order of a group of guys right next to the man, and while he was MIXING THREE DRINKS, the man asked him, as politely as you can ask this sort of thing, "Are you a bartender or a bar back?"

"BAR BACK" he said, as he continued mixing drinks.

And, after seeing your shit, I can safely say that I hope you get run over by an environmentally-friendly car driven by a polite, older gay man from Austin, Texas. And that afterwards, a cute-ish girl pours tequila shots on your open wounds. And if you're not dead by then, well, I hope that at least the hospital severely overcharges you for the sutures.
author: Ben P.

description:
Lucky 13 is comforting in so many ways. It has been around forever with precious little change (how many things can you say that about in life?). So much to love - the bartenders are friendly, the drinks are cheap and strong, free popcorn to make sure you stay salted enough to keep on drinking (so thoughtful), the crowd is always cool enough to want to hang with but not poserish enough to want to smack, and most of all - the ever-so-awesome "find the differences in the porn star pictures video game" at the bar. I LOVE that goddamn thing. Choose male or female porn star and keep busy for hours finding the niggling details that set the side-to-side pictures apart. Just like in Highlights magazine from when we were kids. Only its naked, semi-naked or cheesily clad porn stars in cheesy porn settings. 

Oh Lucky 13 - please don't ever change.
author: wendella a.

description:
This is a dirty rock & roll bar and there is no place in the city I would rather be.  Their beer selection is worthy of a pretentious SOMA bar.  It's cheap (just like your mom).  They have a free popcorn machine that serves up stuff better than what you'd shell out $11.75 for at the Metreon.  Their jukebox has plenty of rockabilly and punk.  They have a hidden beer garden in the back.  And they have a fucking stripper pole in the middle of the bar.

(I'm there every Wednesday night, pole dancing to a little 2Live Crew.  Try the prime rib and remember to tip you waitress generously!  Those folks are working hard for you.)
author: Christopher K.

description:
Lots of beer [ones that I like!] on tap, PLUS pear cider! It all seems reasonably priced, so you can really get your drink on. You could also use that as an opportunity to get a friend who happens to be celebrating a birthday plastered. I've not had to wait too long to be served [the times that I've bought], even though I have that tendency to just fade into the background, and/or I just don't lean all over the bar enough to get some service. 

It's fairly large, lots of space [two upper areas to sit in or to ride a Big Wheel down the stairs from - I saw it happen Saturday night!] and lots of things to keep you occupied if you're the type that needs multiple distractions. Starting from the front, you've got the bathrooms. Very important for activities that would involve bathrooms. In the ladies' room, I must say that there are some true artists out there. They decorate the stalls with pictures, snarky comments, phone numbers, etc. Makes for some quick bathroom reading.

Right after that, the photo booth. Not the same quality as the one at the Elbo Room, but this $5 booth takes both B&W and color and fits about 2.5 persons. Moving along the right, you'll find a stripper pole. Did you notice that? It's on the bar in front of the listing of beers. The various occasions that I find myself at Lucky 13, I've not seen someone dance around it. YET. Will update the review again when I see this in action! There is an awesome jukebox that keeps the place LOUD to the left. Naked Photo Hunt + Sudoku [I held a record at some point!], popcorn, and pool. Video games up top too... And for those itching to watch a game, there is a television up on the wall above the entrance. PLUS, a back patio for hanging outside... It's okay if you have ADD in here, there's always something to do.

They'll let you bring in 36 cupcakes from Safeway down the block AND let you light 24 of them for a friend's birthday. SO if you do that, make sure to clean up and give the extra cupcakes to the bartenders at the end!  

Also have to LOVE that it's in the Castro, and as you're walking with a cute guy back to the car, some guy off the street right in front of Hot Cookie will try to take him off your hands. ;)
author: Tinna H.

description:
There is nothing terrible special about lucky 13, yet without fail I end up here at the end of the night swearing how awesome it is. Maybe it's the free popcorn or maybe the photobooth. next morning "where did all these pictures come from" and then the realization that I did indeed spend 20 dollars on silly photobooth pictures. 

But really, the bartenders are bad ass, they have an excellent selection of beers, and it has a very small amount of douchbags (unless the olympics are on).
author: Allyson S.

description: Good amount of seating, free popcorn, but cash only ): I didn't stay long here, since I went on a trek to find an ATM, but I do have to give major points to the bartender, who watched my left-behind wallet and photobooth pictures despite probably hating my group's drunken antics.
author: Melody L.

description:
It's so refreshing to see a dive bar with an edge in the Castro.
 
Take these elements:
Polaroid photobooth
Incredible spread of beers, both draft and bottle, including the only lambic I've ever seen on tap. Everything under $5.
Chill out door patio where you can sit in the elbow of a tree and lounge at picnic tables
Dogs aplenty
Pool 
Patrons who don't give a damn
Killer jukebox
Stripper pole

They've discovered the magic formula and in this process of alchemy hit gold.
author: Ligaya T.

description:
"Alcoholics go to meetings, the rest are just drunks." was a great quote I heard a coworker tell me over a beer. 

...and nobody knows this better than the bartenders are Lucky 13. Their diverse patronage and chill atmosphere is testament to that. Lots of great features about the joint. 

1. Cute bartenders (of course this has to be #1) who are fast, friendly and attentive. 
2. Largish back area to get some air in the middle of the night, or for a cancer stick if your so inclined. 
3. This cool bar is conveniently located off the underground Muni line at Church and Market (or if its too late, stumbling distance from my pad). 
4. They allow outside food to be brought in (I came w/ bacon wrapped asparagus one time....mmmmm bacon) 
5. Last but not least....root beer on tap. Not just any root beer, great root beer. Ice cold but w/ out the ice to delude it. I ordered it just to break a $5, ok maybe to sober up a bit too... and it was just what I needed. 

There is just one thing that could have been better. The bathroom location. They are located at the front of the bar, by the entrance instead of the back, or in the center somewhere. Its just not intuitive ESPECIALLY when you have the sudden urge to hug porcelain (not that it ever happened to me or anything, right Theron?). 

Head to Lucky 13, you'll be glad you did. But hurry up in the bathroom will ya, I gotta go!
author: Angelo F.

description:
This a place for people who like beautiful ink, a hot rockin' jukebox, an extensive beer selection and cool peeps.

Standout features of Lucky 13:
  .  $3 happy hour beers.
  .  Big tables for you and your 5 other pal-aroonies.
  .  A patio for the smoker-types.

VIVA LA SEXY BLACK CAT.
author: Alice S.

description:
Lucky 13 loves us, we love Lucky 13.  It's pretty much that simple.

Lucky 13 has it all: outdoor seating for the smokestacks, a photo booth, pinball machines, good pours, and a prime location in the center of everything.  If their bathroom didn't look like they were trying to recreate the colon of a putrid corpse it would be perfectamundo, as they say in Soviet Russia.
author: Matt H.

description:
If I were to compare Lucky 13 to my idea of a hot n' seXXXy man, they would pretty much be one in the same:

Tall, tough, tattooed... but, full of humor and character.
Dark on the inside... but, intimate and interesting.
Cheap and easy...  but, fun-fun-fun!

Seriously, Lucky 13 pretty closely emulates the characteristics which make a member of the opposite sex super hawt to me.  Super hawt.  Lucky 13 - I lurve you for your cheap drinks, free popcorn, pool table, photo booth, tattooed bartenders (YUMMY), liberal dog policy and amazing jukebox - sigh... bars that play Johnny Cash/The Misfits/Danzig/Tom Waits followed by Bikini Kill and L7 are totally dreeeaaaaammmmmyyy... sigh.

Hm...

Can you date a bar?
author: Kate R.

description: So far this is my favorite dive bar in San Francisco! Reasonably priced drinks, nice beer selection, fun and kitschy decor, popcorn, fantastic jukebox (especially if you're a fan of punk mixed CDs), dog-friendly, nice staff, and plenty of seating. Just about everything I love about a bar scene.
author: Kelly W.

description: Classic dive bar.  I used to live in Hayes Valley and came here all the time at night.  On a recent visit during happy hour, on a nice day, I discovered the outside patio!  WTF.  How had I missed it for years?  Perhaps I'm just drinking less these days and aware of what's around me? Blew my mind.  Anyway, yeah- there's an outdoor patio.  It's small, but the upshot is, it's not as crowded at Zeitgeist.
author: Laura S.

description:
I've met my match. All you other bitches watch out because he's mine. He completes me like no other dive bar can. 

I knew I was in love the second I walked in. Nothing gets me going like a real Bad Boy. Punk rock posters, moody lighting, fully sleeved bartender, oh yeah... Lucky 13 is HOTT. 

The tap selection is a long, agonizing session of foreplay. Each pint is so rapturous but yet I can't wait to finish and move onto the next one. With so many choices, Lucky 13 will never get boring or routine. And the long happy hour is like a shot of Viagra- $3.00 imports keep me excited and always ready for more. 

The bowls of popcorn, although not inherently sexy, are a good touch. It shows the more tender side of Lucky 13- if you can't cuddle with all of us, feeding will do nicely. 

The photo booth is a naughty little den for trysts and pow-wows. My rendez-vous'  were mostly innocent, but next time I'm going all the way. Oh I'll get lucky... although it better be before my 13th visit or else I'm taking off a star.
author: Britt W.

description:
Not cool.  

Too loud.

Weird seating.

Doorman wouldn't let my man in due to lack of id even though he is clearly past his prime and hasn't seen the other side of 21 since God knows when.  

Bartender gave me attitude when I asked whether the popcorn was made with butter.  

This place can suck my old man's wrinkly sack.
author: T-Bag S.

description:
I've always liked this bar.  I always feel a bit sexier upon entering.  Its not a classy, dress up fancy and look amazing kind of sexy.  Its a dirty, raunchy, trashy, screw in the alley kind of sexy. Maybe its the lighting.  Maybe its the fact that boys are drinking more because of the great beer selection and cheap prices.  Maybe is that this one time, when the bar was filled with hundreds of Santa's three ladies (including myself) all shared one lollipop.  I don't know, but whatever it is...this bar has some sort of nasty power over me.

Why did I never know there was a killer back patio till last night?  I guess it probably has something to do with the fact that it closes at 10, and that's usually my enter time.  Well NO MORE!!! I'm there for the patio...you can bet on it.  I came with my dog, and he loved it too...Lush.  I think he actually felt sexier too, seeing as though the majority of his time there he spent on the back of a french bulldog.
author: Lauren F.

description: What is up? Sure, dive bar, cheap beer, strong drinks, dark and loud, love it... get it (used to be a bartender at Armadillos)... but geeSUS, it was stinky in the Lucky 13 tonight. When the The men's room smells nice you've got issues.
author: Renee R.

description:
Solid bar, though a bit more rough and divey than I generally prefer. The back patio area was nice, though once the post happy hour crowd showed up, it got so full and smoky that you didn't need to light up to get your nicotine fix (whether you wanted one or not). 

I was both amused and put off by the large "F--k Off" and skull & crossbones prominent on the door to the (presumably) supply room. It shows character yes, but that's not the type of character I want in my face when I go out for an after-work drink with friends. I never saw the photo booth I'd heard they have. Still, I give them credit for unlimited free popcorn (very salty), a pool table, a bartop electronic game machine, and a willingness to allow people to bring in outside food. Being stumbling distance to Muni is a benefit also.

Not someplace I'd actively avoid, but they'll be very lucky if I come back on my own in the next 13 months.

TRIVIA: Superstition about 13 being an unlucky number in Western cultures goes back at least to c.1760 BCE when the Hammurabi Code listed no #13. However, it is considered very lucky in the Sikh culture. Several very successful athletes have worn the number 13, including Wilt Chamberlain (basketball), Dan Marino (football), Alex Rodriguez (baseball), and Kristine Lilly (soccer). It's also very popular in old-school tattoo culture, where many symbols take on the opposite of their standard meaning... and that interpretation strikes me as the most relevant to this bar.
author: Bill B.

description: Cool space, large enough even for the weekend crowd, great staff, no attitude, large selection of great (and cheap beer), diverse crowd, awesome jukebox, and free popcorn.  What the hell else could you want?!
author: Joshua W.

description:
13 IS lucky for me. When in Vegas, I always bet on 13. 

Thus, the Lucky 13 is my density. Sometimes my density involves one too many vodka crans than 113 pounds of me can handle, and I have to be carried to the car by kindly, benevolent Yelpers. I'm not talking about any night in particular. Hypothetically speaking, of course.

The Lucky 13 has it all -- dark, sexy lighting, jukebox, strong drinks, photobooth, and patio that gives Zeitgeist a run for its money.  And bonus points for finding my wig and not absconding with it!

Just do me a favor Lucky 13, please cut me off when my eyes start to close and my legs get the wobblies.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
Yay! I finally found it. "It" being a bar that reminds me of all the little rock n roll shit hole bars I used to frequent in Hollywood back in the day when I wore thrift store cords, baggy men's dress pants and monkey boots (yeah, you know you wish you had a time machine to go git ya a piece of that!)

I'm not talking the lame ass Roxy or Whiskey or what have you either. I'm talking the old day holes like Bar Deluxe, the Coconut Teaszer, the Alligator Lounge, Fais Do Do and the like. The places where you could roll in and be anybody you wanted to be and it didn't matter because it was just...cool. 

But alas, I now have that place in SF. A no frills, no attitude bar with cool chillin locals, good tunage and damn strong drinks that are reasonably priced. Hello Belvedere/Soda and Jack/Coke for $9. Yes, you will be finding me here often.
author: Stephy S.

description: Pliny the Elder, free popcorn, and dogs sitting on bar stools.  It's a place for regulars from the neighborhood and outsiders alike.  Don't miss my favorite bar in the Castro-Dolores-Triangle!
author: Michael M.

description:
I like a bar that can be vast in its seating options and still feel intimate.  With those red walls and the oblong shape, the place gives off the feeling of being inside an organ.  I'm not going to say which organ - use your imaginations, you skeevy bastards.

So like it's name, it's a bit of a paradox.  They've got some sketchy punk bathroom graffitti and some bougie-assed beers*.  One can certainly have a good time here, be it on the floozy or friendly side of the scale, and linger over the serious beer selection and salty popcorn.  I like it as an afterparty to the displaced-pacific-heights experience of Cafe Du Nord.

*I'm partial to bougie beer over hardcore restrooms, if you couldn't tell
author: Jennifer B.

description: There's probably not much more that can be said about Lucky 13 that hasn't already been said in 325 reviews, but I will say that this almost-middle-aged mom has never felt intimidated or out of place here.  This bar is for EVERYONE, even dogs, who can regularly be found scouring the floor for dropped popcorn.  Most importantly, there's the DREAMY bartender at Friday happy hour.  *sigh*
author: Valeria R.

description:
I...
have..
never...
been so..
plastered..
EVAR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

a night of double-fisting jameson and PBR (in a can-CLASSY!!) along with taking numerous fernet shots with the bday boy...i had one of those next morning--NEVER AGAIN MOMENTS...BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: omar b.

description: Used to love this place. Here tonight from out of town and it has apparently become a country bar. Not even "good" old country. Someone stop this and bring it back to the punk rock bar it was!
author: J W.

description:
This place has all the components of a favorite, complex drink:

1) savory, in the form of free popcorn
2) sweet, in the form of friendly people and bartenders
3) slutty, in the form of the boob picture book they keep behind the bar
4) cheap, in the form of cheap
5) fun, in the form of the excellent foosball table
6) dance-inducing, in the form of a spectacular jukebox

Sure, I'll have another round of Lucky 13s, in the form of a lush!
author: Ravena F.
Joe C.

description:
Popcorn goddesses swimming in the sea of flickering gold fish. 
Vodka crans, singing praises of pink drinks to the sweeping array of PBRs and Stella stars. 
Whispering trees sway to the rhythmic winds of the city,  soothes the aching soles and fills the lungs on the back patio.
Ushered up to the choirs of Foosball heroes and Pinball wizards. 
Black light posters, black cats and pounding floors of Sublime. 
Creatures of the night commemorate the moment in the intimate recesses of the photo booth.
Gems shooting into black holes on the green velvet terrain. 
Sitting up, standing down, grazing the pasture of jukebox dreams and postcard memories, rocking and rolling along the graffiti strewn walls. 
Concoctions brewed by masters of potions tonics and fun.
author: Mary Ella D.

description:
Giving a punkabilly joint such as the Lucky 13 five stars almost seems like sacrilege. Shouldn't I be chopping away at their rating every time I see someone at the bar who isn't inked with a sparrow tat on their neck or discussing the torque of their newly bored-out bike?

Well, yes.

But we are trapped in San Francisco -- land of smug indie hipsters and real-estate developer scum -- so it's hard to blame Lucky 13 for the fact that its clientele isn't solely limited to greasers who can sing along with every word of "Why I Drink" by the Candy Snatchers.

Frankly, the Lucky 13 has so much going for it that I wish the owners could give lectures to other entrepreneurs about how to properly run a goddamn bar. Key topics:

- Stock your juke with custom CD-R mixes, especially those heavy on classic punk, obnoxious outlaw country, and cocaine-blues rants guaranteed to offend the PC Police while simultaneously instigating the alkie regulars to spin a solo waltz on the bar-top.

- Free, greasy, salty popcorn makes customers thirsty.

- A wide selection of beer doesn't necessarily make you a metrosexual, pompous ass...it just makes easily-tricked drunks buy more expensive beer when they're tired of buying $2 bottles of Pabst.

- Filthy bathrooms help separate the wheat (i.e., hard-drinking regulars) from the weak-ass chaff (i.e., khaki-clad weekend warriors).

- A happy "hour" that runs from opening time until 8 pm really, really makes you want to buy a liver-crushing load of beer.

Clearly, I have spent too much time here. But why not?

For those who despise slick and trendy lounges, Lucky 13 may be San Francisco's best antidote.
author: John G.

description:
best pickled green beans for your bloody mary drankz!
popcorn and patio in the back
Chimay Blue


( | )
author: Grace M.

description:
Lucky 13 is where I get illegal at. I'm loaded...so what!?!?

Here's a little thing I just wrote, don't ask me about it!

Also, they have Racer 5 for amazing discount prices AND BBQ's on SUNDAYS!!

So what I'm  really trying to say is just...
We don't need this 
It's not necessary to have this little trist
Come on man
Lets shake hands 
And don't worry about the blood covering my fists
Cuz really it can only mean one of two things
Either I just fucked someone up or recently slit my wrists
And it doesn't really matter, if you think about it
Really man, I'm dangerously sane
Oh, the smell of burnt cocaine?
What, I'm supposed to inhale it? 
This whole time
I've been burning that shit
Until it's a hot slime
And rub it on my forehead so it seeps straight to my mind
You know, haven't you heard of osmoses? 
Why waste time and lines on noses
When I'm getting so high I go blind and argue with Jesus and Moses
They were really from the future
Did you know this?

Oh lord I'm not sober

OH LORD BABY JESUS!!!!

Worst Review Ever!
author: Dave G.

description:
'Suzanne B visits a place that makes her mother worry --- part 2 in an occasional series'

So, Lucky 13 would only concern my mother because she has this idea that I am a sweet and innocent flower.  In reality this bar should scare no one.  But it's definitely a place to try on a sneer and channel your long-lost punk.  

The tiny balcony upstairs is a great place for a small group that doesn't mind being cozy (very narrow!).  It is also the perfect place to be alternately amused and annoyed by those individuals who, after climbing the stairs and working their way through your tightly packed clan, stand at the back railing and stare disgustedly across a six foot gap at the ATM machine.  Word to the wise --- Lucky 13 has two balconies.  The ATM and the pinball machine are on the back balcony.  Next time you make that mistake I will poke you in the ribs as you worm your way back through the crowd.  Hey, I have to channel my long-lost punk, right?
author: Suzanne B.

description:
