Pluses - Great juke box, black and red decor, fantastic happy hour (It goes until 8 o'clock - $2.50 pints of anchor - nice!), free popcorn, cheap goldfish crackers in pint glass quantity, pool, foozball, tattoo friendly, dog friendly (good if you own a dog or like them), outdoor patio, good beer selection (some unique bottles as well as a hefty selection on tap), and did I mention the great jukebox...chock full of punk, metal, 80s, a whole lot of Johnny Cash, and just enough Tom Waits that he isn't overplayed. 

Minuses - Back patio closes at 10 (noise control), the area with foozball is 8000 degrees (its upstairs and heat rises) , it can get a bit "scenester" at times and the service can vary greatly depending on how many regulars are there. The nice thing about the minuses are that I dont play foozball, it gets cold after 10 so I dont want to be outside anyhow, the scensters only come out and play on the weekends and I am regular enough to get good service.

That being said - tip well, bartenders work hard, especially when the bar is as long as this one. It has been my experience that if you tip them what they deserve you will be served more quickly once the place fills up. Many more pluses that minuses so I give it two thumbs up!
author: Drue C.

description:
My favorite bar in the city ... thank God I don't live conveniently close. 

Great place if you like good draft beer - there are good microbrews and Belgians on tap all the time. Excellent selection of bottled beers too. Likewise, a great place to practice drinking your standard 10-18 year old single malts. Some very stiff mixed drinks can be had when the bartender has determined you're suitable. Cheap drinking is a possibility.

There are hipsters here but typically they're outnumbered by the cute goth-punks, and the crowd has some older drinkers too. Except for the occasional group of 25 year old girls squealing like eighth graders, the clientele is pretty well behaved.

Normally it doesn't get loud and busy until 10PM, so Lucky 13 is a perfectly reasonable place to meet for drinks and conversation.
author: Joseph H.

description:
Ahh Lucky 13.. where I fell in love with my ex boyfriend.
And I love it regardless. ;)

Fun place, cool vibe - lots of shit to look at.
Good drinks
Photo Booth
Lil doggy running around all over the place.. hella cute.

basic divebar bathrooms
Great neighborhood for drinkin n people watchin
I need better hobbies!

*Good times*
xoxo
author: T C.

description:
Why is it that at bars like this people are always nice and at places that are nice the people are bastards?

The world may never know.

Popcorn. 
Space to breathe.
Loud music.
author: Mat K.

description:
Great beer on tap in addition to fab imports: Chimay, Duvel, Hoegarten..... Good jukebox. When you need to feel like yer in Amsterdam, sans "space-gateau", this is as close as it gets. Crowd varies. Used to be lots of Robert Smith, Morissey, Joe Strummer look alikes. Now it's kids that just want to get their beer, Castro and Convo on. Uber friendly bar keeps...in an "Aye Pirate" sort of way, keeping the bar workin' smoothly. Great spot to meet up with friends for a chat and a pint. 

Last time I was here a Boston Terrier was kickin' it on a bar stool. I think he/she was lookin' for a date. 

4 Sir Charles Barkley's
author: Johnny C.

description:
Reasons to go:

1. great outside patio to sit and have a few smokes whilst you waste a whole sunny day drinking outside
2. good music
3. plenty to look at inside, if you are into punk/rock vibe.
4. Good prices

Reasons to NOT go:

1. The bar can smell like downright butthole if you go in on a hot day, or in the morning before it has aired out.
2. The bar gets hot as a mofo as the night goes on, and as it gets busier, you are forced to go upstairs, which is even hotter
3. Patio shuts down at 11pm
4. Service/bartender service can be spotty. I have had some great service some visits, and then i will get the fckn worst service at other times

If you like loud music, cheap drinks, and interesting people, you'll probably like this place. If you have thin skin, and get real bitchy if the bartender doesn't think you are the most important person there, don't bother.
author: J B.

description:
Let me start out by saying that 13 is my lucky number...

This is definitely one of my new favorites in the city and is the new rival to Zeitgeist for my liver's attention...They've got a great jukebox with all my old favorites on it (if only there was some Minor Threat it would be a perfect juke), a real laid back atmosphere and great Happy Hour prices on drinks. There is enough seating so when you have a crowd of about 20 people you can still be comfortable and you don't have to have everyone stacked up like cord wood. Plus the place is dog and motorcycle friendly and has pool...I will be back on a regular basis.
author: Todd E.

description:
The kind of place where you expect the bartenders to be mean to you, but they're not. Now, some might say that's because they're posers, or not authentic, or faux punk or something, but you know what? I hate when bartenders are assholes. It's the SERVICE industry, people. I treat you with respect, you treat me with respect, dig?

That said, the cute girl bartender was totally nice even though she looked all hard and tattooed, and I appreciated that. 

Also, I liked that the drinks were priced at $4.00 even, which is perfect because you hand over a finski and you have perfect change for tipping. I hate when drinks are $4.50 because who wants to be the asshole who tips two quarters??
author: Megan W.

description:
-3 beers for 9$ during happy hour? 
Dope.

-Dark lighting for dark deeds?
Way Dope

-Clean women's bathroom with fun wall graffiti?
HELLA Dope.
author: Jay H.

description:
Graffitti'ed toilets? check
Tattooed bartender? check
Rock n roll jukebox? check
Multiple beers for under $5? check
Happy hour? check
Regulars slumped on their regular stools drinking their regular tipple? check
Patio? check
Guy playing catch with his dog... err, yeah, check

So hello, Lucky 13. On my quest to drink my way around the many many dive bars in SF, I happened upon you. And your free popcorn. We ate so much, I think we really needed to actually pay for it. Maybe thats normal. The bar was pretty empty (it was a Monday night) so we have plenty of choice for seating. The bar stools swivel... which is hours of endless drunken fun, especially when you are suddenly taken out by the dog chasing for pieces of dropped popcorn on the floor under your feet. I will be back to spend my hard earned pennies again.
author: Catriona C.

description:
While it's not exactly my scene, I've had a good time the several times I dropped by. Let's review:

-There are plenty of beers on tap, including my Pilsner Urquell. Excellent. 
-There's plenty of space here and it's great for bringing a big group of friends.
-Drink prices aren't bad at all. Solid.

This place wins.
author: Ryan V.

description:
I have gotten Lucky here many times in many ways but this was a really Lucky one..... 

Date: Undetermined but sometime in 2004.
Place:Lucky13 
Lucky Specimen: An individual (Will call this individual Mr window) who worked at a very popular restaurant at Church and Market and  lived next door to Lucky13.

So Bambi is at the bar chatting it up with the Manager as Mr Window walks and sits next to Bambi saying hello. Bambi blushes and offers to by Mr Window a drink. Offer is accepted, conversations start. Others join in. Shots are flowing. Legs are rubbing. Eye contact is heavy. Lips lock. Decision is made to take this engagement further next door. The staggering starts. Up the stairs into the apartment. Bambi is pushed to the mattress then something goes boom glass breaks lights come on... Wow

 Mr window forgot his 2 books shelves were behind the bed next to the front window of the bedroom drying  from paint and are now hanging out the window about to kill the public on the street. 

2 Weeks go by... Bambi runs into Mr Window at AMBER. This time Bambi is buzzed and Mr Window is ready to be carried on Bambi's back. With the help of a friend we Drag Mr window back to the Apt.

Lights come on. Shelves are gone and Mr window is dropped on the matters with no kiss or rub just a clean drop. Bambi exits. 

I LOVE LUCKY 13.

Bambi
author: Teddy d.

description:
I feel at home hangin out at Lucky 13. It reminds me of the good ol college days in Chico. A great dive bar blasting rock music with a full bar, and many beer choices on tap (even lambic on tap!) & bottled! 

The atmosphere is great, and the crowd is a mix. They have an upstairs which is split into two. One side even has pinball machines! They also have a patio. 

And of course, my over hyped Japanese self will attack the photo booth!

The bartenders were quick to serve me despite the amount of people. And they seemed pretty friendly. But why did I knock off 2 stars if I enjoyed the atmosphere? 

Minus 1 star: The bathroom was DISGUSTING! I felt like I walked out with a newly infested disease. One toilet was clogged of poop, toilet paper everywhere, and it reeked! 

Minus 1 star:  I once enjoyed free popcorn that bars served. NEVER NEVER EVERRRR will I put my hands in free bar popcorn. Some douche decided to put their chewed gum IN the basket of popcorn. Thanks for the share of ABC gum, but now I have a bathroom poop infested disease PLUS some kind of mouth disease. *scrapes tongue with rake*  I hope they find a way to keep the popcorn safe. 

So next time I'll be much luckier by not eating the popcorn or going to the bathroom. I'll indulge myself in the awesome beers, music, and photobooth! I shall be back, and expect to be a Lucky Cat, not dirty Cat. :)
author: Catherine O.

description: I wish they still had the Polaroid one and I bet a lot of people do, but they have digital one now.  Can't say too much about it except it is a photobooth...
author: Gene X.

description:
This is the worst bar I've been to since I've lived in San Francisco. The clientele are cheesy and extremely rude. I had not one but two drinks "accidentally" spilled on me by people who declined to apologize. I'm all for rowdy fun but there was a really bad energy there, people seemed angry and unfriendly. Absolutely NO atmosphere (or maybe that of a Hot Topic store in the Mall) and NO sense of community. Yes, chain wallets and pink faux leopard print live on at Lucky 13.

....and their photo booth took $3 from me without holding up its end of the bargain.
author: Elle B.

description:
Do you know I've never made it past the second table in this place in all the times I've been here? Imagine if I had made it upstairs or to the back--I'd probably need to ask Nish to buy another star! 

Stiff drinks from sexy-ugly bartenders (you know "sexy-ugly," right? if it were a club, Mick Jagger would be President, and Courtney Love would be VP), smutty bathroom walls, superb jukebox, always a great crowd--especially if you're there with Yelpers! And you know I always give bike-friendly places a bonus star.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
I get pretty sick of the juke box because everyone plays the same Misfits song and it's almost guaranteed that at some point during the night "Ace of Spades" will be heard at least once. But most likely five or eight times. 

There's this one dude bartender that looks really tough but is way nice and very fast. The bar itself is super long and I've only ever seen it staffed by one person, causing general slow service. It can also be sort of awkward at times if you're not sitting at the bar, because you might be waiting to order a drink at one end when the bartender is what seems to be 87 feet away. And of course I'm not some douche bag that's shaking my three dollars in the air and whistling, so i end up relocating myself. Blah blah blah.

Anyway, the women's room (never too gnarly)  has 2 stalls, which is really rad for a dive bar. The Erotic Photohunt game is set at the end of the bar by the pool table and the popcorn machine, a perfect location for an inept pool player like myself, who happens to be very good friends with Miss Pool Shark herself, Julie Andrews. And because I'm a great big fat person I  always have room for a basket of stale free popcorn.  As a result, you can find my seemingly lonely ass at the end of the bar, drinking PBR, eating popcorn, and playing Erotic Photohunt (only the babes, though. The dudes are weird). But really Julie's there with me, just playing pool with the cooler kids. So I don't suck that much. Really, I don't.
author: Chloe S.

description:
Cheap Strong Drinks!  Yay!

What I liked about Lucky 13:
-Nice outdoor patio area with picnic tables and plenty of seating.
-Aforementioned cheap, strong drinks
-Multi-level design (sure, it means that your party might possibly be scattered all over the place, but I liked the layout)
-Random, funny bathroom graffiti
-Friendly, happy crowd (even the non-yelpers)
-Super easy public transportation access

What I didn't like about Lucky 13
-Super slow bar tenders.  Seriously guys, I'm trying to fork over wads of hard earned cash!  Could you at least pretend you care a little?
author: Renae H.

description:
Lucky 13 has a great vibe, it's never crazy packed, they have a TON on great beers on tap,and it's my favorite place to people watch and have a beer.

This coming Friday on 13th is there 13th year in Business anniversary party, defintely a place to be. TODD, Happy hour here? plz. DYL tours here........
author: Stanley K.

description:
#2 on my 5 Best Bloody Mary's in San Francisco list!
#3 on my Best Margaritas List!

Also probably in my top 3 favorite bars in SF. Amazing jukebox (from Tom Waits to the Misfits and back again). Pool table, pinball, free popcorn and a back patio. Good people and a great mix of people of all shapes and sizes and colors and preferences getting along and having a cocktail or three. Tons and tons of beers on tap and in the bottle. Coolest bartenders around.

I'm a fan.
author: Josh C.

description:
I'm really bad at math, I mean seriously horrible. I'm a finger counter who gets flustered and confused when I receive bills at restaurants where I have to divide, add and whatnot.

Last night I took a cab from North Beach to Lucky 13. The ride cost around $13. I gave him around $19 (which I figured out after I got inside), which made my driver look like he wanted to kiss me, which actually would have been ok because he was a funny guy.

Irritated over my mathematical short-comings, I put my stuff down with the friends I had met there and went to the bar to order a beer. 

"A Stella please"

"You're 21 right"

"Oh stop, you're too kind (bat eyelashes, twirl hair, etc)"

"That'll be $3.50"

(like the lady I am, I mounted the bar and threw my arms around his big neck while I planted a smacker on his cheek.....ya, no, this didn't happen, but you could imagine what it would be like if I did)

For the cheap beers alone this place rocks my world, and my wallet. It definitely made up for my over-tipping.

The place is a dive bar, which I happen to love. Dive bars are my thing. Take me to a swanky place with low-hanging lights, steel accessories and oddly placed beds, and it's like I've taken a trip to Narnia. But bring me to a dive bar and I've found my center.

They looked like they had a nice variety of games, but I stuck to the cheap beers and conversation with some ladies I was catching up with. The customers were varied, a little more grizzly then the places I've been going lately...Thank God. But here's a little note to the two bald headed men who approached us:

Do I look like I know anything about the UFC? 

Asking girls if they know anything about UFC or boxing is just about the worst pickup I've ever heard. Don't expect chicks to know what you're talking about or humor you when you bring up shit like this.
Just a clarification.
author: Sammy S.

description: This is what a hole in a wall bar is folks. You walk in and it smells like dirty smelly socks, once you get past that your good. If you like to play bar pool this is a cool place. Although from the outside it looks rough the crowd inside is very diverse, you have your hipsters, bikers, punkers and locals that come here.  This place gets very packed, they have seating around the bar, tables and a small upstairs area. The bar staff is pretty cool too. Great hole in the wall.
author: X X.

description:
I'm torn about this review.  I was going to give Lucky 13 four stars because of the enjoyable times I've spent here, but someone I dislike (Mr. Worthington) has a Lucky 13 sweatshirt and wears it often, and if he likes Lucky 13, there must be something wrong with it.

This place is really loud.  It can also be really crowded.  Neither of these things is horrible in the kind of bar this place is, but if you're not in the mood for it, it won't get any better as the night wears on, so you should leave now.

The jukebox has some amazing stuff; it reminds me of L.A.'s KROQ from the mid-1990s.
author: John S.

description:
I like the margaritas and beer selection. My dog likes the people, barbecue days and all the popcorn. Overall it's a great combo for us.

Oh and pinball!
author: Meryl K.

description:
Ohhh!!! So this is what the Lucky 13 in Alameda is trying to be like! Now it makes sense. Great happy hour with $4 Stoli's....The crowd doesn't care if you're there or not. The bartender was attentive and polite enough.

I'd love it if I lived within walking distance.
author: Patrick G.

description: My favorite bar in the city, hands down.  I love everything about this place.  The blacklights and posters, the very healthy beer selection, the happy hour specials, I even love the little dog that is always there on Friday after work playing catch with anyone who will pay attention to him.  I even think they have the best Jukebox in the city.
author: Luis M.

description:
Everything that's great about a dive combined with everything that's great about being a beer snob ... You can have your cake, eat it and then wipe your mouth on your sleeve at this place.

Blue-collar aesthetic prevails (thank goodness!)  No attitudes here.  Whether you are with a group of 10 or merely with your best friend, this is the place to go and unwind.

The music can be a little loud.  But who cares when you can have Pliny the Elder on tap?

And the bartenders are great.
author: Joe W.

description:
Nothing too special, but they have a little backyard patio deal, which closes at 11:30, I think :( 

BUT BUT BUT they have pints of Goldfish crackers and free popcorn and the bartender  chick with the pigtails is really nice.
author: Liza W.

description:
If you gave this place 1 star recently, Delerium has been missing you. 

Lucky 13 is awesome. Sure, it's more than a little rough around the edges, but that's half of its character. Sure, it gets crowded on the weekends, but the drinks are strong so you don't need to venture back all that often, and any bar with free popcorn and a photo booth is a great time. 

If you're gay, I've been hit on by more than one good looking rockabilly and/or punk rock girl at this bar, so at least there's something for the ladies. If you're straight, I've been hit on by a few greasers here too, so if pompadours make you swoon, this is a good place to take in some good eye candy, if nothing else. 

I also really appreciate how dog-friendly this bar is. I always see dogs here (all friendly) so even though I don't have my own, I can still get my pet on.
author: Kat E.

description:
Damn, I love this divey little joint.  

Dark as hell (pun intended?), wide beer selection (including Black Butte Porter!), pool table, pinball, lots of seating, back patio (with the occasional barbecue)... yeah, that's pretty rockin'.  Oh, and CHEAP.  Dog friendly, friendly-unpretentious clientle, no bull kind of bar.  

The bartender was super-sweet and gave us a couple freebies for waiting.  Awesome!  Have lost a scarf here (anyone pick up a blue scarf?), but I would blame that on good libations (not a complaint).  

Don't get me started on the jukebox.  That's at least 10 different kinds of awesome.
author: Giorgina G.

description:
I've had great times here with friends. The drinks are really good but, honestly, I like the ambiance more than the drinks. It has that nice dive feeling (complete with red walls and cool posters), but with room to move around. Additionally, the jukebox selection is pretty kick-ass. 

When we're inside, we like to go to the upstairs seats. That way we can check out the shenanigans going on down below, but from a safe distance, lol. 

In addition to nice bartenders, a funky atmosphere, good drinks, and plenty of room, they have a really neat outside patio area if you want to enjoy the weather or have a smoke.
author: Deidre E.

description:
What more could you want from a dive bar?

Great beer selection both draft and bottle. Good punk/metal/alternative jukebox. Great people watching. Pool table. Not much to say, just an awesome little dive.
author: Vincent V.

description: I love this place.. the amos is great and the people are cool. Great bartenders great beers and juke.. I had my dog collar made there too and they give me treats from behind the bar.. awesome.
author: Valentino B.

description:
Great working class-Pooch Friendly, Rockabilly/Punk bar with Ice Cold PBR in the can, and Pete the Bartender at the stick. 

This is a great spot to unwind after a long day, or to gear up before a long night .

No pretense, just a nice group of billy's and punks and others with a great Juke Box and a bartender who's more concerned with running a good, clean bar than he is with preening in the mirror like some of these FIDI Chippendale wannabes. 

I like a lot of different bars in SF having worked at several as a DJ and Bartender over the years. But Pete gets my vote for service and creating an atmosphere where all are welcome. 

Plus, he's got some great Punk and Rockabilly ready to go on the house Jukebox at all times. 

Summary: Great Bartenders, Great Jukebox, Great regulars and icy cold Pabst in a can for $2 during happy hour. 

If you are still reading this, get off your butt and go see Pete already!.
author: Bryan O.

description: Chill atmosphere. Free popcorn. Drink specials and a free BBQ (on Sunday afternoons?). And of course they pass the basic test, Boddingtons is on tap.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
My enthusiasm for this bar has dwindled, but I still frequent it.

The bar is a punk rock bar, kind of. There are a lot of punk posters on the walls and punk and other rock music on the jukebox. They have a punk DJ there on the weekends, which is awesome. But there are also a lot of hicks that drink there. Its kind of weird.

The bar tenders are nice to you if they like you. They can also be assholes. My friend was not only refused but kicked out because he had a legitimate German ID. So was another peer on a different occasion. Someone was kicked out without reason once.

There are barecues here, and a cool back area to chill at. Its a very big bar.

In the afternoon, this place is very, very mellow. In the evening, its packed and rockin. I went here on Halloween and it was the best bar I went to, full of interesting young people getting hammered. 

The drinks are hella good and aren't overpriced.
author: Alexander W.

description:
I love the Lucky 13, and do you want to know why?  


The photobooth.


Oh, yeah, and they have a pretty good beer selection too.
author: jen n.

description:
If you're looking for a good dive bar with cheap drinks.  You just found it.  

I don't smoke, but if you do - go to the garden seating in the back and enjoy the 2nd & 1st hand smoke together.

Best part: HUGE beer selection & they are heavy-handed on the liquor!  What more do I need to say?
author: Bessie T.

description:
I'm not sure why Lucky 13 is classified here as a gay bar.  It's on the upper edge of the Castro, other than that...been there maybe 20 times and I wouldn't describe it as a gay bar.  Mixed crowd like most other not specifically-gay bars in the City.

The beer selection is really overwhelming, and that's a good thing.  Lots and lots of hard-to-find beers like Delirium Tremens, chalkboarded menus of what's available are above your bartenders' heads to make that decision even tougher.

But my hands down #1 reason to go to Lucky 13 is their pants-shittingly good jukebox, which is heavy with classic punk, 80's new wave, Johnny Cash, good metal, pretty much 95% of what I would put on a jukebox if I owned a bar.  PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE owner(s) of Lucky 13 don't ever change it to one of those soulless, touch screen things that have been spreading (at least around the Reno area) like a contagious disease.  

Whoever burned the Lucky 13 compilations on the jukebox especially deserves some kind of award, not just for the great taste in song selection, but for the awesome CD covers--my personal favorite being the Richard Ramirez photo where he has Lucky 13 burned/tattooed into his palm.   You know it's time to fuckin' rock, when you're drinking and looking at that, about to play some punk ass tunes.

The crowd used to be better in years past,  until average Joe douchebag thought it was a cool place to hang out and gain some points by "hanging out" with punks.  But hey there's plenty of booze and, hands down, best jukebox ever.  Murrio's Trophy Room (upper Haight) has a pretty kick ass jukebox too, but nothing compares to those compilations.  I raise my beer to the unsung hero who put those suckas together.
author: The D.

description:
There was a dog sitting on the bar...so that's something.

Lucky 13 provided more pleasure than I expected but I tend to judge books by covers, liquor by the size of the bottle, and women by their choice of fetish-wear. This place is much bigger than I assumed from looking at the entrance. It's a really long bar. There's a second level and a patio. You could have quite a party here, if you're like me and know how to. I honestly only remember that I drank, not what I drank, but if I had had a complaint it would have registered somewhere in my memory. Good on ya, Lucky 13. Someday I will return.
author: Matthew V.

description:
Great big dirty martinis, nice bartenders, unisex bathrooms, oh wait, I just THOUGHT they were unisex! (Yes, i had already drank those dirty martinis, yes, I really had to pee, and YES, there was a guy in the bathroom already going.... sorry, Mingus!)

.... ANYWAY.... This place has a great, easy going feel to it, totally down and dirty, and I don't know about you, but all I need is cool people around, great drinks, and a place to sit and I'm pretty darned happy!

Lucky 13 had all that! Plus, I never had to wait long for a fresh drink. I can't vouch for the ladies' room, but the men's room seemed fine. ;-)
author: Shari D.

description:
Definitely my kind of bar.  Drinks are very reasonably priced.  Vibe is cool and there are many activities to keep you entertained.  They have foosball, a pool table, photo booth, an outdoor patio in the back and a couple of funky upstairs sections to hang out "above it all"  

I'm definitely coming back here at some point.  They even have a number of Late Night Dining options in the area like Sparky's, Baghdad Cafe and Orphan Andy's.  All walking distance and that's an important feature for a bar I would say.....

Oh yeah, and they have FREE POPCORN too!!

HAPPY HOUR DEETS:
Daily happy hour (4pm-8pm) features $1 off pints and 50-cents off well drinks.
author: Mark W.

description:
If you are from NY and gay, I'm sure you've been to Pieces. That was my go to spot for me and my gay husband for the entire summer of '07. Partly because they had REALLY STRONG, cheap cocktails, fun nights like "Balls to the Wall Bingo" and Karaoke Tuesdays and partly because he lived down the street and this was his neighborhood bar. Nevertheless, it was a great bar indeed. 

Ever since coming to SF, I haven't really found a bar like that. Like the mostly gay, but straight friendly, themed night, really smelly, strong, cheap drink neighborhood bar. But then I walked into Lucky 13 and everything changed. 

The service is good, the drinks are reasonably priced and strong! It's smelly, straight friendly, divey and totally have the neighborhood bar feel. And one of the best things ever to put in a bar, a PHOTOBOOTH!!! 

Case in Point:

http://static.px.yelp.com/photo/T6DZD-mOxV2cpkyNv87vxQ/l
http://static.px.yelp.com/photo/Grnmhji3V6RahyBui_JHoQ/l
http://static.px.yelp.com/photo/FLIQshBDYRMx6hIEPEEkQw/l
http://static.px.yelp.com/photo/NGaKLAnDHot5BBtwX6XWgw/l

I was DRUNK and somehow thought it would be a good idea to put my twins in the picture... And Seong's face is Priceless!!!
author: Jen D.

description:
I suppose I should be disappointed that the night I went there, there weren't any bands or strippers. I was just waiting for a sold out show at Cafe du Nord to end, so I could meet up with someone.

I did spend some time trading stories while having a few drinks with someone who was in the same situation, so that was cool. It actually led to my first and only "missed connections" post on craigslist, so that was really cool.

I'm not sure whether the bar caters to "rebels" or "faux-rebels." I think it might be the latter, but I'm suspending judgment for another visit. I'll have to remember to wear more black the next time I'm there 'cause I'm fresh out of tattoos.
author: Timothy O.

description:
When H.G. Wells wrote The Time Machine, I believe he envisioned Morlocks hanging out at a place like Lucky 13 at sunset after a hard day of underground toil and having a couple beers before venturing out to feast on the Eloi partying down the street at The Orbit Room.

It's big and dark. 
There are pinball machines.
There is punk rock and Johnny Cash on the jukebox.
There is a patio area out back with room for 25 or so. 
There is good beer. 

We can debate whether or not Lucky 13 can be called a 'Dive Bar.' I am of the opinion that it tries a little too hard to be what it is; None of us are perfect. If I had to choose I'd take the Lucky 13 in Alameda over this one, but both of them are worth it.
author: matthew r.

description: I was born on the 13th..so 13th is my lucky number...that said, this place is always good times..
author: Mimi T.

description:
You have multiple types of Chimay and an assortment of other lovely beers. I love you for that.

I also thoroughly enjoy your bathroom graffiti.
author: Beth G.

description:
Somehow I actually went here twice in one day.  Once at the very beginning of the evening (actually, it was still the afternoon) and once at the end.  My second visit would have earned this the usual 4-star, good-but-not-great bar review.  But coming here in broad daylight...now that I could get used to.

Decor here is very punk, with black walls and lots of intentional grafitti, jukebox that mostly contains punk compilations and stuff like Motorhead.  But luckily the 'tude seems to be mostly for show.  The next thing you notice is the spacious beer collection: they had several kinds I'd never tried before, which is a great way to get a bonus star in my book.  Plus it was all damn cheap, at least during the day.  Oh yeah, and lots of free popcorn.

Overall, the perfect yin to Cafe du Nord's yang.  Now I just have to try the Expansion Bar.
author: Wes M.

description:
Fun dive, one of the better ones I've been to.

Great choices of drafts and bottles plus they rock a full bar. 
With raspberry Lambic on tap (not to mention tons of other flavors in bottles) and the ability to switch to a Sapphire and Tonic at any point in the night, I was totally satisfied. Love the patio area with trees and tables, and the drinks were very reasonable. Happy hour will get you another dollar of any drafts so go to Luck 13!
author: Theresa T.

description:
Typical dive bar (don't even THINK about tryin' to pay with a credit card), complete w/ old pool tables and a jukebox w/ a lot of alternative / punk music.

Plenty of good beer options too. Great for groups. If you go on a weekend and you want a table, better get there early...
author: Wes F.

description:
A lot of folks call Lucky 13 a dive, and that may be true, but it's one of the friendliest dive bars I know. Inside it's dark, kinda loud and it smells a bit off, but you can't beat the fun you'll run into within its depths.

With a massive selection of beers and a great jukebox stuffed with every punk hit you can think of, the 13 is an awesome spot to get a group together and make a night of it. Try to get to the back patio, it's a great place to hang out and catch up with everyone. 

The drinks are cheap, the popcorn's free and there's plenty of food options in walking distance for when you're 3 drinks in and proclaim to all who care, "I think I want a pizza!" 

Finally, I leave you with the words of wisdom I witnessed on the bathroom wall:

"I have seen the Metroid's children"
author: Andy A.

description:
The crowd is lackluster, I've never gotten laid by a guy in this place.....is it even gay?

It's not everyday that I come here. Hell, it isn't even once a month. But there is a special place in my heart for this dump. It has an ambiance to it that you might not see if you focus to hard on the decor. The bartenders are pretty awesome, although they change whenever I visit....they make strong drinks and can keep you well entertained. 

This place has a tiny upstairs are too where you can people watch...well not so much, but they have a foosball table and some pinball machines up here to entertain your drunk ass for a bit while you chatter on about memories past.

I am not a sceener, but I enjoy a good divey punk bar every now and then. I approve of this one.

5 Big Red Ones.
author: James J.

description:
Very important updates after finally making it to Lucky 13 Thursday night and I brought Pants. Turns out the bar is very dog friendly. So friendly, they let Pants have a barstool all his own and even gave him a couple treats. 

Also, they have cheddar Goldfish, by the pint glass, for only $1. Only free could top that. 

Really pleasant bartender, great music (again), not overly crowded.

Hello photobooth! But $5? Really...
author: Angela N.

description:
Possibly my fave local dive - the only thing that surprises me about this place is that there are not more people there when I go. There's always a table for us to sit at anytime we go! But this place is never empty - or, at least, never quiet. I guess it's one of those places you either love or hate - like a real dive bar! Dark, black walls and ceiling, "lucky" and "unlucky" posters on the wall - Cramps, b-movies, kitsch ,and the like. Killer jukebox - hardcore punk, hardcore metal - and a cute, off-beat, punk, goth, metal, grunge clientelle to go with. 
One time, we were sitting at a table by the door, and a guy rides in on his new vintage Harley, pulls in about 20 feet, revs it up for about 20 seconds, and shuts it down - awesome - all were smiling and nodding silent approval - gobsmacked - that was so cool, but hey, we can take it!
author: Kingpin X.

description:
Lucky 13 is my new favorite bar.  

The place just feels good.  I'm convinced it's the feng shui.  The skylights, the color red, the bartender who is just friendly enough, the jukebox rocks, the back patio rocks, pool table, video games and (drum roll please) ..... a photo booth!  Rah!

Lucky 13 rocks!
author: James M.

description: They've painted over the community character guestbook (a.k.a. graffiti), rearranged the pinball machine area, fixed the pool table area. it looks like there's more room over there. Oh and they cleaned out back and added a stall door for the toilet!
author: Drew T.

description: Found Lucky 13 last summer on yelp!..  We drove from Eureka...  Coooool ass bar...  All cash no bull...  Our jagger shots were vvverry generous...  We had so much fun smokin weed n gettin hammered on the patio that we forgot we had to jam out for Matisyahu...  Barely made it to the concert...  Lucky 13 memories from only 1 time they're awesome!..
author: The X.

description:
I find this sad to write, because the outside is SO COOL . The inside is okay, but maybe this place just reminds me too much of being 20 and going to places like this and getting blind drunk because I hadn't figured out yet that the buzz part was the fun part, not the part where the dark bar gets darker, or the spinning part, or the part where the throwing up happens.

I can go in here for a beer every so often but I don't see the attraction of staying. Anymore.
author: Karsten P.

description: Local vibes, cheap beers, serious pool table (no doubles, subs, etc), good beer selection, GREAT PRICES, free popcorn.
author: Tom L.

description:
This dive bar certainly has a lot of potential that I didn't use to the max when I was there last time. I guess I was just too busy drinking and wondering why nobody ever ever went to the ladies bathroom but me. I was there for like a couple hours and I went to the bathroom for 4 or 5 times! You think I would met another drunk ladies waiting in line. Nooo...it was dead empty and ridiculously pretty clean for a dive bar bathroom. No tissues on the floor and I was even surprise there's no pee around the toilet seat. 

Ok, I guess now I'm just obsessing on the bathroom while they do have other great qualities like the fact they have popcorn and photobooth! Mix drinks are priced okay cause I could get a bigger glass at the Knockout for $4 gin and tonic, but I'm not complaining. I had a good time. Correction, I had a good drunk time.
author: Perry S.

description:
I haven't been there in a while, but many fond memories are connected with the Lucky 13.

There's the fact that the floor is so sticky that it prevents you from falling over drunk because your shoes are glued to it.

There's actually funny graffiti in the ladies' room, which is really rare.

The outside of the place is painted bright red, so regardless of how drunk you are, you'll always be able to find it.

There's that funny Terrier-style dog that rips up the little beer-cardboard-thingies and sits on his own stool.

They kicked me out of the bar on 9/13/2001 for wearing a t-shirt emblazoned with "WAR PROFITEER", which shows the random, illogical way of thinking I like to see in my supposed left-leaning dive bars.

On the downside, people are way too yuppie in order for it to truly qualify as a dive bar. The cocktails aren't really good. And both the posters behind the bar and the jukebox could use an update (come on, every 10 years or so isn't asking for too much....)
author: Tatjana G.

description:
No TVs, free popcorn, door check guy knew who I was after the third visit, hit or miss with the barkeeps but usually hit, big fat honking Fernet shots and Hoegaarden that -- drum roll, please -- GOES DOWN LIKE LEMONADE.

Oh, and there's a bunch of graffy on the walls and toilet, and something called "punk rock ambience." Whatever. Punk is dead, and this is a great bar.
author: Chris R.

description:
I used to come here more often when the Expansion was open.  But now it turned into the Metro or something, so now I only come here on summer days because of the awesome patio.  I'm afraid of Zeitgeist because it reminds me of high school, so the smaller size of the Lucky 13 patio makes me happy.  
+ Patio
+ Awesome bartenders
+ Dark interior
+ Lots of seating

- CROWDED AS FUCK during the weekends.  That's why I'm sad that the Expansion closed, because I'd go there during busy nights at Lucky 13.
- That's pretty much it.  I can't think of any other negatives.

Come here during the summer/hot days, and get here early.  The patio seating is limited but damn worth it.
author: Meh M.

description:
I've always loved this place, but needed to be reminded at a recent Yelp happy hour exactly how much I love it...

Exhibit A: They have a great selection of beers for $2.50 during happy hour and only $3.50 afterward! In this day and age of bars charging $5.00 or more for a beer, it's nice to see places that keep prices affordable. Of course, this leads to more drinking, but what are ya gonna do?

Exhibit B: The staff is very chill and friendly, and this is much appreciated...'nuff said.

Exhibit C: The size and decor of the bar is great, and they have that sweet back patio! As a result, I've never had a hard time finding a place to hang out and there's never been a lack of things to check out when I come here...

Exhibit D: The jukebox is loaded with cool tunes...where else are you going to hear Iron Maiden's 'Run to the Hills' while enjoying a brew?

Exhibit E: Love their logo, and plan to hook up some of their apparel one of these days. I hear all the cool kids are wearing their stuff...
author: Art D.

description:
Good place for a PBR or ten, or some micro brews.

A good example of a graffiti'd up bathroom.  Maybe the prototype.

However, on most nights quiet conversation is not possible here unless you and your drinking companion(s) know sign language.
author: Nelson W.

description:
On a Saturday (25Apr09) at 2:30pm, where else would a group of chickens meet? Why, Lucky 13! The cluck-a-thon was on, baby!

The prices made me very happy ($11.50 for a double vodka cran and biggie Heffie brewski) and the abundance of dogs at the bar was a tail waggers delight. REAL dogs, people. Apparently, this is where you go if you wear Carharts on a first date and think dog hair is an accessory. Cute boyz with big um, hands. Paws on the counter getting dog treats. Yes!

Anyway, I loved the atmosphere here although I think the rest of the patrons wanted us to leave. Ah, shit, everyone needs a shakeup now and then. My party had a great time with nice bartenders and chatty regulars. Def in the dive bar category, heavy on the Harley and hold the organic anything. 

Right next to the MUNI stop on Market and Church for easy access.
author: Miel H.

description:
Lucky 13 is a top-notch SF dive, & probably the second most trouble-inducing establishment in SF (for me) behind the 500 Club. Which is to say that there's something about this place that invites that little devil on your shoulder out for a waltz. When you're at Lucky 13, there's no such thing as one whiskey too many. Only later (long after you've left) do you realize the folly of your ways.

A great punkrock jukebox, $2 PBR cans & malfunctioning photobooth hilight this fine establishment. Lots of greasers, hipsters & regular Joe-types sitting side by side.

You might say it's a lot like Zeitgeist but a bit less of a hassle. Which is to say they've GOT a beer garden, but it's smaller & not necessarily their claim to fame. (Then again, is the Zeitgeist hassle not worth it?)

There's nothing not to love about Lucky 13.
author: Pete J.

description:
pool table, photo booth, free popcorn, some crazy wall decor, and hard cider.
bumpin even for a wednesday night (im sure it's a different vibe on a weekend night).
a little grimy even for a dive bar, but i dug it for a round of drinks and billiards.

p.s. apparently, it's also frequented by the famous (on yelp) tamales lady.
author: Pearl O.

description:
I normally like lucky 13, its usually a fun place to meet up with friends and just shoot the shit, but tonight drastically changed that. I was saying my goodbyes to friends on the mezzanine when some glasses were accidentally knocked over. The crowd below began to hoot, because drunk people tend to yell at big noises, and the bartender came storming up with guns a blazing. I'm sure it must be difficult to deal with drunks night after night, but I was sober, which is rare. He then feels the need to yell and scold of for because he/ and his bar back haven't been doing their job's by busing the area and leaving the rail full of towering empty pints.

I wouldn't think that the staff here would be a bunch of punk ass whiny bitches, and I guess since it is in the castro it would make sense that they are, but I don't think it's fair to think that way since plenty of the other bars in the area don't have rude ass servers like this place. 

Ultimately, at the end of the day, it's the patrons who pay Your rent bar tender at Lucky 13, so don't be such a prick. I'll be back I am sure, but I am not tipping that bar tender, and that is going to be a first.
author: danny e.

description:
So I host a weekly happy hour, and last night it was supposed to be at Cafe Du Nord - but being alerted from a friend just hours before, the place doesn't open until 8PM - and we like to get to the selected bars around 5:30.  Since I didn't want to stand in front of Cafe Du Nord with a bottle of vodka, I re-routed our group to Lucky 13, just on the same block.

So this place rocks.  I got great service, the place wasn't too crowded early, so my group and I had ample places to sit and talk, play pool, and we enjoyed the free popcorn and the $1 goldfishes (you get a LOT of fishies for a buck) very much.  The neighboorhood is great, and it's close to muni, so it works well for a few folks that might have pounded one too many.

It's a total ROCKER place, a punk rock feel that reminds me of my big hair rocker days back in the eighties.  It's dark in there, very dark, so with one or two drinks - EVERYONE IS HOT.  Enjoy.
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Lucky 13 (Hell Kat   as I call it is a cool bar to go with buddies. You also get to see some Hot Dames sometimes!

 Lucky 13 has a Flair of Rockabilly & Gutter Punk Feeling. 

Cheap Drinks,Good music as well make sure you go for BBQ and PBR's on Saturdays.

The only thing that I want to see is more diversity on people

Over  all Not Bad !
author: Alex V.

description: Love that its a dive rock bar and they have Spatent my favorite beer! They have a great selection of beers. The jukebox is rocking with great classic rock and old punk rock to listen to. They also have TVs and had the game on which was great so people who like sports can watch and have fun too!
author: Nadia N.

description:
I like free things

Lucky 13 has free popcorn AND goldfish! 

They also got: 
-an out door patio (which i REALLY like, the setting has this "friends back yard" feel to it)
-pool table (sadly only one though!) 
-pinball
-photobooth
-juke box (not a bad selection)

The bartenders are awesome. They always mix me a new drink if i'm bored with my regular selection. Also their service is speedy which i like so i can get my drink on! 

Since Cassidy's closed down this bar has taken it's place. If you havent tried this place it's a shame. I love it and so shall the rest of you!!
author: Tedi O.

description: Unpretentious crowd, great beer, Newcastle is always on tap, not too crowded, red interior, pool table, just the right sized tables for an intimate conversation with a friend from out of town, and I usually get pretty lucky with the parking outside. Worst case scenario you can park at Safeway and drink for 45 minutes. And it's got my favorite number in the name. How could I ask for more. There's nothing particularly fancy about this bar and that's what I like about it. Some people may not get what the big deal is... GOOD!  Let 'em drink somewhere else and give me a better chance of snagging my favorite table.
author: Laura S.

description: The staff at this bar treated us badly. Avoid at all costs...
author: Fred W.

description: I've heard about this bar for years and finally had a chance to check it out and loved it! Perfect dive bar (although quite a large space): wide range of clientele, cheap drinks, dogs are allowed in the bar - love it! - and cool vibe overall.
author: LuLu M.

description:
Easily my favorite bar.  Not only cause it's only 1/2 block from my house but it has everything.  Great jukebox, backyard smoking, pool table, foosball, pinball, huge beer selection, balcony for people watching, always fresh popcorn, photo booth, dog friendly, and by far the best bartenders this side of the Mississippi.

I always take my friends there when they come from out of town and I'm met with "wow, *this* is your local bar??".  There is always a decent crowd in there but watch out for the weekend nights.  The weekend warriors descend on the bar over crowding it sometimes giving a wrong impression of what the place is like.  I have no clue where they come from.  You can always pick these people out cause they assume the pisser is in the back.

Other then the over crowding on the weekends some times, it's a great neighborhood bar and I'm glad I live stumbling distance.  On a weekday night, you can't go wrong.
author: Steve P.

description: I'll be frank: I don't remember much about this place. It was the third venue of the night (4th if you count the ill-advised attempt to go to The Mint for karaoke, but we were only there literally four seconds). I don't really remember if the prices were reasonable. I don't really remember what was playing on the speakers. I do remember having a really great time, and an efficient if not friendly bartender, and decently strong drinks. Bonus points because my friend accidentally left his bike out front overnight (whoops, drunk cab rides) and when he went to get it in the morning it was still there.
author: Corinna K.

description:
This is one of those bars that, no matter when you walk in, you feel like it's about 11:30 pm, and everyone looks about three drinks into the night. This is truly a dive bar, complete with the cheep goldfish to snack on, the person who brings their dog, the stiff drinks, the tattoo'ed bartenders...you get the idea.

What's nice about the place is as the Castro gentrifies, the crowd you get is very mixed: a big of the Castro'ites, with people slumming from SOMA, Noe Valley, etc. You never know what you're going to get any particular night, but that's half the fun.
author: Patrick N.

description: This place makes me giggle.  Psychedelic rock posters on the bars, totally divey bar atmosphere, and a bunch of guys in their 30s and their dogs.  Awesome.  I haven't been here around peak hours though, but I'm definitely going back.  The drinks are cheap and the bartenders are friendly.  If and when I get a dog, too, I could see myself bringing it to Lucky 13 while I relieve myself (of not having a beer).
author: Bill H.

description:
It starts with fishnets. Kicks up with some whiskey. And ends in gin-filled tears.

That is what a night at Lucky 13 will to do you. You love it. You hate it. You don't remember the pictures you took in the bathroom stall or how you managed to talk the Clash with the bartendar, but the bump on your head reminds you otherwise. That and the matchbook in your pocket that reads something profound. Too bad you can't read your own handwriting.

It's dark, it's dirty and it leaves you alone. Until you want to be played with...then it's your playground. They even have a patio!
author: Jessica P.

description:
When you go out to a bar and have no idea what to expect it can be interesting to say the least. Wearing all beige made me feel a little out of place in the sea of black T-shirts, I'll admit. So I was the rebel in punk bar, go figure.

The drinks are good, strong and cheap; service is fast and people are friendly. I've never been good at mingling with strangers at bars but here I found it pretty easy. Despite looking like I was carved out of balsa wood.

It's a bitch to get to from my neighborhood but I'd gladly go Lucky 13 again, any day of the week.
author: Keith M.

description: GREAT BEER onTAP!!!! alternative crowd its all good. great place to hang out and get drunk.
author: Ann H.

description:
Two words: dive bar.

Dimly lit, not exactly the cleanest, funky grungy "decorations" (although the big swirly thing on the wall was pretty cool).  Maybe I came at an off time as well---a Friday happy hour where the drinks were so-so, the atmosphere really kind of ... dull?  I might change my mind after seeing it at a different time.

[Added 09/27/06]
But drinks on tap are reasonable and they do have a patio out back.  I still think it's dimly lit and somewhat hard to hear people inside with the semi-loud music.  So, upgrade +1 star to 3.  :)

Times visited: 2
author: Amy L.

description:
So my BF and I were in town, both for business/pleasure. We had a free evening to meet up with my cousin and Pimp Daddy. 

Pimpster recommended we meet up for some libations at Lucky 13. 

Overall rating: 4.8 -- almost a five except for that creepy guy. 

Ambiance: Loud, but not so loud and Funky -- A perfect combo!

Music: Jukebox which rocked... Misfits! 

Decor: Loved it! Take a gander a the pics... 

Beer : Pabst Blue Ribbon in a can--- Need I say more? Can't remember this other beer which came highly recommended from Pimp Daddy J -- it was strong and excellent. 

Doorman: Ahhh did this guy actually work here or was he just trying to find out where my cousin and I lived... CREEPY Or a good pick up line!?

We will definitely go back while in SF.
author: Claudine S.

description: Come here w/ the co workers quite a bit. Pool table is usually open as well as the tables/chairs on both floors. Just far enough out of the Mission to avoid lames and losers. Tall cans r ice cold, music is loud and sports center is on the tube. What else could a dude ask for?
author: I D.

description:
Hmmm what can I say....

 Lets start with the bad Is it a dive bar no!! is it a punker bar no!! is it a Rockabilly bar no!!! BUT IT IS A BRO BAR!! 

   It seems like "normal" people who want to "live on the edge" might go there and claim theywent to a dive bar. The Bartenders think its a privilage to be served by them. The juke box is ok if you like TOP 40 punk ,Psychobilly,metal,Etc  Ive seen a Better Juke at The Hideout in Reno!!
   My opinion... to posh to glam not my cup of tea.But easy to park and stumble back to your car at the Safeway!
author: Rich C.

description: My friends and I ventured into Lucky 13 after dinner tonight for a few drinks.  It was a total dive and not my typical scene, but I was pleasantly surprised.  They had great music and it was the perfect place to have an after dinner conversation.  There were plenty of people in the bar (for a random Wednesday night), but it wasn't too packed so you could actually hear what the other person was saying.
author: Andrea R.

description: I stopped here for only about a half hour but from what I could see, this is a pretty relaxed bar.  There's a back patio, that will seat a few large parties.  The space outside is definitely not as large as the ones at Zeitgeist, but it's still a cool place to relax and have a drink.  My friend paid for my drink, but I think the prices are within reason.  There's also a "boob" book where you can immortalize your upper body for the sake of ooglers if that's your thing.
author: Amy J.

description:
I don't think I remember a night where I didn't stagger a bit coming out of this bar.

I like this place because the music is loud and the booze is cheap.  And they have pinball machines, pool and foosball tables.  Parking can be a bitch sometimes.

Shot of Jamesons and a glass of framboise please!
author: Sam T.

description:
The hallmarks of a dive bar: 
1) old downtrodden drunks lingering all day on the barstools
2) a limited selection of beer (and certainly no designer microbrews or cider)
3) dark and dingy, where you are mildly afraid you might catch something by sitting down
4) strong, cheap drinks
5) a great jukebox featuring old classics

By these standards, Lucky 13 is NOT a dive bar. Sure, it has cheap drinks and the jukebox is pretty decent. But a bar awash with a bunch of hip people with sailor tattoos and a fancy selection of beers just doesn't strike me as being all that divey. That's not to say that it's bad -- I actually LIKE Lucky 13 -- but let's call it what it is... a good bar, but by no means a dive.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
My good friend used to be a bouncer at Cafe du Nord and we would always come to Lucky 13 for a shot or two before or after he was working. This is a great dive bar. The bartenders are nice, although they might be because he was friends with everyone. 

It has a little outdoor area in the back and a PHOTO BOOTH.  The bar is big and they have pool and good music.
author: Jackie G.

description: Standard SF beer selection.  Upright attitude.  As a dive, their isn't anything wrong with Lucky 13, it's just nothing special.
author: Luke M.

description:
Sadly, I think my only "5 star" reviews are bars.  I guess that's a good indicator of what makes this girl happy.

Thank you to whomever put this bar on the earth.  I just moved here from Chicago, a city known for its awesome dive bars.  So I experienced orgasmic joy when I happened upon Lucky 13, I mean, my new home away from home.

The draught beer selection is tight, the bartenders are really nice, and the music was making the drinks go down niiiice and eeeeeasy.

13 is my lucky number!
author: Jessica H.

description:
Three words: Fun Dive Bar. 
Cheap drinks, cool decor, dogs and long lost friends welcome.
Warning: Urinals do not flush. 
Enjoy
author: Rory V.

description:
Lucky 13 is one of my favorite bars in the city.  Yeah, it might be dirty and stinky, but hey - that's what true bars are suppose to be.  If their foosball table was kept in better shape, I would go there WAY more often.   It gets pretty packed on weekend nights, so going during the day on Saturday or Sunday for a few free games of pool is actually one of my favorite times to go.  Good drinks (including a damn good bloody mary), cheap drinks, free popcorn, and free pool - why would you need to leave? 

**********Bloody Mary Review**************
Another reason to go during the day is their BM.  This isn't anything special in terms of ingredients - what makes it so special is the time and care the bar tender usually takes when they have time to make one.  They usually ask how hot I'd like it and if I want a rimmed glass.  What makes it even better for me is the place isn't famous for making good bloody's - They have decent bartenders that usually need to serve hungover people - so making a decent BM is a necessity.   And since during the day the place isn't a mad house, you are likely to get it the way you really enjoy - and not some 'one taste fits all', like many other places. 

So next time your friends suggest going for some drinks, keep in-mind Lucky 13 - even it it is in the middle of the day on a Sat/Sun.

Read some of my other Bloody Mary reviews at:
http://www.yelp.com/list_details?list_id=YHu-iA23Xj2c1bVa7JROhA
author: Josh M.

description:
Never made it past the first 15 feet, pulled up a seat straight away and never moved. Apparently, there's a smoking lounge out back and a pretty good dj, but we didn't notice either. 

My review is solely based on the $5 stoli bluberri n soda (my drink of choice). Bartender even bought us a round. Let's just say my friend and I managed to get really drunk for about $30. A cheap good time. We'll be back next time our pockets are feeling empty.
author: Vanessa P.

description:
Lucky 13 is a solid bar.

Drink prices are reasonable, it crowds well, and the patio out back is a plus.

I hung out most of the night on the patio, which is a weird amalgamation of half-assed Oktoberfest and family barbecue area. It works, though.

I recommend stopping by for a few drinks if you're in the area.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Where can I go to get some delicious beer at a decent price, pet cute wandering pooches, and sit among the stars in a hidden little courtyard?  By god I found it!  Lucky 13.
I was meeting up with a friend and he suggested the place and now I too am a fan.  I don't don the appearance of a cute punk chic or sexy rockabilly babe (I do in my inner sanctums!), yet I felt part of the clan.  There to have a good time, drink beer, and listen to some good tunes.  Ah life at its best.
author: Becky T.

description:
Lucky 13 always treats me right.  Whether it's with a black velvet or a grey goose and cranberry, I always have fun.  Free popcorn, decent bathrooms, cool juke box, pool table, fooseball table, PICTURE BOOTH, outside patio...Lucky 13 has something for everyone.

If you're real lucky, you may catch a lil' pole action...I've come here plenty of times but have only seen them pop out the pasties once!
author: Jennifer S.

description: I came here after dinner once and I was impressed by the vast beer selection they had on tap and in bottles and their very low drink prices.  The music was a little loud for 9 o' clock which made it difficult to have a conversation with my date.  They are very dog friendly.  There was one running laps around the bar which made for good entertainment.  I wonder if they are owned by the same people that owns the Lucky 13 in Alameda.  They have the same concert poster decor and generally the same atmosphere.
author: Scott G.

description:
Boddington's on tap good. Jukebox selection good. Smoking area closes at 11pm bad. 

I like this place. It's pretty laid back and the music is good. And the book of boobs is brilliant.
author: Shane C.

description:
I adore this place.

Between the excellent beer selection and the photobooth and the availability of outdoor seating... it's awesome.  Great for people watching and trying new beers. The cheap drinks are also a big plus.  It's definitely a dive, but I like that about it.  People and bartenders alike are unpretentious and friendly, and in the years I've been coming here, it hasn't lost it's charm.

Big love for the Lucky 13.
author: Christy T.

description: Awesome dive bar....dark, spacious, chill atmosphere! Good alternative / punk jukebox and oh, Free popcorn...woot;)
author: Marie L.

description: One of the best happy hours in the city (runs until 8). Only bummer is sometimes the prices change depending on who is behind the counter. One day Pliny is $3, the next it's $4. Whatever, I still love this place. No bull, not too crowded, and free popcorn! They are also totally cool with bringing outside food in. Grab some Ike's and walk over. Best combo ever.
author: Alfredo A.

description:
Wowza!! Where else can Shatangi take the boss out and run into a few friends, long lost high school buds sister and favorite hardcore gay pornstars (don't forget the photo-booth) in one place. All that and a patio 

Shatangi told you
author: Njon W.

description:
Do you remember that scene in "From Dusk Till Dawn" when Salma Hayek dances down the catwalk toward an anxiously awaiting Quentin Tarantino, lifts her knee and pours a shot of whiskey down her gorgeous leg into the perved-out Tarantino's mouth!?
Amazing.

Lucky 13 kinda has the same feel as that bar - sans Cheech.

Dark, slightly sinister, rock and roll music and a stripper pole ON the bar!
Tons of beer on tap, more in the bottle and good scotch whiskeys.

Its hard to make assumptions these days, or maybe Ive just spent a little too much time in the marina, where I don't get too much attention from the laadies(said in sexxy voice) - but I definitely had girls coming up to me looking for attention.  
Ego boost - 3%.
(Note to self: come here again)
author: Ryan R.

description: The service was good and the beer was cold, and the food was free (well they asked for a donation), and this was a good dive bar.  The locals where cool a respectful.  I would come here with a bunch of friends and hang out.
author: Spencer S.

description:
The Lucky has a great crusty disposition and even better juxtaposition just steps away from the polished havens of libation in the Castro. Truth is though, that its close enough to the Lower Haight and the Mission to draw a good crowd that appreciates Slayer and the Misfits on the wurlitzer. They don't really have a wurlitzer, but damn that would be the icing on the proverbial cake. Oh and speaking of cakes, the bathrooms at Lucky are pretty heinous and could use a urinal cake or two to disguise the smell that wafts halfway up the bar.  

Other than that, its one of my perennial favorites to hang for hours and drink either good or cheap beer, depending on your preferences. Like others have said, unless its just 'booze+mixer' or shots of brown booze, I'd stick to their extensive beer selection.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Free popcorn!
Good Beer.
Outside!
Near Transit!
Hot Ladies!
Good Vibes!
The bathroom is tagged. Good view when pee'in
author: David C.

description:
The Lucky is one of my favorite bars in the city...  If I could take Henry Rollins to a bar (for coffee of course) I'd take him to the Lucky.  

* my personal favorite patron "Radio" is always running around killing people on the pool table (did you know he used to play in a jazz band??)

* Thin Lizzy?!!

* Best jukebox in the world (if you like things from the Killers to Modest Mouse to Tom Waits to DK to David Bowe to Black Flag to, yes I know this is hard to believe, but Coldplay (just kidding)

* if you're "Lucky", maybe there will be a spuds mckinsey dog chilling at the bar (he actually stands on one of the bar stools on his hind legs and rests his front legs on the table as if he's holding his paw out saying, "hey buddy...  how 'bout another??"

* there is also a smaller dog (sometimes) that will chase bubbles.  If you're blowing bubbles (for example) he'll run up your leg as if he's climbing a tree to catch them in his mouth - I think he may have been a circus dog during the last vestiges of his K-9 youth (about the time Men at Work were really big - oh, and Mr. Mr.)

* PHOTO BOOTH!!!!!!!!  What a great YELP* opportunity eh?!  ;-)

* LOTS OF BEER TO CHOOSE FROM

* and, they have Agave Tequila....  ooooooohhhhh

* close to "HOME" for a late night meal...

* why am I still trying to convince you to check it out???

I love you Lucky 13.
author: Benjamin G.

description:
Lucky 13 is what you might call mini-zeitgeist. Until you get there and see a nubile young 35 year old, stripping on the bar and grabbing twenties with labia.  You then meander towards the back patio, where you find yourself drinking in your favorite friend's backyard. Until Pappy kicks you out and eats your weed.

There's free popcorn.  There's a hot bartender.  There's a photobooth for making out in, and there's cartoon cats all over the walls.  Next time you're bored at amber come hang out with us instead -- you CAN smoke there, remember, I said there was a patio, retard.
author: Abby M.

description:
Lucky 13 is loud as fuck and I like it that way.

I used to get really drunk and make out with this guy's wife upstairs on the balcony. I'm surprised he didn't eventually kill me.

Awesome jukebox. Gotta love it.
author: Alexis C.

description:
Plentiful, cheap intoxicants. 

Free popcorn. Dangerously salty. A meal in itself. 

Genuine, rough crowd. The mission hipsters are all at Amber around the corner & the fixie degenerates are at Zeitgeist. Which leaves a homogeneous, earnest creme de la creme of whiskey swilling locals.  There is a refreshing lack of eye-candy. 

The pool table in back is comically shitty, but it always draws a crowd of very serious players.  Idunno why, you tell me.  Don't bump into them on your way to the popcorn machine.
author: Ryan P.

description:
One of the better jukeboxes in the city. 
50,000 beer choices. (approximate exaggeration)
Friendly barkeeps, if you know what you want.
Douchy for neighbors that complain about noise and force the staff to close the outside patio.
Pool table, foosball, pinballX2.
What's not to love?
author: Chadwick M.

description:
Love this place.....Pool League night took us there tonight.  Even though we got spanked, I had a really great time.  Down-to-earth atmosphere and a two-level plan make for a cool space, and they even have a back patio area.  I always love that.

Yeah, they kicked our asses raw...3 to 13.  Pretty dismal!  My mudslide made it all better...
author: Randy F.

description:
I have only been here once a couple of weeks back. The beer garden out back was very pleasant and none of the patrons creeped me out. I felt at home here whilst not "at home" since it was my first time to the place.
I will definitely come back for the ambiance and for the very decent music flowing out the door.
Comfy is good in a bar.
author: Kimberley M.

description: I've been to this place a few times and I like it more than Toronado.  (gasp) What?  Good music, never too crowded, and Pliny the Elder on tap for $5.
author: Khac L.

description:
Visited for the first time last night. The name is actually quite representative of the sort of scene inside.

Respectable beer selection, and drink prices were pretty reasonable. We took our drinks to the raised seating overlooking the bar, which was a little warmer but provided a great view of the entire bar. 

They also have a stripper pole in the middle of the bar! Let me tell you, that's some sleazy entertainment. There were a couple of [beat, drunken] ladies trying not to vomit while doing their best to be remotely seductive... ya know,  without dancing well, looking good, or taking any clothes off. It was hilarious! Seriously, d-list strippers would have been offended had any been present at the time.

Happy hour is daily until 8pm, so I'd like to check that out in the near future.

Other cool features of the place include a popcorn machine with free popcorn, pool table, 2 pinball machines, photo booth, Pac-Man, and an ATM. They also have a small outdoor patio area that's reminiscent of a miniature Zeitgeist.

Just off of the Muni stop at Church. I'll definitely be back.

Oh, and you can bring your canine friends as well. I don't think my cat would be into it.
author: Ramsey D.

description: One of my favorite bars in San Francisco.  Huge amount of beers on tap, even more on bottle, plenty of space, high ceilings so that even when it's crowded it's not too loud.  Their happy hour is great; $1 off all taps until 8 PM, which means things like $3 for a 90-Minute Dogfish IPA.
author: Zachary R.

description:
I almost never hit Lucky 13 unless I'm already in the neighborhood, but it is pretty centrally located. 
I think alot of people walk into this place with some kind of 'tude or preconceived notion of it trying to be a biker bar or punk bar or someshit, and I have no idea where they get this from. It's just a regular, non-pretty-people bar with a kickass beer selection, and a good jukebox. Isn't that enough? 
The bar staff are not exactly sweethearts, but they are efficient and friendly-enough for my taste.  
The patio area out back is great, especially since they installed more awning to shield from the rain. It sucks that the prissy neighbors upstairs insist that they shut down the patio at 11PM, but hey, it's good while it lasts.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Oh, Lucky 13.

It's a good place to go and be left to your own business while being surrounded by chill people minding theirs.

Good bloody marys, if you can convince the bartenders to make you one.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
dark- check
sleazy- check
Cheap drinks- check
Juke box- check
good bar staff- Check
patio- check

hmmm sounds like it is hitting on all the right spots. just wish the juke box had some industrial in it.
author: Mr. Rivet ..

description:
This was the "bike messenger bar" in the SF "Real-World" all those years ago.  Even as a high school student I knew that wasn't really the story, and that Puck was some kind of a poseur jerk.

Lucky 13 has Framboise Lambic on tap, as such its fairly authentic "rock and roll" lifestyle feeling is cut a bit --- this is a good thing.  This is a nice big bar, with a great beer selection, decent pours and good staff.

I was in here one night and in the men's room I noticed someone had "dropped" 50 cents in quarters into the urinal, they were just sitting there in a little pool of urine.   As the drinking continued through the night, several times I returned to the men's toilet.  Each time more money had been added to the urinal pile and a second pile of filthy money had started to grow in urinal #2.  
There was even a five-dollar bill down there by the end of the night.  I sort of visualized a creepy latex clad urine fetishist hiding up behind the ventilation grate in there, just dropping money in the urinals and waiting to get his jollies when somebody scooped up $20 in filthy change.
author: Gustie L.

description:
Lucky 13 is great.  Reasons outlined below:

1. Nice and fast bartenders
2. Popcorn (free)
3. Dogs
4. Big/not-too-sketchy bathrooms
5. ATM inside
6. Photo booth ($3.)
7. Pool table
8. Generally good music playing

Why am I not there right now?  This place is amazing.

*** UPDATE *** 
New photo booth. Now $5 instead of $3. It is digital and doesn't fit as many people into the frame. This is sad news.
author: Elena M.

description: Grab some friends, grab a glass of whisky. Meet me at Lucky 13.
author: Nikki M.

description: being from Atlanta I'm very picky about the types of bars I frequent. Lucky 13 is the type of place I would be a regular at. Now to get this city some fucking live music going on.
author: Cove C.

description:
As a straight guy living in the Castro, my choices of where I can go get a drink without getting my ass grabbed (NTTIAWWT*) are fairly limited.  Lucky 13 is an island of straightness in a sea of leather and moustaches (NTTIAWWT*).  An island well stocked with beers ($2.50 happy hour!) and free popcorn and pool.  The jukebox aint half bad either.


*Not That There Is Anything Wrong With That
author: Eugene F.

description:
Stiff drinks.
Good jukebox.
Polaroid photobooth.
Patio.
Good times.
author: Jenn S.

description:
-Racer 5 on tap, with Dogfish Head 90 Minute on occasion.
-The best motherfucking jukebox I've seen in this city: rife with 80s hardcore spread across homegrown mixes that it could take a lifetime to go through.
-Tornado foosball table in fine form (god i miss living in a coop).

Fuck you. Lucky 13 is better than your dive.
author: Dave G.

description: Great Beer for only $4 and not just during happy hour!  Now I love a good beer and don't get me wrong I do frequent my neighborhood bars like Toronado and Noc Noc for some tasty beers but that's usually at a higher price.  So I was pleasantly surprised to pay only $4 for Pliny of the Elder on tap and not too mention the rest of their great beer selections.   I like this place -  the beer selection is to my liking, the bartenders are genuinely nice, there is a photobooth (what!), jukebox, free popcorn and an outdoor patio!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Divey, douchey, and dysfunctionaI. I LOVE IT!
The patio is obviously for smokers, but closes by 11 pm. 
They have an excellent beer and lambic selection. 
Photobooths were present and functioning. That's also a plus.

Very diverse crowd here too. I think you can find every subculture that resides in San Francisco here. Minus the Marina snobs. Perrrfect.
author: Shereen R.

description:
Lucky 13 was rad. The walls were covered in Misfits posters and murals. They had Chimay. The music made me bounce a little. It was big and spacious.

This review was lame but whatev. Hopefully it was good enough to make you check it out because it's worth a drink.
author: Susan L.

description: VERY dive-y. I ended up coming here because the bar I meant to visit happened to be closed. It was fine for what it was. That said, my tequila gimlet wasn't spectacular. It's dog-friendly.
author: Catherine T.

description:
When I was a kid riding in the back seat of my parents Volvo, we would drive by this place and it scared me.  I thought it looked like a motorcycle bar like the one in Pee Wee's Big Adventure...but something always made me want to go....

Now I love that place!  It is dark, red, loud  with metal blaring from the juke box and an awesome patio I only discovered the last two times I was there.  Lots of laughs and a fun-loving crowd.  I love the red pool table, but watch out for the sharks!  They have a ton of beers to choose from and some good arcade fun.  Be sure to get a drunk picture in their upstairs photo-booth!  I have gotten pretty drunk here on Spaten...you should too.
author: Julie C.

description:
Great hang-out bar, especially when I'm in a dark mood or close.
Love the dark atmosphere, drinks selection, prices and the down-to-earth bartenders.  Been here a few times, introduced by a friend and I'm coming back!  Thanks Lisa, you r the best!!!
They have a pool table and pinball machines.  Plenty of space, fun and diverse crowd.
author: Yamil A.

description:
great dive bar!   been there a couple times, first time being on my birthday, going solely on my boss's reccomendation.  dude, he was so right!  
it is dark, loud music, all types of people.  with their dogs.  awesome.  i love dogs (a nice friendly puppy is the best when intoxicated).  their bathroom is covered in graffiti and tags.  inspiration for my future 5th bathroom. right next to that is a photo booth!   there are big tables and lots of bar seating.  and there is an outdoor back area too.  
they have sarcastically friendly bartenders, and lots of beers... including specialty beers.  they enter this contest for local bars and restaurants to brew their own beer based on specific criteria and recently won with a special sierra nevada beer.  only thing i drank that night.  

good place.
author: Katie H.

description:
Wow.

For some reason "dive bar" ends up being synonmous with "surly bartender" or "shitty beer" and for Lucky 13, neither of these are the case.

It's just what I want out of a no-bones dive bar: loud music and dim lighting. The beer selection is great in both draft and bottles. Happy hour specials are great and run until 8 most nights I think.

The bartenders are friendly as hell. It makes for a good time out and it's close to home. It also has plenty of room to sit both at the bar and the cavernous inside full of tables. So bring a friend. Or 20.

What more to want?
author: Joel P.

description: L13 is the quintessential dive bar, do NOT ask for the bartender for a drink recommendation (that is annoying at almost any dive bar, duh). Just know what you want at the get go, even if it takes a few minutes to figure that out. Sure it smells like piss and old man slippers as you walk in, that is because the bathrooms are right up front. Also, it gets mega packed and LOUD on the weekends, that is why I usually venture in during the week. The juke box is awesome and you get free popcorn. You can also play pool and video games up in the loft. What else do you need really? It's nothing fancy and sure there is some attitude from the people who work there, so if you expect to be treated well when you're an entitled douchebag yourself, don't come here then. See, it's very easy. Just be patient and know what you want to drink. Say thank you and tip. That is all. Oh and I guess they have a small back patio that is now opened, so that is a plus for sure.
author: Gina R.

description:
I loved this bar. I was lost in your big city, scared and alone, cars whizzing by and loud noises until I stumbled into the 13.
What an awsome beer selection (nothing like it in Santa Cruz)!  I drank six of them and bought a sweatshirt, I rock it almost everyday. I don't know who this kooky bartender is everyone was talking about, he was either off the day I went or I was too drunk to notice. I guess the people in their were pretty lame but I was hanging with my best friend (me) anyway. I was there to get pickled, not make friends.
author: Jaydog P.

description:
When I die they're going to sprinkle my ashes in the corner of the balcony at the Lucky 13.  

Best bar in the city.  Beer, whiskey and a rock out with your c**k out jukebox.
author: Mz M.

description:
