This bar has only done me wrong once and it didn't even do me wrong just my friend Dirty Ryan and he is crazy anyway so they probably didn't do him wrong but he just thinks they did.
A great after work spot with arguably the best drink deals in town. At least it seems that way whenever I stop by because this place never hurts me financially or emotionally. Some great memories here with Marisol and Jess(ica) help give this place a warm, sentimental thumbs up from me. That, and the friendly staff and nice folks who frequent this treasure of a bar.
author: Benji T.

description:
This place has great beers for cheap before 8PM. Free pool on Sundays. Free popcorn. And a great punk and rockabilly selection on the juke. Those things score pretty high in my book. 

Some folks complain that they can't get laid here. Well, I wouldn't  know anything about that, since I can't seem to get laid anyway or anyplace. Thank God for the Guitar!
author: Paul S.

description:
As the Zeitgeist continues to fill up with poseurs, Lucky 13 takes the same basic concept (tattoos are cool, hillbilly hardcore is all that should be available on a jukebox, all colors should be shades of black or red) and keeps on keepin' it real.

The bartenders are always super cool here, and pour a great beer selection (lots of euro/german selections). And while you may grow tired of hearing Ministry/Reverend Horton Heat/Cramps/Blasters on an endless loop, at least you don't have to worry about some drunken frat loser stumbling on Journey and leading his brothers in a sing-a-long.

UPDATE: They've done a lot of 'retooling' to their jukebox, and have put about 20 of their own 'personal mixes' in. Really pretentious stuff, too. Plus, when we were there recently, we put in two bucks and two and half hours later, still had not heard our songs. Boo!!.......
author: Andrew L.

description:
one of my favorite happy hour spots in the city.  However, their ladies room could use some work.  On my last happy hour occasion some friends and I were struck by a new dilemma - which is the lesser evil, no seat or no lock? You get this and more at Lucky 13.

Also I'm willing to go 5 stars but they'll have to fix the popcorn machine!
author: Kat W.

description:
Total loser bar....  but the staff is so friendly and nice that I can't be too mean.  They do have that crappy lil back porch too, which adds to smoke appeal.  

suggestion:  Sit at the bar and talk to the bartenders, and don't look at whats going on behind that gin and tonic of yours :)
author: Pammy S.

description:
ok, so at first after reading many of the reviews on here i was a lil scared to come here...

but once i got there, i was in love! bartenders were good, and fast. drinks were cheap and strong! it was a saturday night, we got there around 10pm, is was a nice crowd, not too packed. and what else can i say, a place with free popcorn, hell yeah! oh, and loved the photo booth idea, although at $3 per picture, it's a bit pricey, but fun!

the music was great! i heard some of my favorites while i was there... Social Distortion, Johnny Cash and even some Distillers! I'm definitely coming back for more!
author: Manny M.

description:
Friday night was my first time here----and it won't be my last!

A rad little dive, with character to spare, my first impression upon entering the lucky 13 is that the bar is huge! It extends from one end to the other, and we had no trouble finding a spot to wedge ourselves to grab our drinks. The bartender was friendly and made a pretty good long island. The beer list is extensive and impressive, too. There is plenty of space which is always nice, and they have a killer jukebox and a photobooth!!
I also noticed the popcorn machine, and the boxes upon jumbo boxes of goldfish---perfect for loadie snacking!

Thank goodness for the lucky 13... just in case you go to a show at the sweedish american hall up the street that has no bar....
author: Caddy M.

description:
I fell in love here - a little afternoon delight.  He didn't even flinch when a pretty girl came on to him, saying " I know, I smell good, like lip gloss and panties". He just looked at her, while the guys within earshot, just about fell over after hearing that pick up line.

He wasn't even thinking about getting lucky with some chick.  He was just hanging out. Checking people out, and occasionally scratching his balls... but, his ball scratching was endearing because, he is Rags the dog.  
I love Rags, and would have dog-napped him weren't he soooo content in his digs at Lucky 13.
Even if Rags weren't rubbing up against me wanting a pet on the belly, I still liked this place. How could you not like a place that lets you B.Y.O.D and B.Y.O.B.?
While I was busy petting Rags' belly, I noticed an old fart who brought in a less-than-conspicuous paper grocery bag. In that bag was a 12-pack of Natural Ice, which had one can missing... yes, he cracked one open and enjoyed at the bar. Pretty cool.
While, they have signs saying that they don't sell MGD, Bud light, and some other cheap beer, you may be able to sneak in some of your own booze.  If not, then at least you can give a good dog a bone, belly rubs, and keep him from smelling chicks' lip gloss and panties.
author: Kara B.

description:
best dive bar in the city. great beers at a reasonable price, outside area for those warm summer nights, and tom waits on the jukebox. what else do you need?

side note: despite what the categories might tell you, while everyone is welcome, if you're looking for a good gay bar, this isn't one.
author: Courtney B.

description: You can't go wrong with a punk rock bar that has a photobooth, huge drink variety and spacious back patio. I'm a fan.
author: Natalye R.

description:
another one of those darkly lit red bars.  This one has a very wide assortment of brews on tap--and even keep specific glasses for some of their brews.  Tasty!  And, better yet, you can chill with your non beer drinking buddies as well.  Amaretto Sours kept our birthday gal very happy indeed!

There's a small very well worn pool table.  The regulars were fairly nice to us early in the evening, and didn't give us crap for playing friendly bad doubles.  Apparently betting and partner pool is frowned upon here.

I did notice some pinball machines in the mezzanine, and I understand that there's a backyard area somewhere--but I only stopped in there for a quickie after work drink or two.  

Some very attractive and stylishly dressed people were in attendance too.  Lots of eye candy!
author: Rebecca R.

description:
A decent bar to drop into for a quick drink on the way home from work, on the way to a show a Cafe Du Nord, or on your way to a dangerous night in the mission.

They have an awesome jukebox, a wide variety of beers, black lights and whatnot. This bar always seems to have a nice, friendly crowd, despite the fact that the tattoed and pierced crowd that frequents this place. They've got a nice outdoor area to catch a smoke, but it closes promptly at 11pm. At that point you're relegated to smoking on the street outside. 

I wouldn't want to spend a whole evening here, but it's a good starting point.
author: Tim T.

description:
This place pretty much kicks Tinker back in it's damn.

It's a cool dive bar and the people were fun, rowdy and delicious.

I will have to come back again when it's not Pride Sunday to truly see how lucky (by lucky, I mean drunken fun) I can really get.
author: Kim D.

description:
Good happy hour, comfy stools, big selection of beers, I'm a fan.  I did trip over someone's dog when I first walked in.  So be careful of cute furry dogs when walking in. 

This bar is cash only! 

I went on a Tuesday night and there was a mixed crowd.  The bartender was really nice and attentive (granted, it was the Tuesday before Christmas).  I would definitely come back.  They have a pool table, photobooth, and I think darts? I can't wait to move out of LA and come back to the Bay.  It's hard to find bars like this in LA.
author: MissJennifer L.

description: Great place to chill and have drink. The beer selection is amazing and the bartenders make strong well drinks. There is a popcorn machine in the back, pool table, kick-ass jukebox, pinball, and back patio that is open whenever your lucky. I usually come here for one drink and end up three tequila shots deep and a new group of friends. Don't take my word for it, check it out for yourself.
author: Jose Fernando G.

description:
On a random Saturday night, the first few months I was living in San Francisco, I just walked up from my apartment over on Beale Street and made my way up to Market, where I met up with a talkative dude saying he was headed to a cool place to meet some friends.  He didn't seem weird or anything, so I thought why not.  Anyway, I ended up at the Lucky 13 doing shots of different good tequilas.  They have a cool jukebox with Tom Waits and the good indie/punk/rock stuff that every jukebox should but doesn't.  
Also, if you're seeing a show at Cafe Du Nord or the Swedish American Hall and want to kick back a few shots before the show, well, here you go.
I don't know if it's gay or straight, but it's cool to hang here and drink and do what you gotta do.
author: Kev M.

description:
How can you not love this bar? The dog at the bar on the stool? The black cat? It HAS been awhile, how I miss the cold beer, good music, and the fact that  I used to be able to stumble home on foot. 

Good drink, good folks, good music, good drink.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Love this place.
1. Right down the block from Cafe Du Nord
2. Right around the corner from my friend's house
3. Good jukebox
4. Great beer selection

Good place. They were baffled when The Professor ordered a Rose Kennedy, but I'd never heard of that particular cocktail either, so I wasn't surprised.
author: Rachel M.

description:
The best dive bar in the city.

I went here with Fiance on Saturday night. It was busy but not unberably packed. The drinks were super cheap which is great for us. They have an awesome beer selection and the vodka tonic & gin tonic were perfectly mixed.

They have an upstairs area with foosball and pool tables too.

The ATM machine didn't work and they're cash only so that kind of sucked a bit but most places are cash only around here
author: Adam C.

description:
Todd Dayton's "San Francisco's Best Dive Bars" lists Lucky 13 as the third member of the Holy Trinity of San Francisco beer bars, along with Toronado and Zeitgeist.  To expand this analogy to its logical conclusion, Toronado is certainly the Father, offering the whole width and breadth of our drunken faith, Zeitgeist the Son, with its patio of salvation and its resurrection as a bike messenger bar after its death as another kind of biker bar, and Lucky 13 is the Holy Ghost, with its spooky and spirited interior, and its transcendent balconies that allow us to reach a higher plane, both metaphysically and literally.

Okay, seriously, though, I love this place.  Although the beer selection might not be quite as interesting as Zeitgeist (and neither of the two is really any contest with Toronado), they have some nice options, particularly in bottles.  The two separate balconies are nice and allow a little makeout privacy if you so desire.  Actually, one of the things I love about this place is the sheer size of it relative to the size of the crowds.  It seems to always have a lively, moderate crowd, but you can always find a seat and can hear your friends over the din.

As at the other two figures in the Beerhead, the bartenders can verge on the surly if you don't follow their mysterious code, but the other night when I thought I'd lost my keys there, the barkeep helped me look for them and let me borrow his flashlight.  As at the others, they all seem to be reasonably nice people who just don't put up with anybody's bullshit because they know people will keep coming and keep tipping.
author: Joshua B.

description:
when I'm in SF, I wanna be here!
great vibe! great peeps, awesome drinks!
author: Diranasaur D.

description: A bombtastic dive. Cheap drinks, cool peeps and some of the greatest bathroom poetry I've ever read.
author: Alex H.

description:
- extensive beer options... check.
- free popcorn... check.
- foosball... check.
- ability to buy rolls of quarters at the bar for foosball deathmatch... check.
- convenient location... check.
- bartenders who only pause, rather than laugh at you when you order a half beer... check.
- sells cool bar logo sweatshirts that keep half of San Francisco warm... check.

See, what's not to love?
author: reb f.

description:
Now this is a dive bar. Just for all of you folks in the Marin/Pacific Heights who think the BrazenHead is a dive bar, you might want to stop in for a example. The reasons why it is nearly perfect 1. It is dark 2. It has a great beer selection 3. The bar staff is rude to the clueless, and yes if they are rude to you, you are clueless 4. There are always attractive women here who want nothing more than to have fun.

So pretty much a perfect place.
author: Seamus M.

description:
graffiti, biliards, sticky floors, monstrous chick bartenders, foose-ball, doggies that are unleashed (unlike must parks), and popcorn machines seem to make up Lucky 13. Depending on what you like, I guess I was somewhat entertained.

I didnt stay for too long but when I did I rocked that fucking foose-ball table.  Drew homeboy we need a rematch. They mustve rigged the pinball machine because that was way too easy to TILT.
author: riz l.

description:
Still, after 20 years (yes I realize I'm dating myself) - Lucky 13 still remains one of my favorite dive bars.  

I love the upstairs seating, like a little private cubby hole and the pool table in the back.  

My favorite new additions - and I say new because I hadn't been there in 4 years - are the cute English bull dog who completely entertained us by humping people's legs and the water dispenser in the back - which is all I drank there.  Would be happier with glass instead of plastic cups though.

The age range is good here!!  There are actually people my age and older - as well as younger so everyone is covered.

The bartenders waved, smiled and said "thank you guys" as we left, which was amazingly sweet since we never ordered a drink.  And, the doorman carded me!!!  LOVE THAT!  :)
author: Kimberly H.

description: Perhaps the best dive bar in the city. Plenty of great beers on tap, plus many more in bottles. Great jukebox, alternates between metal and Johnny Cash. Pool table. Few TVs that often show worst crashes videos, when not music videos. Free popcorn. Small outdoor patio out back with free grillin' Saturdays during the warm months. Very dog friendly (treats available upon request). Great memories.
author: Jake G.

description:
Luck 13:

Good music in Jukebox
Good beer selection

A+ all the way!!
author: Adrienne H.

description:
Our fav. bar in sf!  i go mostly for the graffiti in the bathroom.  always something new.  

(see below rantings!)
author: Jordan P.

description:
Dahling I love you!
The Lucky was my favorite place even before they got Area 51
because of the fantastic juke box.

It became my very favorite place when the shooting game appeared.

It was the only place where I could listen to Nick Cave and Suicidal in succession outside of my own apartment.

I must say I was deeply saddened when our Nick was removed from the music selection.
:(

I love the bartenders on a weeknight
because they are friendly and fun and the prices are excellent.

I have given up going on weekends because of the strange yuppie influx that never really went away after the dot com bullshit.

Still, even on the rare occasion that I find myself there too late on a weekend-eve there are often interesting people who buy me drinks...
there was even a wedding party there once and the groom insisted that my friend and I pound PBR with him while his friends face planted one by one on the table.

Verrrrrry interesting.

Oh I just love the Lucky.
If I could give it six stars I would.
author: Trixie R.

description:
Heard good things about this place, but was a little apprehensive since I'm not exactly the punky rocky biker crowd. Checked it out with a group of friends last night and it turned out to be a lot of fun, though! The bartenders are super nice/funny, and they gave us a pint of free goldfish crackers -- A++. And except for a moment of weirdness when I first walked in, I felt comfortable and at home. It's got a a lot of personality, is kind of tacky, but not, wasn't too crowded, and we got a great table up on the balcony. 

We also played with a guy's teacup maltypoo, who had a little leather vest on. It was ridiculously cute. 

Remember to bring money, it's a cash bar.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Lucky 13 is OK with me. Cool setting, the decor and atmosphere is evocative of where good punks must go when they die. Excellent beer selection; which is the strongest selling point for getting me in the door, as well as the most significant reason warranting four stars. The dark red n' black interior, fitting jukebox selection and sticky floor of Lucky 13 is very comforting in a "I'm glad I'm actually in a unique bar with a personality and not sucking down bud light at an Applebees like most of America does on a Saturday night" kind of way.

Cool setting, great beer, fun atmosphere. I'm sure I'd like it even better if it were my neighborhood bar. Go there sometime if you haven't, it's worth a try.
author: Aaron J.

description:
This is a nice bar with an okay crowd.  I seem to remember some sort of decent happy hour special.  There a number of seats upstairs that let you really look down at the people below you.  There is a pool table, foosball table, a couple of pinball machines, and some shooting video game. 

The restrooms are at the front of the bar, and consequently, it always smells when you first walk in.  

The best thing about Lucky 13 is the little patio out back where you can smoke a bowl or two with your beer.  it doesn't get very windy, so its usually comfortable out there, though I think they close it at 10.
author: matt c.

description:
This place is sick!  I mean that in a totally awesome kinda way.  Last time I was here there must have been an earthquake cause I fell off my barstool.  Goddam plate tectonics..

Drinks were right.  Bartenders were cool.  The beats slam.  Go there now.
author: Pete M.

description: Sometimes.... only punk rock will do. Angry, Sexy, Frustrate..dy?  Yes, all of them are cured by a good dose of Jack Daniels and a jukebox loaded with Henry Rollins and Iggy Pop. Sure leather and 400lbs of metal rumblin' tween the legs complete the picture, but feel free to dress up and  stroll in because all are welcome and no one in need of a strong drink will be turned away. Curse them 7's and roll a Lucky 13.
author: Mark B.

description: Nice dive bar! On the edge of the Castro it brings in quite a mix. Office types stopping off for a quck one mix with the tattoo bike messenger, hipster, goth chick, vintage motorbiker and you name it (no marina types)! Chimay White on tap, heavy pour wells, free popcorn, pool table, games, Photo booth???  A must stop when in the neighborhood!
author: john h.

description: Its all about that overly salty popcorn :) AH love it!
author: maria K.

description:
The only DIVE bar ill give a FIVE!!  The location is good right off of Market!!  This place has $2 dollar PBR...a Major Kudos for having a pool table and foos ball table in the back!  

The crowd that goes there is mixed 20's, 30's.  I Actually found out about Lucky 13 from going on yelp.
author: Nicholas B.

description:
The Queers on the jukebox and free popcorn.  Five Stars.  

Fin.

EDIT: This comment below, "The 15 year old me would totally fucking love Lucky 13," hits the nail on the head.
author: Owen K.

description:
Let's recap Sat. night. 

It was my birthday. I had been convinced to meet up with my friends in the Castro where they had been all night to go dancing  under a cloud of strobing rainbows. Even though dancing ain't really my thing it was wicked fun. 

However, after we left there I drug one of my best friends to the Lucky 13 because I really liked it the first time I went and needed a return to Melissa normalcy - cheap beer, a seat at the bar, and  a good jukebox. 

We sat at the bar and I ordered my standard - high life and a shot of jamesons. Kevin did the embarrassing friend thing and told the bartender that it was my birthday and he responded with the blank stare - which I could have kissed him for because I hate all that nonsense. However - after I took my first and my friend went to the atm - the bartender gave me another...awesome. 

my friend promptly left, too straight he said- but I remained there till close which was about 45 minutes. Surprisingly enough I ran into a girl who had just moved here from Austin too and we had mutual hairstylists and friends from TX. awesome again. 

this is why i love dive bars and I'm glad that I found the lucky 13. The bartender assured me that it was gonna be there for a long time..whew!
author: Melissa R.

description:
Lucky 13 is my Zeitgeist backup.
Its not as cult, but still good.
Their beer selection is great, and I have seen evil gin and tonics made.

I've heard plenty of rumors of them going under, but that seems to not be the case (so far). Every once in a while I see someone I know here, and every once in a while I hang out in the back patio where people smoke and drink and chatter amongst themselves.

bar++
author: Tom S.

description:
Mission-style dive bar without all the trendsters. I mean, sure, there are plenty of people here who bring their dogs and have creative facial hair, but the general vibe is really relaxed over "what are you doing in my neighborhood." Being that it's not in the Mission, its not infiltrated by frat boys in striped shirts eager to check out a new, non-marina scene so they can go tell all their buddies how cool they are. 

There are an insane amount of beers here--both in bottle and on tap. Cider can also be found on tap. Every now and then, when I'm feeling especially crazy, I'll pick beers based on names (like trois pistolas. Ever heard of that? Neither have I). Some have been good, most have been gross. It doesn't bother me though, my boyfriend usually finishes what I don't.

Pool tables, dark interior, jukebox  AND a polaroid photo booth? Awesome. And even on a Sat night, you can easily find a place to sit, with minimal people to push through.
author: Sabine S.

description:
Great bar and they don't flinch if you stumble in with your girlfriend screaming things like: Louboutin! Barneys! Sorority Sister!

I do have my superficial side and sometimes I can't hide it. When that happens, I like to be in a place that doesn't judge.

Lucky 13 is one of those bars that holds a special place in everyone's heart. They have a patio and serve food sometimes which is really nice. I can't think of a better bar in my neighborhood!
author: Kimberly H.

description:
I'm a fan of this place.  Granted it's in my hood, and anytime you find a place that you like and can walk to easily it probably bolsters the star rating.

I went in with my roommates having started the night elsewhere and was welcomed by a couple of dogs and thought for sure I had had more drinks than I remembered!  But I came to find out dogs are allowed in there, which I think is pretty kick ass. Super divey feel, but I kind of dig that so I could be biased.

I liked the pool table and free popcorn, and it has quite a few fun little perches to people watch.  There's even a smoking patio, but be warned that it closes at 11pm early on in the week...not sure how late on weekends.  Business is fairly steady, but definitely slow during the Mon-Weds drag.

You should know that the bar is cash only before you go, but then again - as the bartender told me - their drinks are "really really cheap", and he was right.  $4 beers (imports!) and well drinks, and they do a damn fine job of keeping the alcohol hand heavy on the latter.

Don't know if this dive tops your local dive, but if you live in the area it's definitely worth checking out.
author: Amanda K.

description: awesome rock bar.  spacious and the jukebox is all "mix tapes" consisting of all punk and, oddly, bauhaus.  lots of beer selection and a great diversion/option in the castro.
author: Eliot J.

description:
I feel old even saying this, but this place is too loud!  I can't hang out and chat with my friends over a beer if I can't hear anyone talk. 

Also, their women's restrooms are not well equipped if you are going to be drinking a lot of beer.  There are 2 stalls.  One is missing the door and the other is missing the toliet seat.  Hmmmmmm

$2.50 pints does make it a good starter bar though.
author: Susan T.

description:
JUKEBOX: Minutemen, Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds, Black Flag, X, The Stooges, Paul Westerberg, Tom Waits

That already scores four points, but the beer is plentiful and fairly priced. Popcorn machine, pool, non-abrasive locals, friendly barkeeps, dirty bathroom, pretty women. Yes please.
author: Ryan R.

description: Super cool bar tenders, awesome atmosphere, great drinks.  Lots of fun
author: Katie L.

description:
I really like Lucky 13... the juke is good... the beer selection is solid & they have a foosballl & pool table. Serioulsy, how much more do you need? Every time I go in there there is someone with a dog & while I know that may irk some people, I really like it. 

Also, I really like to hang out with friends & drink or play pool/foos & not worry about "being seen" I like that I can go to this place in whatever I have on & no one gives a flying fuck about it. Plus they have have a patio... those are always fun
author: Dan C.

description:
Great place to go to if you want to see another side of your coworkers. :)
Spent my last birthday there watching my dad hit on friends and the dogs constantly scanning the floor for all the popcorn we were drunkenly spilling. They like dogs there, and we like people who like dogs. 
Frrrreee popcornie, patio in the back for all you smokers out there (but going out front is better because you can people watch), sweet jukebox, bathrooms arent that nasty (but ladies, you might need to pull out your hovering skills unless youre too wasted to care), drinks arent that expensive, whoo! I find myself saying "we should have just went to Lucky 13" whenever we go somewhere else.
author: Lou C.

description: Very classy dive (see Pole dead center of bar). Brings you back to the good old days of a raunchy pool game, strippers everywhere, drunk beyond control. Good stuff!
author: Haz O.

description:
went from Cantina, a classy, candle-lit bar, to my friend's fav dive bar. in one night.

The place did not smell pleasant, but the people there were not rowdy and just...suuuper chill (wouldn't consider it a gay bar either...). plenty of seating...very lax environment with a jukebox.

My friend got me the double daddy; def the strongest tasting beer I've ever tried.

A friendly dog greeted me at the entrance.
author: Serena W.

description: great bar ...they have dog fish head for $5 a pint!!  outside patio..always have free popcorn...free burgers and hotdogs on saturdays..
author: David G.

description: Hell yes Lucky 13! I have always liked this bar and always seem to have fun beer fueled times here with great people. Two sizes of PBR, c'mon! Good for big and small groups who want to get loud, or a great place to meet to start or end an evening. A photo booth for the memories (the $5 bill money slot is in the front of the seat) and there seems to always be a dog to pet. I don't usually say this about any place but the door staff is top notch and takes no nonsense. Which I consider a plus for happy safe drinking. The 13 gets pretty busy but there always seems to be a friendly crowd in there, chat up the folks around you, soak up the choice dive bar ambiance and you will get served. Toilets are up front and the ATM machine is at the back up the stairs (So you can look like you have been there before if it's your first time).
author: William R.

description:
We stopped by here after the baseball game on a Saturday to meet up with some of my brothers friends since it was our last night in town. We really liked this place. We sat at the very first table once you walk into the bar. The $2.00 PBR's were great but after a while I started buying the $3.50 PBR's in the larger can. The free popcorn was a nice touch and we did fit 4 people in the photo booth for a quick picture. I don't really remember how much it was but the photo strip is hanging on my fridge here in Dallas. I heard they had a back patio but we didn't make it back there. I saw a pinball machine upstairs but didn't make it up there either. There was too many people to talk to and say good bye to for me to just get up and wonder off. But, I guess I could have. The music was cool and the door man was cool to. The men's bathroom did not have a door knob/handle but inside it was like "graffiti world" I think I was in there an extra 5 minutes just looking around. 
We really liked this bar and might be back next time if we are in the area. 

MZ
author: Mike Z.

description: Outdoor area is a major plus.  It is a pretty cool local place.  I blacked out here once, and decided I should never drink that much again!  But better here than Badlands, OMG!  That would have been... bad.
author: Aaron W.

description: love this place. Everytime I go to San Francisco I make a stop here. First off I drink Rasberry Lambic and no one out in So-Cal has it on tap. "Lucky" for me the Lucky 13 does. The have a wide selection of different beers.  The jukebox has some of the best music. The bartenders are cool. They have free popcorn. And the best part is the drinks are cheap. What more could you want in a bar. The only thing I was dissapointed about is I wanted to visit the back patio I have heard so much about. But when I got there it was closed. I think they close it at 11pm. Oh well I just had to smoke in front.
author: Valerie I.

description: One of my favorite dive bars in the city because it's never overly-crowded, the staff is generally friendly, the beer selection is great, and they have a patio in the back.  Oh, and did I mention they have free pop corn to snack on? Great afternoon happy hour beer deals, too! Wowzers!
author: Scott G.

description:
Need- Jack and Coke
Want- Dark, relaxing corners after a long week
Have- No friends in town
Found- Lucky 13.  

I think I'm in love.  Punk rock on the speakers, decent people serving the drinks and an honest vibe about the crowd.
author: David L.

description: Whenever I get a chance and visit the city, I try to hit up Lucky 13, because I love the vibe, and the beer, and of course the music. My inner punk rock chic comes out at Lucky 13. So chill, and I love it. I looooove beer, and they have a great selection here.
author: Sabina And Pete V.

description:
lucky 13 just feels good. as i write this there are 272 other reviews and they are keeping a 4 star average. with chimay on tap, a framboise lambec on tap and 20 or so others it's no wonder why. what gives it a solid 5 stars in my book is the free get it yourself popcorn. a great beer selection and free popcorn will make the bar for me.

free popcorn, it needs to be a law. why would any bar owner not give away something salty, preferably popcorn? is it too late for free popcorn legislation on the november ballot?

FREE POPCORN, if that isn't useful info i don't know what is!
author: roger b.

description: This place has free popcorn, a back patio, a photobooth, fast and attentive bartenders, and tallboys of PBR. It's the quintessential hipster dive. If they got rid of the black lights I'd probably go here even more.
author: Jarrod B.

description: Great eclectic jukebox, awesome beer selection, cool bartenders and reasonable prices and despite the grunge punk crowd everyone is really mellow no static here.
author: Chris C.

description: First, let me say that Lucky 13 is not my favorite dive bar. But what brings me back here time after time is its excellent beer selection and that it has plenty of seating. Perfect place to hang out with your friends on a Monday night and keep ordering such great beers as Maredsous, Trois Pistoles, Aventinus, Deschutes Black Butte Porter. And the best part? They have Pliny the Elder Imperial IPA on tap! Have enough of that and you'll not only overlook the sketchy bathrooms, but get beer goggles thick enough to hide the fact that your "date" is a long-haired homeless dude with two gold teeth and a beard thick enough to hide acorns in.
author: Andrei Z.

description: Photo booth upstairs!  Drunk + pictures = hilarious memories of the best night ever
author: Stacy R.

description: I dig this mucho.the facade of the building is what attracted me at 1st..pin-up chick[100 coo points]and then inside is just as coo.im into the whole dive feel of it The drinks are stiff like i like my men and its just all around a great atmosphere..
author: David c.

description: This place is rulin'. It's one of my favorite bars in San Francisco. You really can't beat $2 PBR and free popcorn, man! Chill neighborhood folks come here and bring their pups and read the paper, alongside hyper weirdos that go to art school. It's not really an eclectic mix: almost everyone is in SOME kind of scene. But I gotta say I've never met a bad apple here. Plus their photobooth kicks hiney!
author: Pamela D.

description:
I would be lying if I said I went to Lucky 13 once a week...because its more like 4 times a week...its the best!

I love the selection of beers and the price. Pliney for 4 bucks, hell yes! What, you want some popcorn with that...bingo, you got it! Photohunt, yep that too! Can my roommate bring her senior rescue foster dog in...of course!

This place is the best...oh Lucky 13, how my life would suck without you
author: Karen B.

description:
skip this place!  always ridiculously under-staffed.  owner must be too cheap to hire enough bartenders because the most I've ever seen is two, even on a busy friday night.  gotta wait forever to get a drink, if you're lucky enough to get one at all.  imagine if you were ordering for a group of friends or a date and had to wait forever.

bartenders are rude, trashy, and have a bad attitude.  not even friendly when you generously tip.

no nearby straight bars, either.  so its not worth the hassle of going there.  if you want a good selection of bars, go a few blocks down to 16th and mission.
author: Patrick K.

description: best dive bar ever. Beer selection is AWESOME/AMAZING/MAGICAL, punk galore yes yes yes. I avoid typical amateur hour times (Fri/Sat nights) so haven't seen the shit-show youngsters, but for classy drinkers such as I, this is where I go to get my afternoon/evening drank on during the week.
author: S B.

description: They were the best of times, they were the worst of times and most of them have happened at Lucky 13.
author: Maria D.

description: Knock some sense into the neighbors who probably moved in AFTER this place existed so that the patio can stay open past 11pm and it'll get on my 50 bazillion stars list.  Never did try the crucifix (a reverse snakebite with lambic instead of cider), but there will be a next time.
author: Sus... B.

description: Great bar. Excellent beer selection and friendly staff. Play your selections on the jukebox when you first get there because later on it becomes a sobriety test.
author: Baron L.

description: Really good beer list.  Other than that, Lucky 13 tries to hard.  Or maybe its the clientele trying to hard?  Mediocre either way.
author: Christine M.

description: I love a bar when my feet stick to the floor.  Fuck, that's awesome.  Better yet is when I don't have to pay $12 for an imported beer that's handed to me from some pretentious dickhead with an attitude about it.  Don't call this place a dive bar because it isn't a dive bar.  A dive bar is where you stick to the floor for reasons other than spilled beer.
author: Honey L.

description: This place always felt like somebody's *idea* of a punk rock bar. Even straight bars in the Castro are bad.
author: patrick g.

description: Are you in the mood for getting down 'n' dirty in a mildly spacious, hot, grimy-ish, biker-esque dive bar that smells faintly of sweat, where you might accidentally trip over pit bulls, but can actually sit down on a weekend night and drink for REALLY CHEAP? Then this is the right spot for you, my friends. And on many days, it's the right spot for me, too.
author: Stephanie P.

description: I have to admit that I read the reviews for this place before I stopped in.  Hey guys come on now, I was expecting it to look like Hot Topic and Green Day had a baby and named it Lucky 13, but it was not that bad.  Admittedly, its not 'authentic', but what the hell is anymore.  Go to some liquor store in the Bayview if you want authentic.  There you have it, real people doing their thing.  Minus one star for closing the patio at 11.
author: Dana M.

description: pretty sweet bar
author: Michael E.

description: I'm ultra superstitious. 13 is not lucky to me. How I even wanted to step foot in this place is beyond me. I had been here years ago after a Cafe du Nord show but this was so pre-Yelp I didn't recall enough to do it justice in my review. But, now that I went back I remember why I pushed my superstitions aside. Cheap bears on tap, a total no-bullshit crowd (and they all look harder than they are) and a crazy jukebox. Mick and I popped in here for a happy hour beer and got like 1,000 songs for $1 and listened from everything from the Dead Kennedeys to Tool to Faith No More to Johnny Cash. And we had a delightful conversation with a rather fucked up (naturally and chemically, I believe) on the back patio. How nice.
author: Michael E.

description: Simple local bar with a cool chalkboard list of beers and drinks, a pool table, an upstairs overlooking down and an outdoor patio. Enjoyed the laid back, almost distant kind of service so that we all can enjoy our drinks AND popcorn-- a nice touch! Also liked the bar tables that people can choose either to chat up with friends or strangers.
author: T L.

description: It's nothing special, but I like it.  Good beer selection at the bar and good music selection on the jukebox.  Otherwise, nothing really stands out about the place either in its favor or working against it.
author: Quinn S.

description: This bar is seriously awesome. Not really in my neighborhood of choice to party, but shit, sunday they always have a $2 dollar beer and free pool. There is a nice outside area to get some fresh air or have a smoke. The crowd is far from pretentious and the neon white zombie posters are fun to stare at when you are crunkjuiced.
author: Sean K.

description: If you can get past the obvious ploys to be a punk/biker/rocker for the hipsters bar, this place isnt that bad. Pretty average beer selection, with the obligatory PBR in a can staple. The roost is the best place to hang out, where if inebriated enough, you can throw Goldfish crackers at some silly shaggy haired Killers fan named Tyler while they are trying to play pool.
author: Mick F.

description: Ten years ago, I would have given L13 five stars, no question or hesitation. The great beer selection, loud music, friendly bartenders, free popcorn, decent pool table, fun people watching and good location are all still very much in effect today. But times have changed, and so have I. The juke is more annoying to me now, and free popcorn is less impressive once your liver gives out and you start to slow down. It's no longer my Everest of dive bars... but it's still pretty much my base camp. God bless you, Lucky 13, you magnificent bastard.
author: Arsenio S.

description: Have gone to the Lucky 13 since it opened and we used to walk our food over from Azteca (RIP) on Church most nights and enjoy beer and a great jukebox.  A real home away from home when we lived in Duboce Triange.  If you like your bars dark, well-stocked with great beer, tattooed, populated with bar tenders who like to tend bar & not have to chat it up, and with an amazing jukebox of old-school punk, this is the place for you.
author: Dana F.

description:
Best bar in the neighborhood by far..

A small refuge from the gentrification of church@market.
author: Church Street J.

description: CHEAP BEER. Not in quality, in prices!!! Me sister and i took a double take when the bartender said "$4 please." What the crap??? Really? We pay $8-$12 for this beer in so cal!!!! Place has a back patio, saw a black dog roaming around (def not something you see in so cal bars), and some other jaw dropping extra curricular activities. Don't worry, it wasn't anything obscene, but kinda cool. Anyways, fan of the cheap beer.
author: Diana V.

description: This fucking bar sucks shit. The sociopath bartender everybody else has been talking shit about is a burned out 40 year old with no future but a "cool" job working at a bar that is a good choice for you if you're bridge & tunnel looking to hang out with retarded meth heads who love Good Charlotte & like to pretend they were around at Gilman back in the day. If this bar has "attitude" to you, you probably find Hooters "sexy". If this bar is "punk rock" to you you've probably never heard of the Minutemen. If this bar is "divey" to you you're most likely rich.
author: Jason M.

description: Lucky 13 may not be my 1st semi-local bar of choice, but that doesn't mean it doesn't deserve some patronage occasionally. I usually only hit this place up if I'm visiting DuNord for a show, grabbing a drink before or after. I've found, however, it can be quite a nice afternoon bar.  Motorcycles + masses of black t-shirt + piercings + great beer specials + back patio+ afternoon sun = surprisingly relaxing and great weekend afternoon bar! My import beer was a whopping $2.50! yeah! Plus, the people there are so sweet- no one seemed to care that I had left my tattoo at home.
author: Nicole L.

description:
punk is not dead! punk is not dead! punk is alive and well at lucky 13. this place is like an ipod for great punk music. the clash, the ramones (r.i.p. joey, johnny and dee dee) , the velvet underground, the sex pistols, the avengers, the damned... the drinks are cheap. the crowd is rowdy. and the music rocks! now this is a party.

next day. huh, what happened to my lucky 13 hoodie?
author: frisco j.

description:
my new fav sunday spot

lottabloodymarysunday!

good folks, great bartenders, good dogs, free popcorn. dark a bit dirty and good music.

see yah next sunday.
author: dawn a.

description: Over-priced ($5), but a great spot for a quick/scandalous makeout sesh!
author: Misha F.

description: Not a place for a quiet drink with friends, but they don't pretend to be.  I had a fairly good time sipping a beer and watching all of the drunk people flail around and fall on each other.  There was a little bit of an attitude there, but I didn't find myself too irritated by it.  All in all, a SF bar with a grunge atmosphere.
author: Jin W.

description: When you're in the mood for low lighting, shooting some pool, chugging some beer and trying to not get your ass kicked by the bartender. Lucky 13 is your spot. My friend Abel took me here my first time. Now when I'm in the neighborhood it's pop in and grab a beer time.
author: Ashley H.

description: Great bartenders, great jukebox, great locals and the patio's open again.  Long live Lucky 13.
author: John K.

description: This is one bar that I never veto when someone else suggests it. On the weekend, dogs! Today there was a sleeping pit bull or similar completely owning the floor while a small panting carry-on dog stood on a nearby barstool, watching him like a hawk. Why would a bar NOT have this kind of scene on a Sunday afternoon?
author: Melanie R.

description:
My 4-star rating is provisional -- as with many bars/pubs/dives/what-have-yous, it really depends on the night. We'll call this, in general, a four-star Wednesday night and Saturday afternoon.

I really don't know why I'm bothering with this. There are, like, one million reviews of this joint already. You've probably already stopped reading this.

I like the doorguy. He's a nice fella. We shoot the shit when I drop by. There is a friendly self-possessed bartendress who has been there as long as the place has been open (14 years at last count?), a funny kinda punker dude with great stories about using mace on unruly clientele, and more characters who are surprisingly cool given that they have to deal with all the boatloads of bridge-and-tunnel chuckleheads who drop by on amateur nights (Fri and Sat).

A varied crowd. A friendly pool table. A back patio that usually stays open until around 10pm or so. Pinball. Fucking Foosball. That's pretty huge, right? A photo booth. A good punk-leaning jukebox, although it is unfortunately overloaded with "Lucky 13 Mixes" that have their tracks typed out in a tiny typeface that will piss you off and make you cross-eyed.

The funniest thing about this place is the fact that I can't even count how many times some drunk guy (or gal) has staggered up to me asking me where the bathroom is. I don't get it. They're not hidden. Do I look like "The Bathroom Guy?" Or the kind of guy that has to register with the county every time he moves? 

Don't answer that.
author: Android H.

description: As perfect a bar as they come.  Dark, black, glowing red, loud/dark music, great West Coast beers, cool bartenders, a patio, great jukebox, popcorn, great name/logo, cool people, tats...  What more could a San Francisco Satan Worshipper ask for!  One of my favorite bars ever!  Quintessential San Francisco!
author: Roy J.

description:
I decided to take a friend to Lucky 13 for her birthday.  It's a bar that I've passed many times, and never had a desire to check out, but after being referred there by a friend, I decided what the heck.  

The lousy music and disgusting bathrooms didn't bother me, but the bartender sure did.  It took forever to get our drinks, dispite how empty the bar was, and to top it off, he had a really bad attitude.  I guess if you're not punk, or you don't have tits, the skinny bald bartender with the big lamb chop sideburns doesn't feel like he has to treat you like a real person.

Skip this bar if you're out to have a good time.
author: Jason R.

description: Lucky 13 is a great dive bar.  They have a large selection of good beer, free popcorn, tons of seating, cool decor, fun music, an outdoor smoking area(with tables) and decent enough patrons.  It also has PBR-drinking cheesdicks, but not as many as Zeitgeist.
author: Vince G.

description:
when you know people.. its a great place... 
i go here to kick it at the pool table with the lucky 13 team

but its too hot.. no air circulation
the drinks are great
author: tanner r.

description: I love the feel of this place. Dark, divey, cheap and very friendly.  My biggest complaint is that the two times I've been here there are some creepy old men either hitting on my guy friends or trying to get my number so I can buy them pot.  ME?!?!?  I'm talking OLD and very leery and one of them close talker type guys.  However its never too packed and we always manage spots at the bar or a table on the side.  Drinks are basically free in comparison to the snooty bars of the fidi and super strong.  Nearly smashed my face falling into the camera in the photo booth (yes I hit them ALL!).
author: Tiffany L.

description: Definately got a lot going on.  A punk band was playing and a stripper was dancing around a pole on the bar.  The place was pretty packed but the wait for getting a drink wasn't too bad.  It was highly entertaining I must say.  A nice change from a lot of the typical SF bars I tend to go too.
author: Mary R.

description: this place rocks. i was here on a thursday eve hanging with my honey and another colleague for a post-work hangout and it was perfect. happy hour til 8, free popcorn, nice beer list, dark enough that it keeps whiny ppl out, red/black motif, nice big tables, cool tatted folx with their pups.  i'm sold.
author: Kat R.

description: Don't be dismayed by the stench as you enter-- it dissipates as you move toward the back of the bar.  Once you get past the first 15 feet or so, you hardly notice it, mostly because you'll be distracted by their excellent draft beer selection, the friendly bartenders, an eclectic panel of regular patrons, a nice little patio in the back, and any number of dogs running around, eating popcorn off the floor.  I'm happy to call this my local watering hole, despite that funny smell at the front of the bar.
author: Ritik C.

description: Recently stopped by here to play some foosball. It seemed like a cool little spot but I wasnt so impressed. It was a bit too cramped, nothing too exciting about it. It does have foosball, a photobooth and the bartender was only a little wasted when serving our drinks..but I dont think i'll be back.
author: Britney K.

description: Yeah, nice red room atmostphere, great beer selection, nice little beer garden, good music on the jukebox, and as far as i would know (being my yuppie scum self) good coverage of the, um, punk rock scene in the ambiance decor.  Hail Satan.
author: Cassio P.

description: Lucky 13, your jukebox is swell Tragically, you loos really smell Your jukebox is great and PBRs are cheap But man, is your weeknight bartender a jerk
author: Kirsten B.

description: Lucky 13 might be too clean and the bartenders too nice to be considered a true biker/punk bar, but since I'm a tiny little white girl with no tattoos and my only bike is a red Schwinn cruiser, I love it.  The bar is spacious and the back patio is small, but it's nice that it's there.  The free popcorn is delicious (and not only because it's free).  Also, they have pinball.  Not many bars have pinball and I'm a huge, huge fan.
author: Katie S.

description: You can have a damn tasty $4 Bloody Mary here. You can play pool, pick a fight, make friends with someone's pit bull, get yer drunk on, and not leave with empty pockets.
author: Rene D.

description: Reasonably priced drinks, dark atmosphere, and good music = good times...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I got talked into going by a friend who lives a few blocks away, because we know the bartender(hi Noah!) I am a big fan of dive bars. I would much rather be able to drink shots of Jameson with like minded people, then get weird looks from the girl next to me drinking a peach belini. And this is a pretty good one. Decent priced drinks, cept its cash only. (Almost got locked in the Chase building while trying to get cash)They have a ATM usually, but it was broken on the two occasions I went. My only complaint is the beer. If they sold Keystone I would be so much more excited...because I hate PBR. But in general, Im sure people would appreciate the selection. Ales and stouts and whatnot. Pool table in the back. Beside the long bar, there are a bunch of tables to sit at. Jukebox. Photo booth. Lots of good graffiti in the bathroom. Free goldfish crackers to offset your drunk. All in all, a good experience.
author: Mary B.

description: Making me feel Lucky.  Tons of good beers on tap--some that are hard to find, like Delerium Tremens.  Pool, photo hunt, photo booth.  It's flirting with five stars, but I don't have a sensational story involving Lucky 13 yet (that I can remember).
author: Stef A.

description: A bar where I get free drinks because the neighbor knows the bartenders, throw the ball for the dog, and get hit on by a guy whose girlfriend I met not 10 minutes prior?  Awesome.
author: Jess T.

description: Jeez - all these people hating on it for being a 'wannabe' punk bar? Relax, scenesters - it's super friendly in there regardless. They've got a real nice beer selection (Mirror Pond...mmmMMM!) and have the best and saltiest free popcorn in the city...the pool table's aight too. The bathrooms are straight up gross tho - don't touch anything in there!!
author: Justin H.

description: I can't believe I haven't written a review for this pub yet as its one of my favorite bars in the city. I guess I'm a "dive bar" fan because all my favorites seem to fall into that category. (although I don't go to smelly-carpeted bars that open at 6am to let in the same old line of alcoholic customers) GREAT beer choice, awesome bartenders, and has to be one of the best jukeboxes in the city. The clientle is very interesting as well. If you like all of these things, plus a pool table and an outside area out back to sit and smoke, check it out. You won't be disappointed. Oh, and there's a balcony for some privacy as well.
author: Rich M.

description: Ha the best thing about Lucky 13 is that during the summer on Saterday's from 4-7pm, they have a free barbeque going out back, which is sponsered by  a different beer company, whose beer is $2 pints!  The only thing I'm not fond of is the resurrgence of the Marina people (do they realize there orange?) hanging out here, hence the 4 stars:(
author: Cassie L.

description: I love this bar!  It is one of the first places I started frequenting when I turned 21 and I haven't stopped.  The cheap stiff drinks, awesome staff and excellent jukebox remain a staple in the neighborhood.  I also love the free BBQ on Saturdays during the summer.  Great beer selection as well.
author: MonkeyPants S.

description: This is a really cool punk bar.  Juke box playing great stuff.  You cant beat cheap PBR.  The people and the feel of the place are great.  Went during halloween a few years back, was damn crowded but it was fun.
author: Bryan V.

description: Well, I happen to like this photo booth.  So does my pitbull.  Yep, this bar is pitbull-friendly and I've got pics to prove it!  :)
author: Stitchy M.

description:
nice little joint. free popcorn, great beer selection (even some obscure belgians), and a wonderfully weird regular named ron.

the big ass picnic table in the back goes great with a pack of parliaments.
author: peter m.

description: There are dive bars and then there are dive bars... I think Lucky 13 qualifies as the latter.  Any place that lets a bulldog sit at the bar is ok in my book.
author: Willy c.

description: they'd card the President and the Pope. Security goons are definitely morons. Lots of decent places to go to without putting up with this sh*thole
author: norman w.

description: This place is pretty awesome.  Cool crowd and you could chill outside.  Love their drinks, very healthy.  I'm speechless for this place.  I recommend this bar...drink to that.
author: Tiffany D.

description: One of my favorite dives in the city... big as Texas but has a warm feel to it with just enough natural light creeping in.
author: Dan B.

description: If you like beer this is a good bar. Fun crowd, and a patio for smoking, nice and divey. Personally you can never haver too much Johnny Cash on the jukebox! If you want cocktails (ordering actual drinks seemed to annoy them) you may want to try another watering hole.
author: Melissa B.

description: every time i go to this bar, i turn to my companion and say, "i love this place." it's laid back, the jukebox is great, the beer selection is superb, the bartenders are awesome and mix drinks perfectly (and without too much attitude) and the clientele is very mixed. there's no pretension that i've ever noticed - just great music, drinks, and ambiance.
author: Sarah B.

description: I like this place....I don't like it as much on a Friday or Saturday night but what can you do?  Every good place is busy on the weekends.  This place has alot of personality and the size of the bar is to be admired as well.  If you can score a table that's a plus since it does get busy but if you're looking for a good bar with good personality come by Lucky 13.  A good mix of people....not too many hipsters, not too many yuppies, but I also noticed alot more sausages.
author: David C.

description: Whatever.  Sort of a crappy Zeitgeist wannabe.  No disrespect to the staff, though.
author: Coco D.

description: As far as SF dive bars go, this is as solid as they come.  Easily one of my top 3 favorite places to crack a can of PBR.
author: Andrew E.

description: I love this place just cause dogs are sitting right next to me on a bar stool or sprawled on the floor. I LOVE IT JUST COS THEY LOVE PETS!!!
author: Topazskye L.

description: Good happy hour prices, big selection of beers, and a photobooth!! This place was really big actually, very cool. The bartender made my drink very very strong, very cool.
author: G G.

description: I love this place, but I feel like it's be made to be "more" than it is. It's a neighborhood bar. With great, cheap beer. And dogs.
author: Rose J.

description: One of my favorite bars in the city. The patio is great on cool days and warm nights. The pours of Bulleit are no-nonsense, and the bartenders are attentive. Great jukebox, great beer, free popcorn, good times.
author: Steve C.

description: This isn't a regular haunt for me but I have been found haunting the nooks and crannies of this bar on several occasions. It's a great dive bar that seems a little constructed at times but is so well worn, like an old pair of doc martins that you stop noticing the bits and pieces that don't seem like they are happy accident and hapenstance and begin to melt into the dark surroundings. Drinks here are drinks, nothing fancy, no fruit extracts, just your basic tonic and [insert well spirit brand here] sorta drinks, but the beer selection is fabulous. If you're feeling like doing the stray cat strut then saunter on down in your two tone spats to this spot for a pull of the draft and see where you're at when the kitty kat howls...
author: Len S.

description: This bar's got my favor with a trifecta of total awesome: free popcorn, sweet beer selection (&here I'll admit I've got my chick stand-by of peach lambic, delicious!), and PHOTOHUNT.  Seriously, is there anything better than clicking on the dirty version of Highlights' "Find the Difference" with a trusty Hoegaarden by your side?  Sunday nights, man.  Push repeat on that ho.
author: Tina L.

description: Great music, attentive barkeeps, nice (free) BBQ's and a place in the back to smoke whatever. Definietly a place to stop by if your in the area.
author: Tosh J.

description: Once you get over the stench when you first walk in, having drinks there is quite fun. Great for before or after a show at Cafe Du Nord. Fun games, pool, pin ball, photo booth, fresh popcorn, well sometimes fresh... cool artwork on the walls and generally cool hip folks...
author: Rachel L.

description: A cool bar with great beers at a reasonable price.  I like the outdoor area when it's nice out as well.  $5.50 for Chimay Blue rules!  They also have Schneider Wiesse by the bottle which is hard to find and is one of the best German Wheat beers.
author: Mitch A.

description: Punk tunes + rockabilly decor + super strong drinks = my kind of place. But Lucky 13 actually took a little while to grow on me. I think I had become too accustomed to cramped, hole-in-the-wall dive bars, so Lucky 13's cavernous interior took me by surprise. The upstairs seating is prime real estate for checking out all the action down below. The bartenders have mastered the friendly:aloof ratio perfectly enough to make them cool, and the bathrooms offer such a plentiful amount of graffiti that one could be drunkenly entertained for hours.
author: Kelli C.

description: Quick service, helpful suggestions, and noticed empty glasses.  Lovely red, my favorite color - everyone looks good here.  Wait - I'm getting *how* much change back?!  Happy hour suits me.
author: .Hazel T.

description: Lucky 13 is actually part of my annual tradition with my high school friend, Erotica (yes, it's on her birth certificate. yes, her parents are crazy. no, she hasn't heard your unoriginal joke): she flies in to SF, we eat somewhere random then end up at Lucky 13 for cheap, strong drinks and Polaroids. The next day, we wake up and drive to Tahoe.  I like this place. It's great for punks, preps and pooodoos.
author: Chrissy Q.

description:
i love this bar.  little known fact: i was served the first beer at lucky 13 on friday the 13th on their 13th anniversary.  and yes, that does make me feel pretty darn special.  

i almost never spend time inside.  i spent about 4 years of my life sitting on the back porch with a great group of friends everyday after work.  was in there for the first time in awhile and noticed that they added a stripper pole to the bar.  um, i have no comment about that.  just thought it was worth noting.
author: Melissa Y.

description: I am usually only here around happy hour because I work down the street, but with that being said the happy hour is great, $1 off well drinks and beer. The bartenders are cool, theres a pool table and like a mezzanine section, and i guess a patio, though ive never been out there. Free popcorn, and strong drinks. AND a photo booth! Ive gone in there to just take pictures with friends. Awesome idea. Cool neighborhood bar.
author: Alyssa P.

description: San Francisco's best juke box resides at the Lucky 13. A great Punk rock bar that has been around for decades. You will not find many, if any Stuffed shirts or skirts at the 13, more likely you will find all the local color that makes San Francisco a great city. Moreover, with all the color comes the K-9's, as the 13 is also the best dog bar in the city. The 13 is housed in a large hall with high ceilings, a long bar and numerous tables. The back holds the pool table which is free on Sundays and a right turn from there takes you to a small back patio where smokers and readers alike lounge and enjoy their pints. Behind the pool table is a loft with tables and couple of pinball machines. Unlike Shitegeist, the bartenders here are capable and pleasant. Happily they provide free popcorn by the pool table. The aromas here can be challenging, the noise level can be prohibitive and it can occasionally just be too crowded.
author: Christopher N.

description: $8 for a cocktail and a beer? And it's only a couple of blocks away from my house? And it's dark so no one can tell when the asian glow takes effect? That would be perfection....
author: Marie M.

description: I am never EVER gonna front on a place with a jukebox like this.  Even if this were a lammo wanna be bar frequented by idiots in clash t-shirts and ripped fishnets I wouldn't give a SHIT.  I love good music and I go here on regular occasions with other good music fans and hit a tequila shot with a bar back of some PBR.  It's too dark in here to judge the other patrons, lame or not.  HIt it on off days and hours and rock out then pass out.
author: Claire C.

description: This used to be my all-time favorite bar in SF.  Then they changed owners, lost some of their fabulous bartenders (although they still have Laura on the weekends - yay!), and my taste in bars changed.  But I still love the place.  It's like that really comfy sweater you know you should get rid of, but ahhhhh, the memories ... so it remians in your closet ready to be pulled out at a moment's notice and drown you in nostalgia of your early years in the City.
author: darla s.

description: My kinda dive-no pretentious fucktards, strong drinks, good drink selection, some attitude that keeps it distinctive, and bartenders that are into what they're doing. Everyone here was just doing their thing and the place is big enough that they could do it in their own space. One of the bartenders gave me a free whiskey sour when he could tell I was in a bad emotional spot-that's cool cuz it shows he was actually paying attention to his customers. And cuz free drinks are just generally rad and equal Ayelet will be back here.
author: Ayelet I.

description: This place rules: tons of great beer, loud punk music, goldfish and close by my place
author: Mathias G.

description: Always on the lookout for a wateringhole, this bar wet my whistle!  Thanks to the sweet barkeep who looked out for my indecisive nature, I was able to taste many a brewski before settling on a classic and delicious black & tan.  And I never had to ask...I was simply served.  Now that's love:)
author: Tracy E.

description: My only memory of this place is a tall drunk blonde girl trying to fight with three even drunker guys....I think the girl won...Girl power!
author: Maria V.

description: I've pretty much always had fun at this bar.  The drinks are nice and strong, and the jukebox selection makes me happy.  Also, there is a photo booth upstairs, and how is that not a good idea?
author: Melissa G.

description: Great bar.  I'm not sure how divey it is though.  In order to be divey, there has to be a lot of danger, and I'm not sensing that here.  Instead, I sense a welcoming place -- where all kinds of people seem to co-exist nicely.  Even though it's in the Castro, it seems to get a pretty mixed crowd.  Great selection of beer on draft too.  A definite winner.
author: Tim G.

description:
lucky 13 never fails to get me into trouble.

thank you, lucky 13.
author: Samantha W.

description: $2 PBR is a blessing and a curse. I've been coming here since the first time I visited SF before moving here. I would take a star or a 1/2 away (if yelp would let me) because of the bathrooms, but L13 is saved by recent bartender hirings. I'm gonna be coming here until I die.
author: Mike M.

description: All I have to say is, "oh jeebus... thank you, thank you, thank you... I will drink from the wealth of beers, well-drinks, and cocktails you offer."
author: Mitchell W.

description: The cheap drinks and smoking patio won me over. Maybe the fact that it was a rare warm evening in SF helped. The bartenders were nice and efficient. Great place for happy hour before heading elsewhere.
author: laura b.

description:
in my limited SF bar experience... it's not that i didn't enjoy the bar.  however it was at the end of our mac 'n cheese tour, i was already quite full, and quite drunk.  i remember the bar being dark and loud.

i remember the dude next to me thinking he got a drink discount, and he asked the bartender "is that the normal price, or are you in to me".  and the bartender was like "no dude, that's the normal price".  well maybe he didn't call him "dude", but that's the so-cal in me.

anyway, i am starting to realize this is kinda the dive bar scene in SF.  not what i'm used to at a so-cal dive bar... but i guess that's why everyone in SF can't leave the house without some kind of North Face apparel.
author: Sean L.

description: One of the best bars in the city!  It's not a dive bar - it's chill.  Dive bars don't have an enormous beer selection with plenty of Belgians on tap.  The best thing about this place is all types of people go here and everyone loves it: hippies, yuppies, bikers, you-name-it.  The bartenders are cool, the jukebox rocks, free popcorn, pool, outdoor patio, and great vibe.  Even when it's packed to the gills my friends and I can usually snag a table.  The stripper pole was a great addition!
author: Dave Z.

description: Decent, and good patio. Staff might need a couple classes in hospitality but they aren't there for love I guess. Popcorn is a plus, and you can always find a seat. I'll come back.
author: Chris S.

description: Great bar. Big, has a pool table. Walls covered in posters from the Cramps. Sorta dive-rock bar but good priced strong drinks. Crowd varies to people just grabbing drinks before dinner, Castro peeps and indie rock. Plus they have popcorn.
author: Alyssa C.

description: Great divey bar with one of the best jukeboxes around. Sat here with my friends and got quite drunk waiting for the election results last year; it was the perfect place to be right then, and everyone in the joint was sympathetic.
author: Jude F.

description: Good music, cheap prices and close to my apartment. What else could I ask for? Free popcorn? Done! Oh yea, Lindemann's Framboise on tap and cheaper than Toronado at that! I will definitely be back to Lucky 13 in the near future.
author: Bathrooms Only ..

description: The perfect bar for those who want the atmosphere of Zeitgeist, but don't want to get dirty. An expensive, trendy bar, but nothing beyond that.
author: Randy M.

description: I really like this bar. It's dark and usually packed, the bartenders are good and fast, they have fresh popcorn available, pool table, fooseball, ecclectic scene. A relatively straight bar in the heart of the Castro. The back patio is my favorite.
author: Nicole F.

description: Dark. Great juke. Here's my 13 story: I met some friends here and we were killing time before going to the Castro to see The Wildbunch. I put some tunes on the juke and just as we're leaving my song comes up - Pull My Strings by the DK's - live song from when they were on the Bammies in 1980 - great song. We walk into the lobby of the Castro and who's there - right - Jello Biafra. Cool.
author: Colin S.

description: Why would I rate it any less.  An EXTENSIVE beer selection, good music, free pool, free popcorn, grafitti walled bathrooms, plenty of seating (upstairs inculded), cool diverse people and bartenders, outside patio, and even one of those picture vending machines to capture you acting like an ass after your 10th brew.  Wanna try something different?  Try the Undemans Lambic beer, a rasberry tasting belgium beer.  I know, sounds like an oxymoron, but what doesn't these days.  it's gooooood.
author: Adrian N.

description: Great bar. I can't believe I haven't been here before!  Dark, just as a good bar should be, with chatty bartenders and a friendly, converse-wearing crowd.
author: shoba d.

description: OK so I'm there on a biz trip/convention type thing, and I have been dragged from sportsbar to hotel bar to hipster lounge, and I have had enough.  I split away from the crowd with another fella and head over here.  Hell yeah, that's what I was looking for.  It reminds me a bit of Delilahs back home in chicago, which is a good thing.  The bartender I dealt with was pretty cool, the tunes were excellent, and the beer selection was real nice.  Highly recommended, and I would probably give it 5 stars if I actually lived here but I only made it there once.
author: Steve R.

description: Pool table, free popcorn, outside patio and female bartenders that could kick Chuck Norris' ass - what more could you ask for?? Looking to get deep down drunk - this is the spot. Drinks are cheap.  The guy's bathroom should probably be completely renovated but until i see a family of raccoons nesting in the toilets, it's fine.
author: Peter M.

description: I enjoy going to this bar when my LA friends are in town, that way I can pretend to listen to their banal, self absorbed blathering whilst enjoying the quality jukebox. When Lotta is working it's the most fun, she's the greatest....but on weekends it's not too easy to get the other bartender's attention. Nonetheless, it's always a good time, you can go there on busy nights, I'll prefer to enjoy the warm glow of the afternoon bbqs.
author: Colleen B.

description: Free popcorn, which I learned after a discussion with the bartender is possibly but dubiously vegan, is served here. The bar has a very Seattle feeling as in punk rock music playing, and music posters on the wall. There is a patio which is good for nice days and catching up with your fire-breathing friends. Quite the heterosexual meat market on the weekends too.
author: Netty L.

description:
there were so many distractions i didn't even know they had a back patio! thank you michael! lucky 13 felt lucky indeed my first night there, because the tamale lady showed up and blessed me! 

there were also a bunch of dogs running around, which i like, we introduced new people to fernet. good night all around.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Ironically one of the first bars i went to in the city because now I live a couple blocks away.  Some peeps hate on it, like my roommate sometimes, i think he wants to just pick up girls at bars sometimes (strange) and the 13 is never too lucky for him. Whuaaa whuaa.  (Debbie downer noise)  But I love this place, free pop corn, sweet beats, and fucking FOOSBALL!!!!!!!!!!!!  And the table is usually available or jumping in on a little tourney ain't no thing.  Nothing is worse than being in the presence of the mighty  foos and not being able to play.  Like the typical scenario of a bunch of lame ass dudes monopolizing a table because they are too cool for school.  I think they see my nimble wrists quivering in anticipation, and frankly are scared shitless.  I can't blame though, I scare myself sometimes.  But I poop my pants and move on.  RELEASE THE BEAST!
author: Katie M.

description: It wouldn't be a San Francisco bar without a graffiti-strewn men's room, but I still dig this place. Door man was nice, bartender was attentive (though there seemed to be only one during a peak time on Friday night) and the drinks are reasonable. The music gets a little loud, so it's hard to have a conversation, but all in all I've always had a good time here.
author: Jeremy P.

description: Going to bars on the weeknights is the best.  Not really crowded or noisy, and getting a drink isnt a hassle.  Haven't ventured to the back patio yet.  I was too entertained by the "free" fooseball.  You must know the secret of the table to obtain this free-play :)
author: andrew l.

description: Surprised to find this place empty even on a Monday night. Well, it did pick up a bit later when we were leaving. I am a hard sell on bars. But I like this place. It was quiet which I'm sure is not  the common scene. They have great prices on great brews like a $5 Racer 5. And I can't believe there is a separate review profile for the photo booth here. Whoever started that is lame. But the booth is worth the $3. It's a polaroid booth that produces 4 shots on 1 photo. You have time to prep between shots and manually take the photo, which I think is a plus, especially if you're with costume(s). The location of you in the booth can be viewed from below, so beware. I think the trick to taking clean shots in every frame is to wait 5-10 seconds and take the next one. If you wait too long the photo starts to develop and takes away from the final shots. Cheers to Lucky 13!
author: Letty D.

description: Great dive bar, not too far of a trek from my place in the Sunset. However, a bit too crowded on weekend nights.  Love the upstairs seating.
author: Morence L.

description: warm beer in dirty glasses, aging staff who thinks they are cool because they have wrinkled tattoos and piercings, cliched jukebox, urine covered bathroom floors, cocktails are crumby, too much attitude, fake dive bar. only redeeming quality is the 1/2 assed patio where one can smoke. put this joint off the beaten track and it is out of business.
author: Robert P.

description:
Awesome jukebox.  Awesome beer selection.  Awesome vibe inside.  What more do you need?

Ideal for a pre-gig drink if you're going to Cafe Du Nord or the Swedish American for a show.
author: Patrick P.

description: A true dive bar with lots of character. It's a dog friendly place so bring your pup if you have one. Free BBQ snacks are available on the back patio so make sure you take a trip back there. Only downside: they had Non-alcoholic Bitburger beer. Other than that is a good place to hang with friends
author: Kayne Y.

description:
i had my going away gathering here before i "moved" to new york (i say "moved" in quotations, still doesn't feel quite real) and all my friends were like, "this is such a melanie bar, nice choice," meaning, they play music i love and it's totally chill. love the sections "upstairs," my friends and i took over the smaller narrower section, which probably led to it getting EXTREMELY hot up there and stuffy. it's dark and the bartenders are friendly. also has a photo booth woohoo! the only thing about it is that the pictures come out kind of small and that was the first time i've had horizontal photo booth pictures. key note: a second printing of the photo strip comes out a little after the first one, so don't walk away from the machine after you get the first one!

i love that there's a popcorn machine, salty popcorn makes beer taste that much better. a star off for the piece of gum one of my friends found in  one of the rounds of popcorn we did and for the one bathroom stall being totally nasty. oh, and for the upstairs getting so hot and yucky feeling that by the end of the night, my friends and i had migrated to a table down below right at the foot of the staircase. they need some fans up there or something!

say "yeah" to lucky 13, am celebrating my joint birthday outing here with my "twin" sister jessica when i fly back home next week!!!!
author: Melanie C.

description: Cool bar, great beer list.  One of the best jukeboxes in the city, too.  They've got a small patio out back too.  This is not one of those pretentious trendy places, show up in more than jeans and a shirt and you'll look out of place.  This is in the dive bar side of the spectrum...
author: Jason L.

description:
3.75

they have chimay=awesome. 

great posters on the wall, good atmosphere, nice beer selection.
author: Natalie C.

description: AMAZING happy hour until 8pm.  $1 off draft beers.  Did I mention their draft beers are ridiculously inexpensive already?  Check this place out for certain.  Just leave a stool for me too.
author: Max M.

description: Fun, great place! Free popcorn! Good drinks! Good crowd!
author: Mel P.

description:
any bar that has turbonegro on the jukebox gets 5 stars from me. this is my favorite bar in the city and i try to hit it up every time i visit. i also like to play a game of erotic male "find what's different between these 2 images"

yes, that is not the actual name of the electronic game, but i'm usually too drunk to get the true name. and i'm too drunk to realize that i'm playing the erotic male version. thankfully, i have friends that remind me the next day.
author: Jason D.

description: I'm not seeking this place out. If you're into the punk/rockabilly too-cool-for-everything scene this is the place to be. The prices were good, the juke box was extensive. I can see why people love it, but it's not for me.
author: Rachel B.

description: It's a chill neighborhood bar though half the time it's full of people from elsewhere in the city.  Dimly lit with photo booths, a pool table, and plenty of seating.  It's a relaxing place for meeting up with people.  I usually stumble in here after seeing shows at Cafe du Nord, so I could be imagining that pool table considering how intoxicated I was.
author: Kimmie N.

description:
the smell of urine & accompanying smells that welcome you as you enter the front door are not the best of ways to say hello to it's patrons, but once you can get past that, you're in the clear!  the bar is looooooooong as hell and the bartenders are very attentive to you!  the mixed drinks are a bit on the watered side, but i guess you can complain and get ignored the rest of the night, no?  i am very happy that they have megatouch @ the end of the bar and still tend to you as you get lost in the screen of power solitaire!!!!
