basically, this place doesn't suck, bit it does kinda' leave you with the feeling of "what now?" after you've smoked your fist pack of smokes within the 1st hour of being there.  word of the wise, make sure you have some where else to go by the time the 3rd hour of being there rolls around!





***ursa major***
author: Michael M.

description: I felt right at home walking into Lucky 13. It's the kind of place that you want to hang out at in the late afternoon. Their jukebox has a great selection of old metal and punk faves, and their happy hour lasts forever! Come early and get blasted on cheap beer with your friends. It's a great way to spend a Friday evening.
author: David H.

description: Rock-o-really.  More Motorhead t-shirt than motorhead album.  Used to go there a lot when i first moved here for some reason.  It's fine I guess.  Usually too crowded and I don't like (get) the aesthetic.  Probably give it another shot now that the expansion's closed.
author: Ed B.

description: Killer atmosphere, reminds me of a place I used to frequent on the east coast.  I like the dark.  It's fun.  I'll be back soon.
author: Jay B.

description:
I love the Lucky.  Had many good times here and it still rates as one of my favorite SF bars.  I don't make it here as much as I used to, then again, I'm not out as much overall so I guess it still evens out.  A perfect Friday would be hitting the ZG around 3:00 and hitting up the Lucky for a night cap on the way back to the Lower Haight.  Of course this usually ends up as a good 9 hour run, but it's a good time nonetheless, even if it makes your Saturday wholly unpleasant.  

The bar itself has everything you would want in a good, divy type bar.  They have your pool and photo hunt.  There's also foos and pinball upstairs for those seeking variety.  The jukebox is great and the music is loud which can be good or bad depending on how much you really want to hear the person(s) you're hanging out with.  There's a lot of space and tables so even when there's a lot of people there, you never get the sense of being too jammed in.  This is noce especially on Friday and Saturday nights when pretty much every bar is jammed.  They also have a cool little patio area out back.  One of the most distinguishing characteristics is there's a big old school popcorn popper and free help yourself popcorn.  It's quite a nice touch too have some tasy popcorn, freshly popped, with your drinks.  Last but not least, all of the bartenders of very cool.  They're efficient, pour good drinks, and will remember you if you're there with any regularity.  

On a final side note, the bathrooms are near the doors where you come in.  You can be a hero to any number of would-be pee-ers with this little tidbit of information.  I don't think I've ever been there w/o having to help at least one confused person locate the restroom.
author: Zach J.

description: My friend said Lucky 13 reminds her of being in a bar in Chicago.  Well, my friend, if this is what Chicago is like.  Then I'm gonna have to check out the windy city out sometime soon.  Its dark. . . glossy dark red and black painted walls, ceilings and floors.  Walls are covered with wall art of all sorts.  Old school PacMan game, photobooth in front, jukebox with eclectic sorts, pool table and popcorn machine in back.  On tap is an assorted bunch, from pear cider, Stella, Guinness to microbrews too.  Bouncer and bartenders, you have your punk rock, hells angel and trashy Amy Winehouse appeal.  The bar is decorated with action figures, like Puppet Master to the State Puff Marshmallow man.  Even a lovely stripper pole on top of the bar table.  Hmm, my friend dared me to get on it, but I told her. . . .I may do it before my 31st b-day, so let's hope she forgot that I said that by then.  HA!  Its a pretty big place, with 2 upstair areas in separate sections.  I say use them like a watch tower to people watch.  Don't be afraid to enter this dark realm of a dungeness punk scene delight.  They welcome you with open arms and a head bang as a bonus.
author: Janice F.

description:
I came here on the night this place opened and I've been coming here almost once a week ever since. I never stay past 9 as the whole vibe changes (I'm old), but damn if this this isn't the best happy hour of any bar I've ever been in my life. Beer-wise I prefer it to Toronado as they obviously look after the pipes better at 13's, plus Toronado has too many draughts that sit for too long - 13's seems to sell everything in volume. Zeitgeist lost it in about '99 so for me Lucky's is it.
PS - All the bartenders are top-quality, best in the city. However, big kudo's to Lotta on weekends during the day - a truly great bartender.
author: Matt E.

description:
this is where i go when i want to drink outside and not deal with the hoards of crowds at zg.

one of my top dive bars in sf.
author: s s.

description: Good rock and roll bar.  Great beer selection and there's usually some decent music playing.
author: Cory G.

description: Wow!!! After reading the reviews, I decided to take my boyfriend here on our vacation this past weekend (we live in the L.A. area). First off, we're definitely more into bars where you can get a seat, great music on a juke box, and a decent crowd. Let me tell you, this place did not dissapoint. The juke box was awesome, even though they could have put it up a little higher, the bartenders were great and very attentive, the drinks were SUPER cheap and very strong, and the place is a pretty good size! I would definitely recommend this place to people who prefer bars over foo-foo clubs/bars. If you are into CLUBS, you will not like this place. Definite must for the rockabilly folk! What a great time!! :)
author: Danielle S.

description:
I love the fact that they have so many choices of beer.  My wife and I have been there a couple of times, including new years eve.  We are probably not their target demographic as my wife told me last time - "you need to grow more stubble to fit in here"

As long as we are drinking, Lucky 13 will be on our list of places to consider...
author: Marcus S.

description: Pool and pinball... what more do I need?  I have been going to this wonderful dive bar for years, and I still haven't made it out to the back deck.  I guess I always forget!  Why do I love Lucky 13?  Well, they have the best reading materials on the walls and a wonderful variety of beer... all at reasonable prices!
author: Allison G.

description: My hangout for eight years.  I love the staff, jukebox, and the drinks.  Definitely a place where you can get a good drink.
author: Andrew H.

description: When I was little, I imagined the dark interior of Lucky 13 to hold leather-clad people who threw chairs and hurt themselves for fun. That may be true, but when I was there I didn't witness any of it. I also didn't notice anyone who appeared to be a desperate poseur like some folks seem to think populate this bar. Maybe it's because I went on a Wednesday night. But I don't really care about that kind of thing anyway. What I do care about is cheap (and good) drinks, pinball machines, a jukebox that plays awesome music, a balcony on which my friends and I can dance, and people who don't stare you up and down constantly.   We had fun, and I never thought, "Wow, this bar would be awesome if it wasn't so obviously trying to be a punk rock bar." Okay then.
author: Janine M.

description: Teaching a cute, drunk girl how to moonwalk on the balcony while myself drunk on Framboise: sound like your fantasy?  This is my reality.
author: Frankie D.

description: This place is just a really solid watering hole.  No real pretention, just a great space to get your drink on.  This place is why bar's in the city are fun.  Beer's galore as well.
author: Eagan I.

description: Perfect proximal distance to Cafe Du Nord, for a change of atmosphere after a show.  I loved the ambiance and seeing all of the different styles of people that show up at this place.  It's not one of those places that demands one fills a certain criteria before showing up or chance being socially ostracized.  Things that make Lucky 13 even more adorable: free popcorn, a rockin' jukebox selection that'll keep you chatty and happy into the wee hours, no cover, pinball, and balcony seating for the more intimate experience.  They have great pear cider as well. I love the logo, too. For Lucky 13: 10.3 jillion points. A++
author: Devon P.

description: Love this bar, its spacious, has a back patio, laid back bartenders, good beer selection, great jukebox, what more could you ask for, i mean really....
author: jamie z.

description:
I have been coming here for years, and I've always liked this place.  It's good and dark, the jukebox has a good selection, and they have TONS of beers on tap, and a hecka good happy hour that goes 'til 8.  There is a nice little patio in the back for the smokers.  They have that touch screen game at the end of the bar--if you aren't playing Photo Hunt, then you are a chump.  Free popcorn; excellent way to convince folks that, yeah, who needs dinner, let's just stay here and keep drinking! (Cybelle's pizza is around the corner and they are open LATE--put some of that in your belly before you stumble/cab home)  There's an upstairs w/ foosball and pinball and a photo booth, and it is usually not crowded up there at all.  And the pool table is free sometimes, and people actually use the chalk board to see who is next, like God intended.  Good job people.  Also, there is frequently an excited little dog who lives to play fetch.  And on Saturday afternoons they have free hot dogs and burgers--nice!
     The only bad thing?  I'm not sure that the stall in the mens room has a door.  And if it does have a door, I'm not sure that it has a lock.  But hey, when you gotta go, you gotta go!
author: Brian P.

description: Dogs allowed, good prices, photo booth.  Terrific, although the cat cartoon on the logo totally creeps me out.  I've gotten some good drinks here daytime (three cheers for spicy bloody marys) but some bad drinks here nighttime (an icky margarita and a very sour gimlet, which is arguably the right way to make a gimlet but isn't my cup of tea), which leads me to think I should stick with beer on busy nights.
author: Sara L.

description: I like Lucky 13 because you can bring your dog there.  The patio area is a plus on a nice, warm day.  The music is too loud, but I think that of pretty much every bar I go to.  I'm a crotchety old woman.
author: Landy G.

description: Great place, lots of beers on tap, good jukebox. Kind of a punk dive bar.
author: Doug I.

description: They have an outdoor patio, which is huge for me.  Cool bartenders  and a long, cheap happy hour cement it.   Great location to meet friends. Never anywhere near full, and very few annoying people.  I did see a 16 year old wearing some of their clothes though... and I'd been eyeing that zipping hoodie too.
author: Heidi P.

description: Good tap selection and nice happy prices.  Bartenders are generally friendly.  The decor/lighting is rather dark...even for a beer pub.  There's a small back patio for days when the weather permits.  Location is convenient for MUNI riders, but parking is tough for others.
author: Christopher K.

description:
ok it's loud on a busy night but this bar has true old-style SF appeal.

it kind of feels like Zeitgeist used to back in the day (what day you ask?? a lady never tells).
author: Darla W.

description: Friends and I have been coming here just about weekly for over 10 years. Has it lost a bit of it's "edge"? Maybe, but with all the super trendy lame "bars" opening up lately, it's nice to go somewhere with Speakeasy on tap and Motorhead in the Jukebox.
author: Raymond A.

description: I was rather impressed with this little bar. It's refreshing for the neighborhood and is quite cool. The inside is dark and full of neon lights. I could see myself spending hours in the future drinking all the great beers on tap. It's also not a gay bar which is refreshing for the neighborhood. I will definitely be back here and write more!
author: Pascal C.

description: For being a great dive bar, its like the caravan meets some actual floor space. Good prices, beer funk, good music = Proper dive place.
author: Alberto R.

description: When it's crowded that long bar can be a bitch when you just really want to get the attention of the busy bartender. On a chill weeknight this place is cool for hanging out, drinking, playing pool and looking at the coolest poster art in the city. Punk rock!
author: Foodie F.

description: This place is AWESOME! Great music and the bartender hooked it up for making me wait like two seconds.
author: kelly l.

description:
i was out on a drunken binge with some friends at the lucky 13 one night and got straight to work chatting up a mysterious and extremely adorable stranger at the bar.  he was both mysterious and adorable and those are two great qualities in a one night stand.  the other great quality is no std (that was still tbd).  just as i felt serious time was being made with the mysterious and adorable stranger, another disgusting and foul stranger pushed himself between us and started asking me incredibly personal questions like, "is that your real hair color?  does the carpet match the drapes?  i am drunk, you light cigarette?" and I am like, "GET AWAY FROM ME!  I DO NOT KNOW YOU!" and this dude will not leave and is just leaning against the bar staring at me and smiling like an insane person.  I look back to where the mysterious and adorable stranger had been and he is gone...SO MYSTERIOUS!  i wanted MORE!  but instead this drunken psychopath was blocking my escape.  I don't know why I stayed and talked to him, I think, deep down, there is a little part of me that knows my lot in life is not the mysterious and adorable stranger but is rather the drunken and possibly dangerous psychopath.  These are the cards I have been dealt and I must play them...I think perhaps I was someone terrible in a former life (say, Stalin) and payback is a bitch.  

ANYWAY...this dude.  would.  not.  leave.  He tells me many tails over a period of an hour.  my friend, Brigid C., joins us and we are both simultaneously fascinated with and repulsed by this big weirdo stranger.  we learn he is in a band and he plays something ridiculous like the banjo and he is a producer at NPR and he REALLY needs a light PLEASE GOD SOMEBODY LIGHT THIS FUCKING CIGARETTE!!!!  knowing that it is illegal to smoke in this bar, I gladly oblige.  The second his cigarette is lit, the bartender is all, "dude, take that outside" and the big fucking weirdo is all, "miausodfuo8qe980u8!!!!" and the bartender's all, "OUT!" and the big fucking weirdo is all, "KJOAIU*UU@E(JIOIAWU()U!*UHIJSKASJHDU!!!!!!!!!" and the bartender's all, "that's it!  your ass is outta here!" and with that, comes out from behind the bar and picks the big fucking weirdo up and throws him (literally THROWS him) out of the bar.  I'm sitting on the bar stool being all, "OH, SNAP!" when I realize that I have the big fucking weirdo's drivers license in my hand (long story) and so I have to run out after him to give it back.  When I get outside, there is a circle of people around him and he is laying face down in a pile of his own vomit.  I'm all, "Flip him over before he chokes on his puke!" and nobody will touch him so I make to go towards this dude and out of nowhere, he fucking SPRINGS up, grabs his drivers license, shakes my hand and takes off RUNNING down the street.  like full speed ahead.  It was INSANE AQUARIUM.

well, needless to say, this story ends when I place an ad on craigslist looking for the guy, his friend sees it, forwards it to him, he responds, ends up he does work as a producer at NPR and he does remember me and my friends, he invites us to drunken naked thanksgiving, i decline but we do end up forging a somewhat odd relationship built on frequent bizarre encounters and him offering to snort cocaine off our breasts.  i know he sounds unappealing but I have to say, this dude is fucking awesome...i'm so glad he drunkenly threw himself into my life that night at lucky 13.   Our story does take a sad turn when we find out that our man must move to NYC to become a big time NPR head honcho and I must stay here and rescue dogs.  See!  Proof!  Stalin!

And that is the tale of david smith (name changed to protect um, his job), a coked out of his mind freak show banjo playing psychopath who is in charge of all of your current liberal thoughts...god help you all.
author: Laura B.

description: Two words, one syllable: FOOSBALL. This bar has one of the better (i.e. only) foosball tables in San Francisco, located on the balcony in the back, along with a couple of pinball tables. But pinball is too hard; foosball is the sport of true champions. But watch out: the table sometimes gets jammed because ass-clocks wedge the little cardboard trays for the popcorn into the foosball goals. (Yes, I have done this before as a young man with no morals, but I have matured since then). There's also a decent pool table that usually sees a fair amount of action - and I believe the pool is free during happy hour. Did I mention the popcorn? Yes, I did - you have been paying attention. They have this nifty little popcorn machine downstairs that's free; you can gorge yourself on popcorn while downing cheap drinks ($2 PBR, the standard candle for cheap beer - I wish they had Tecate, though) or more expensive drinks (they have a beer list that hasn't made me sad in the past). The outdoor patio is nice and cozy, but beware - it closes at 11PM, I believe, due to noise concerns. But it is an often overlooked place to while away a sunny afternoon. There's no lock on the stall door in the men's bathroom, so this means it's difficult to poo or do drugs in there, if you are the kind of person that does either of these things outside of your home. As many of these reviews have already testified to, the jukebox is fucking stellar - seriously. A warning, though - Lucky 13 sometimes gets uncomfortably crowded on the weekends, which can be a good thing, or a bad thing, depending on your astrological sign. But the clientele, while perhaps not genuinely punks/bikers/rockers (as if this should matter to anyone) are generally nice, with the occasional fratty douchebag thrown in for your mocking pleasure. Overall, Lucky 13 would get my vote for student body secretary in the high school of bars within walking distance of my house.
author: Max H.

description: I just found my new favorite dive bar! The beer selection at Lucky 13 is great, as are their $3 beers during happy hour. On Saturdays (during warm weather, I presume) they grill FREE burgers and chicken on the back patio. And there is a jukebox and a photo booth, if you're into those things (I am).
author: Meghan C.

description: Saint Paddie's Day is great. Unless you're out with true alcoholics who can't physically bear the lines at the bar and the lengthy periods between beers. The usual suspects and I found ourselves in just such a predicament last night. With all species of party animal raging in the streets of the Mission and bare-chested men gyrating on every table top in the Castro, standard boozehounds like us were at a loss for a place to go that wouldn't be so crowded as to defeat the purpose of going to a bar altogether. Someone saw Lucky 13 out of our cab window and yelled at the driver to stop. Seeing as the big Lucky lies in the middle of no-man's land, we figured we may have found exactly what we were looking for. And we were right! This is a bar I would generally classify as creepy but last night they fit the bill and I was surprised by the kinder, gentler Lucky 13. The place is huge and accomadates many, the bartenders are super nice, and the crowd was leaning toward the drunk end of the spectrum. Just what we were looking for! I probably will not become a regular, but I know where I'll be pounding cocktails one after the other next St Patrick's Day, while the rest of you clowns are trying to find the bar at the Irish Bank :)
author: Autumn K.

description: this place was AWESOME. i dont know how it happened, but apparently when we walked in, we were given free shots. i was in line for the pisser, even though there were 3 stalls inside. the guy behind me thought i was an idiot. i was just drunk..anyways, back to the shots. i think it was some kind of spiced rum, but i decided to be a trooper and drink it without the coke chaser. i almost barfed, so i chased it down with my beer and almost barfed again. whatever, i played it off like i was just coughing. anyways, this place had a great atmosphere, beer specials posted all over the walls, and super friendly bartenders. thumbs WAY up
author: Andrew T.

description: if you're an old, angry punk, that's still pissed off at dad, or the world, then this is the place for you. 1 star for the staff, and another star for the juxebox.
author: Pickle R.

description: i was going to give this place 3-stars because i'm quite indifferent about this place, but this place smells - especially right when you walk inside and take your first few steps into the place. we are talking smells similar to the attic and 500 club, or even worse! seriously, can you do anything to combat that foul stench? other than the smell, it's an okay place. i've had many drunken moments here with friends. the atmosphere is similar to what you'd see at 500 club or even zeitgeist, which isn't totally my crowd, but i get along with them better than a frat bar. oh i almost forgot, they have an outside smoking area in the back - however, i'm not sure what days / how late they have it open.
author: James J.

description: What can I say?  Rock n Roll!  One of the best damned jukeboxes in town.  Black paint everywhere.  The bathrooms are disgusting.  A pool table.  Popcorn.  And lots o booze.  Nice break from the wine bars I get dragged to all the time.
author: Jeremy R.

description: ive been gettin super drunk here lately.bartenders are cool.huge space plus patio.love the photobooth.
author: Lauren V.

description: great place! good vibe...dive bar! free popcorn although i am not a popcorn fan (gets stuck in your teeth!). only 1 pool table but i have been able to get a couple of games in. the back patio rocks for those people who unfortunately smoke. ooo and hot bartenders here too!
author: Susan M.

description: tight place! nice, strong drinks :)
author: L V.

description: i fell asleep at a bar, in the classic head down pose. finally, my dreams have been realized.
author: alina p.

description: very cool chill bar that i definitely will be coming back too.  the music was just off the hook  (a near perfect mix of good ol' ballads, 80s glam rock, and some 90s alt rock), and I realized later that there was a jukebox.  a kickass jukebox!  note, they only take cash at the bar and i didn't see an atm around....
author: Roshni R.

description: lucky 13 is like a multi-level indoor dog park with beer. friendly bartenders, outdoor patio, pool, popcorn, punk rock on the jukebox.... what more could you ask for? minuses are that it's super dark in here and it attracts some neighborhood weirdos, but the dogs are friendly, and hey, i aint one to judge.
author: Mary V.

description: yes, virginia, there is a santa claus. and he is making out with another santa claus. and there is mrs. claus smoking a ciggie out back.  multiply that by a bajillion more drunk santas and you have my first experience at lucky 13. the santas dominated most of my sensory intake but it still seemed like a cool space - with various places to perch and linger like multi lofted levels and an outside patio.
author: julia r.

description: If Hot Topic opened a bar, Lucky 13 would be it. The only time I've enjoyed this bar is when it was empty. Otherwise, you'll be fighting for space at the bar with every starstruck Bright Eyes fan and Sweaty Page drop-out. Try Expansion Bar a few doors down.
author: Chris D.

description: Nice bar, and always good people!!! They have a booth, and the drinks are good!!! nice pool table
author: Pamella P.

description: Best jukebox in town. Best ambiance. Miss L is the best bartender in town. Also, I love the crows: best mix of every constituency of our whack little city - I've gotten into air-guitar jams with barely conscious jarheads as well as gotten my ass kicked on the pool table by a sassbot whose column I read the following week in the Economist. You can't fake this kind of thing.
author: Todd E.

description: the lucky 13 is a must for drinks before and after a show at cafe du nord.  the drinks are strong!  i ordered a cranberry and vodka and it was barely even pink.  plus i'd go to any bar that has a day-glo misfits/anthrax poster on the wall.  great place to get drunk and then jam 5 people into the photo booth for lewd pictures.  pretty damn easy to get to from really anywhere in the city.  but why don't they have ace pear cider?
author: kate s.

description: Great, a bar for self important horror rock douche bags. Bartenders and staff are total jerks. I will never go back here after the discriminatory and idiotic treatment that my friends and I received. For starters, I ask one of the staff where the bathroom was, he gave me a "hmph" then walked away (all the doors are so graffiti'd you can't tell which door is the bathroom).  Then one of my friends tries to make small talk with the bartender, the bartender curses him out and insults him for no reason... maybe he's having a bad day.  My friend lets the bartender know he's being rude, and that he just wants a drink, then the bartender kicked him out, for no reason: "I don't like you" he said.  My friends and I were in awe with the disrespect this establishment shows friendly, paying customers from off the street... Maybe they're trying to maintain their tough image in a gay neighborhood... who knows? I can't recommend this place less...
author: Jeff B.

description: i've never not had a good time here!  even when square dancing down the street, we could run in and get a cold beer.  and don't judge me for the square dancing.  it ended up being a jolly good time.  mind you - we did only dance the one dance and spent most of the time at lucky 13.
author: jen b.

description: I practically live next door to Lucky 13 and I'm so glad I do!  This is my favorite bar for happy hour, a drink on the back patio or late night beers with friends.  The beer list is awesome, with a lot of great imports that are hard to find.  Both their bottle and draft lists are remarkable.  The bartenders are a little rough around the edges, but that's their charm and they all seem to have pretty heavy hands when it comes to pouring cocktails.  Laura is my favorite bartender.  The free popcorn is a nice snack, even though I try not to think about how fresh it may be.  There is a photo booth and a couple games upstairs and the patio is open until 11pm (until the neighbors start complaining about noise).  I would steer clear of the Lucky on Friday and Saturday nights, unless you're into Marina girls and frat boys.  I love coming here during the week and either early on in the night, or closer to closing time.  There is a big rough and tumble biker crowd here, which I love, and probably isn't the place to come if you drink cosmos.  Most nights, Lucky 13 is a great neighborhood bar with a lot of regulars, strong drinks and loud rock music.
author: Ariel D.

description: i wish *I* had my own brass nameplate labeling my regular bar stool... Lucky 13 cares.
author: jen s.

description: I love the logo, and I love the bar. It's chill fun, and the drinks aren't over price. at least when I am here. I don't have to really worry about some guy with a flipped up collar or some yuppie chick complaining about their trouble they had trying to force their boyfriend to marry them.
author: Mike h.

description: new favorite bar. they played the avengers, murder city devils, and the descendents AND only charged $4 for a whiskey sour!? insane.
author: Rebecca M.

description: awesome atmosphere. awesome jukebox. pbr. and i've always coveted a sweatshirt...
author: Dean E.

description: my new favorite bar. large beer selection. good jukebox. the bartenders are always friendly. pool table and patio. even free popcorn.
author: Daniel N.

description: great place to meet up with friends, indoor and outdoor avail.  great jukebox, games (pool table, video games)upstairs and downstairs.  central location for other destinations after.  2bathroom stalls avail. in ladies room too.
author: andria p.

description: For my very first time in San Fransisco my goals were to one hit up Castro and two find an awesome dive bar. I am proud to say I accomplished both of my goals. Lucky 13 was something we stumbled across and after talking to Jeff the doorman off we went. We discovered that this bar was very decently priced on there drinks and my husband and brother in law enjoyed the pool table. I loved everything about this place met alot of awesome people and even had the pleasure of meeting pappy lol. BUT all good things must come to an end and I soon found that the people whole came to this bar were def extremely nice.I had not been out or drank in over a year due to just having a baby in august.WEELLLL I also found that the bathroom floor wasn't that uncomfortable lol.I want to thank the ladies that helped me out in my terrible state and found my husband for me lol.I truly recommend this place if you are in the area.JUST DONT DRINK TO MUCH
author: jodi l.

description: everytime i come here, i end up having a killer time.  cheap drinks, cool, fast bartenders, loud music, a lot of action going on outside.  perfect dive bar venue.  they even have one of those photo booth thingys so u can always remember those special drunken moments...awww.
author: Jedimaster J.

description: like dark bars? head here!!, it moody, fun and downright one helluva dive bar - superb !
author: Stuart g.
